{632, 0} If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN, the UE shall, if the UE is attached for non-EPS services only and timer T3242 or timer T3243 is running, perform a combined attach procedure.

{639, 0} In this subclause, the detailed behaviour of the UE in the states EMM-DEREGISTERED and EMM-REGISTERED is described.
---

{642, 0} The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the detach or combined detach is performed either by the UE or by the MME;
---

{642, 0} The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the attach request is rejected by the MME;
---

{642, 0} The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the tracking area update request is rejected by the MME;
---

{642, 0} The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the service request procedure is rejected by the MME;
---

{642, 0} The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the UE deactivates all EPS bearer contexts locally;
---

{642, 0} The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the UE is switched on;
---

{642, 0} The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, an inter-system change from S1 mode to non3GPP access is completed and the non3GPP access network provides PDN connectivity to the same EPC;
---

{642, 0} The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the UE attached for emergency bearer services is in EMM-IDLE mode and its periodic tracking area update timer expires.
---

{651, 0} In state EMM-DEREGISTERED, the UE shall behave according to the substate as explained in subclause 5.2.2.3.
---

{654, 0} For a UE configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17], timers T3444 and T3445 are considered to have expired at power on.

{654, 2} See 3GPP TS 23.122 [6] for further details.

{655, 0} The substate chosen after PLMN-SEARCH, following power on is:
{656, 0} if no cell can be selected, the substate shall be NO-CELL-AVAILABLE;

{658, 0} if a suitable cell has been found and the PLMN or tracking area is not in the forbidden list, then the substate shall be NORMAL-SERVICE;

{659, 0} if the selected cell is known not to be able to provide normal service, then the UE shall enter the substate LIMITED-SERVICE;

{661, 0} if the selected cell is a non-3GPP cell, the substate shall be NO-CELL-AVAILABLE;

{672, 0} The UE, shall use requests for non-EPS services for non-emergency call from CM layers to trigger a combined attach procedure, if timer T3346 is not running, or to attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN radio access technology and proceed with the appropriate MM and CC specific procedures;
---

{672, 0} The UE, shall use requests for non-EPS services for emergency call from CM layers to attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN radio access technology and proceed with the appropriate MM and CC specific procedures;
---

{672, 0} The UE, may initiate an attach procedure upon receiving a request from upper layers to transmit user data related to an exceptional event and the UE is allowed to use exception data reporting if timer T3346 is not already running for "MO exception data" and even if timer T3402 or timer T3411 is running;
---

{672, 0} The UE, may initiate an attach procedure upon request of the upper layers to establish a PDN connection for emergency bearer services;
---

{672, 0} The UE, may initiate an attach procedure upon request of the upper layers to establish a PDN connection for RLOS, if timer T3346 is not running.

{703, 1} The UE then uses the relevant EMM and ESM procedures to establish the eCall over IMS at the earliest opportunity;

{704, 1} Once the attach procedure is completed, the UE uses the relevant EMM and ESM procedures to establish the non-emergency call.
---

{706, 0} When returning to state EMM-DEREGISTERED, the UE shall select a cell as specified in 3GPP TS 36.304 [21].

{707, 0} The substate depends on the result of the cell selection procedure, the outcome of the previously performed EMM specific procedures, on the EPS update status of the UE, on the tracking area data stored in the UE, on the presence of the USIM, on the UE configuration and on the reason for moving to EMM-DEREGISTERED:

{753, 0} The UE may enter this substate when it is in automatic network selection mode and the maximum allowed number of subsequently unsuccessful tracking area updating have been performed.
{753, 1} The UE may also enter this substate as a result of a tracking area update rejected by the network or as a result of a service request rejected by the network.

{783, 0} When the UE is in EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication and needs to transmit an initial NAS message, the UE shall request the lower layer to establish a RRC connection.
---

{783, 0} When the UE is in EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication and needs to transmit an initial NAS message, the UE shall request the lower layer to establish a RRC connection.
{783, 1} In this request to the lower layer the NAS shall provide to the lower layer the RRC establishment cause and the call type as specified in annex D of this specification and, for the case specified in subclause 5.6.1.2.2, shall also provide the initial NAS message, otherwise NAS may also provide the initial NAS message.
---

{791, 0} When the UE is in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall proceed the behaviour as specified in subclauses 5.3.1.3.
---

{792, 0} For the routing of the initial NAS message to the appropriate MME, the UE NAS provides the lower layers with either the S-TMSI, the registered globally unique MME identifier that consists of the PLMN ID, the MME group ID, and the MME code, or none of them according to the following rules:
{793, 0} If the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" from the network, the UE holds a valid 5G-GUTI and, the UE performs an initial EPS attach procedure or tracking area updating procedure following an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode;
---

{792, 0} For the routing of the initial NAS message to the appropriate MME, the UE NAS provides the lower layers with either the S-TMSI, the registered globally unique MME identifier that consists of the PLMN ID, the MME group ID, and the MME code, or none of them according to the following rules:
{793, 0} If the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" from the network, the UE holds a valid 5G-GUTI and, the UE which was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED, performs an initial EPS attach procedure,
---

{792, 0} For the routing of the initial NAS message to the appropriate MME, the UE NAS provides the lower layers with either the S-TMSI, the registered globally unique MME identifier that consists of the PLMN ID, the MME group ID, and the MME code, or none of them according to the following rules:
{793, 0} If the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" from the network, the UE holds a valid 5G-GUTI and, then the UE NAS shall provide the lower layers with the MME identifier part of the mapped GUTI, which is generated from the 5G-GUTI as specified in 3GPP TS 23.003 [4], an indication that the identifier is a native GUMMEI and an indication that the identifier is mapped from 5GS;
---

{792, 0} For the routing of the initial NAS message to the appropriate MME, the UE NAS provides the lower layers with either the S-TMSI, the registered globally unique MME identifier that consists of the PLMN ID, the MME group ID, and the MME code, or none of them according to the following rules:
{797, 0} If the TIN indicates "GUTI" or "RAT-related TMSI", or the TIN is not available, and the UE holds a valid GUTI:
{798, 0} When the UE in EMM-IDLE mode initiates a tracking area updating or combined tracking area updating procedure for load balancing purposes, the UE NAS shall provide the lower layers with neither S-TMSI nor registered MME identifier;
---

{792, 0} For the routing of the initial NAS message to the appropriate MME, the UE NAS provides the lower layers with either the S-TMSI, the registered globally unique MME identifier that consists of the PLMN ID, the MME group ID, and the MME code, or none of them according to the following rules:
{797, 0} If the TIN indicates "GUTI" or "RAT-related TMSI", or the TIN is not available, and the UE holds a valid GUTI:
{799, 0} When the tracking area of the current cell is in the list of tracking areas that the UE previously registered in the MME during the NAS signalling connection establishment, the UE NAS shall provide the lower layers with the S-TMSI, but shall not provide the registered MME identifier to the lower layers;
---

{792, 0} For the routing of the initial NAS message to the appropriate MME, the UE NAS provides the lower layers with either the S-TMSI, the registered globally unique MME identifier that consists of the PLMN ID, the MME group ID, and the MME code, or none of them according to the following rules:
{797, 0} If the TIN indicates "GUTI" or "RAT-related TMSI", or the TIN is not available, and the UE holds a valid GUTI:
{800, 0} When the tracking area of the current cell is not in the list of tracking areas that the UE previously registered in the MME during the NAS signalling connection establishment, the UE NAS shall provide the lower layers with the MME identifier part of the valid GUTI with an indication that the identifier is a native GUMMEI.
---

{792, 0} For the routing of the initial NAS message to the appropriate MME, the UE NAS provides the lower layers with either the S-TMSI, the registered globally unique MME identifier that consists of the PLMN ID, the MME group ID, and the MME code, or none of them according to the following rules:
{801, 0} If the TIN indicates "P-TMSI", or the TIN is not available, and the UE holds a valid P-TMSI and RAI, the UE NAS shall provide the lower layers with the MME identifier part of the mapped GUTI, which is generated from the P-TMSI and RAI with an indication that the identifier is a mapped GUMMEI;
---

{792, 0} For the routing of the initial NAS message to the appropriate MME, the UE NAS provides the lower layers with either the S-TMSI, the registered globally unique MME identifier that consists of the PLMN ID, the MME group ID, and the MME code, or none of them according to the following rules:
{802, 0} Otherwise, the UE NAS does not provide the lower layers with the S-TMSI, the registered GUMMEI and the mapped GUMMEI.
---

{803, 0} The UE NAS also provides the lower layers with the identity of the selected PLMN.
---

{803, 0} The UE NAS also provides the lower layers with the identity of the selected PLMN.
{803, 1} In a shared network, the UE shall choose one of the PLMN identities as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{804, 0} When an ATTACH REQUEST message, or a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message when the TAI of the current cell is not included in the TAI list, is sent to establish a signalling connection, the UE NAS also provides the lower layers with the DCN-ID according to the following rules:
{805, 0} if a DCN-ID for the PLMN code of the selected PLMN is available in the UE, the UE NAS shall provide this DCN-ID to the lower layers;
---

{804, 0} When an ATTACH REQUEST message, or a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message when the TAI of the current cell is not included in the TAI list, is sent to establish a signalling connection, the UE NAS also provides the lower layers with the DCN-ID according to the following rules:
{806, 0} if no DCN-ID for the PLMN code of the selected PLMN is available but a Default_DCN_ID value is avaialble in the UE, as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [15A] or in USIM file NASCONFIG as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17], the UE NAS shall provide this DCN-ID to the lower layers.
---

{807, 0} If a relay node is attaching for relay node operation, the NAS in the relay node shall indicate to the lower layers that the establishment of the NAS signalling connection is for a relay node.
---

{808, 0} In S1 mode, when the RRC connection has been established successfully, the UE shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode and consider the NAS signalling connection established.
---

{809, 0} In S101 mode, when the cdma2000® HRPD access network resources are available for tunnelled NAS signalling, the UE shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode and consider the S101 mode NAS signalling connection established.
---

{812, 0} The signalling procedure for the release of the NAS signalling connection is initiated by the network.
---

{813, 0} In S1 mode, when the RRC connection has been released, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode and consider the NAS signalling connection released.
---

{814, 0} If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] then, if the NAS signalling connection that was released had been established for eCall over IMS, the UE shall start timer T3444;
---

{814, 0} If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] then, if the NAS signalling connection that was released had been established for a call to an HPLMN designated non-emergency MSISDN or URI for test or terminal reconfiguration service, the UE shall start timer T3445.
---

{817, 0} The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 with the service gap time value available in the UE when the NAS signalling connection is released if, the UE supports SGC feature, and the service gap timer value is available in the UE and does not indicate zero;
---

{817, 0} The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 with the service gap time value available in the UE when the NAS signalling connection is released if, the NAS signalling connection that was released had been established for mobile originated request for transfer of uplink data.
---

{820, 0} If the UE receives the "Extended wait time" from the lower layers when no attach, tracking area updating or service request procedure is ongoing, the UE shall ignore the "Extended wait time".
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives any of the EMM cause values #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #25, #31 or #35;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message which does not include a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the UE has not set the "active" flag in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the UE has not set the "signalling active" flag in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the tracking area updating or combined tracking area updating procedure has been initiated in EMM-IDLE mode;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the user plane radio bearers have not been set up;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a DETACH ACCEPT message and the UE has set the detach type to "IMSI detach" in the DETACH REQUEST message and user plane radio bearers have not been set up;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message indicating, any of the EMM cause values #9 or #10 and the UE has no CS fallback emergency call, CS fallback call, 1xCS fallback emergency call, or 1xCS fallback call pending;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message indicating, the EMM cause values #40, the TRACKING AREA UPDATE message was not triggered due to receiving a paging for CS fallback or a paging for 1xCS fallback, and the UE has no CS fallback emergency call, CS fallback call, 1xCS fallback emergency call, or 1xCS fallback call pending;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message indicating any of the EMM cause values #9, #10 or #40 as a response to a SERVICE REQUEST message CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message, or an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message with service type set to "packet services via S1";
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, may start the timer T3440 if the UE receives any of the EMM cause values #3, #6, #7 or #8 or if it receives an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message indicating the EMM cause value #39 and the UE has initiated EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST in EMM-IDLE and the user plane radio bearers have not been set up;
---

{821, 0} To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT, SERVICE ACCEPT, ATTACH ACCEPT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message with control plane data back-off timer.
---

{837, 0} Upon expiry of T3440, in cases a, b, c, f and h, the UE shall locally release the established NAS signalling connection;
---

{837, 0} Upon expiry of T3440, in cases d and e, the UE shall locally release the established NAS signalling connection and the UE shall initiate the attach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.3.2.5, 5.5.3.3.5 or 5.6.1.5.
---

{840, 0} In cases b, c and g, upon an indication from the lower layers that the user plane radio bearers are set up, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and may send uplink signalling via the existing NAS signalling connection or user data via the user plane bearers.
---

{840, 0} In cases b, c and g, upon an indication from the lower layers that the user plane radio bearers are set up, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and may send uplink signalling via the existing NAS signalling connection or user data via the user plane bearers.
{841, 1} If the uplink signalling is for CS fallback for emergency call, or for establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall send the uplink signalling via the existing NAS signalling connection;
---

{840, 0} In cases b, c and g, upon receipt of a DETACH REQUEST message, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and respond to the network initiated detach as specified in subclause 5.5.2.3.
---

{843, 0} In case b, upon receiving a request from upper layers to send NAS signalling not associated with establishing either a CS emergency call or a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall wait for the the local release of the established NAS signalling connection upon expiry of timer T3440 or T3440 being stopped before proceeding;
---

{843, 0} In case b, upon receiving a request from upper layers to establish either a CS emergency call or a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and shall locally release the NAS signalling connection, before proceeding as specified in subclause 5.6.1;
---

{843, 0} In case b, upon receipt of ESM DATA TRANSPORT message, as an implementation option, the UE may reset and restart timer T3440;
---

{843, 0} In case b, upon receipt of a DOWNLINK NAS TRANSPORT or DOWNLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message, the UE which is in EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connections shall stop timer T3440 and may send uplink signalling via the existing NAS signalling connection;
---

{843, 0} In case b, upon receipt of an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST, MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST, DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST, DOWNLINK NAS TRANSPORT or DOWNLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message, if the UE is using control plane CIoT EPS optimization, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and may send uplink signalling via the existing NAS signalling connection.
---

{849, 0} In case c, upon receiving a request from upper layers to send NAS signalling not associated with establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall wait for the the local release of the established NAS signalling connection upon expiry of timer T3440 or T3440 being stopped before proceeding;
---

{849, 0} In case c, upon receiving a request from upper layers to establish a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and shall locally release the NAS signalling connection, before proceeding as specified in subclause 5.6.1.
---

{852, 0} In cases d and e, upon an indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been released, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and perform a new attach procedure as specified in subclause 5.5.3.2.5, 5.5.3.3.5 or 5.6.1.5;
---

{852, 0} In cases d and e, upon receiving a request from upper layers to establish a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and shall locally release the NAS signalling connection, before proceeding as specified in subclause 5.5.1.
---

{855, 0} In cases a and f, upon receiving a request from upper layers to establish a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and shall locally release the NAS signalling connection, before proceeding as specified in subclause 5.5.1.
---

{857, 0} In case g, upon receiving a request from upper layers to send NAS signalling not associated with establishing either a CS emergency call or a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall wait for the the local release of the established NAS signalling connection upon expiry of timer T3440 or T3440 being stopped before proceeding;
---

{857, 0} In case g, upon receiving a request from upper layers to establish either a CS emergency call or a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall stop timer T3440 and shall locally release the NAS signalling connection, before proceeding as specified in subclause 5.6.1.

{860, 0} In case h, upon an indication from the lower layers that the user plane radio bearers are set up or upon receiving a request from upper layers to send NAS signalling not associated with ESM DATA TRANSPORT, the UE shall stop timer T3440;
---

{860, 0} In case h, the UE shall not send ESM DATA TRANSPORT message until expiry of timer T3440 or times T3440 being stopped.

{863, 0} In EMM-CONNECTED mode, if the UE moves to EMM-SERVICE-REQUEST-INITIATED state upon receipt of a CS SERVICE NOTIFICATION message, the UE shall stop timer T3440.

{864, 0} In S101 mode, when the cdma2000® HRPD radio access connection has been released, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode and consider the S101 mode NAS signalling connection released.

{868, 0} Suspend of the NAS signalling connection can be initiated by the network in EMM-CONNECTED mode when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used.
---

{868, 0} Suspend of the NAS signalling connection can be initiated by the network in EMM-CONNECTED mode when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used.
{868, 1} Resume of the suspended NAS signalling connection is initiated by the UE.

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{870, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been suspended, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, shall not consider the NAS signalling connection released and shall not consider the secure exchange of NAS messages terminated.
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{870, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been suspended, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, shall not consider the NAS signalling connection released and shall not consider the secure exchange of NAS messages terminated.
{870, 1} Based on further indications provided by the lower layers, the UE shall update the status of the suspend indication for the EMM-IDLE mode;
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{871, 0} Upon trigger of a procedure using an initial NAS message when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall, if the initial NAS message is a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message which includes a UE radio capability information update needed IE, enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication and proceed with the tracking area updating procedure;
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{871, 0} Upon trigger of a procedure using an initial NAS message when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall, otherwise, request the lower layer to resume the RRC connection.
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{871, 0} Upon trigger of a procedure using an initial NAS message when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall, otherwise, request the lower layer to resume the RRC connection.
{873, 1} In this request to the lower layer the NAS shall provide to the lower layer the RRC establishment cause and the call type according to annex D of this document;
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{874, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been resumed when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode.
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{874, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been resumed when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode.
{874, 1} If the pending NAS message is, a SERVICE REQUEST message;
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{874, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been resumed when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode.
{874, 1} If the pending NAS message is, a CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message, and the UE did not include any ESM message container, NAS message container or EPS bearer context status information elements;
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{874, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been resumed when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode.
{874, 1} If the pending NAS message is, an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message, and the Service type information element indicates "packet services via S1" and the UE did not include any EPS bearer context status information element,
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{874, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been resumed when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode.
{874, 1} If the pending NAS message is, the message shall not be sent.
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{874, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been resumed when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode.
{874, 1} If the pending NAS message is, the message shall not be sent.
{878, 1} Otherwise the UE shall cipher the message as specified in subclause 4.4.5 and send the pending initial NAS message upon entering EMM-CONNECTED mode;
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{879, 0} Upon fallback indication from the lower layers at RRC connection resume when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication, send any pending initial NAS message and proceed as if RRC connection establishment had been requested;
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{880, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection resume has failed and indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection is suspended, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication and restart the ongoing NAS procedure if required;
---

{869, 0} In the UE, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{881, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection resume has failed and indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection is not suspended, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication and restart the ongoing NAS procedure if required.
---

{882, 0} In the network, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{883, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been suspended, the network shall enter EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, shall not consider the NAS signalling connection released and shall not consider the secure exchange of NAS messages terminated;
---

{882, 0} In the network, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{884, 0} Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection has been resumed when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the network shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode.

{882, 0} In the network, when user plane CIoT EPS optimization is used:
{885, 0} For the case that not all suspended bearers are resumed, see subclause 6.4.4.6.

{887, 0} The UE shall store a list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming", as well as a list of "forbidden tracking areas for regional provision of service".

{887, 0} The UE shall store a list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming", as well as a list of "forbidden tracking areas for regional provision of service".
{887, 1} These lists shall be erased when the UE is switched off or when the UICC containing the USIM is removed, and periodically.
{887, 2} When the lists are erased, the UE performs cell selection according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21].

{887, 0} The UE shall store a list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming", as well as a list of "forbidden tracking areas for regional provision of service".
{887, 1} These lists shall be erased when the UE is switched off or when the UICC containing the USIM is removed, and periodically.
{887, 2} When the lists are erased, the UE performs cell selection according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21].
{887, 3} One or more tracking areas is removed from the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" in the UE, as well as the list of "forbidden tracking areas for regional provision of service" if, after a subsequent procedure e.g. attach procedure, tracking area updating procedure and GUTI reallocation procedure, one or more tracking areas in the lists is received from the network.

{887, 0} The UE shall store a list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming", as well as a list of "forbidden tracking areas for regional provision of service".
{887, 1} These lists shall be erased when the UE is switched off or when the UICC containing the USIM is removed, and periodically.
{887, 2} When the lists are erased, the UE performs cell selection according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21].
{887, 3} One or more tracking areas is removed from the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" in the UE, as well as the list of "forbidden tracking areas for regional provision of service" if, after a subsequent procedure e.g. attach procedure, tracking area updating procedure and GUTI reallocation procedure, one or more tracking areas in the lists is received from the network.
{887, 4} If the UE has only one PDN connection established which is for emergency bearer services, the tracking areas shall not be removed from these lists if one or more tracking areas in the lists are received from the network.

{888, 0} In S1 mode, the UE shall update the suitable list whenever an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT, SERVICE REJECT or DETACH REQUEST message is received with the EMM cause #12 "tracking area not allowed", #13 "roaming not allowed in this tracking area", or #15 "no suitable cells in tracking area".

{889, 0} Each list shall accommodate 40 or more TAIs.
---

{889, 0} Each list shall accommodate 40 or more TAIs.
{889, 1} When the list is full and a new entry has to be inserted, the oldest entry shall be deleted.

{891, 1} The UE shall erase this list when the UE is switched off or when the USIM is removed.

{897, 1} These PLMNs shall be regarded by the UE as equivalent to each other for PLMN selection and cell selection/re-selection.

{897, 2} The same list is used by EMM, GMM and MM.

{898, 1} The stored list consists of a list of equivalent PLMNs as downloaded by the network plus the PLMN code of the registered PLMN that downloaded the list.

{898, 0} The UE shall update or delete this list at the end of each attach or combined attach or tracking area updating or combined tracking area updating procedure.

{898, 0} The UE shall update or delete this list at the end of each attach or combined attach or tracking area updating or combined tracking area updating procedure.

{898, 3} The UE shall delete the stored list if the USIM is removed or when the UE attached for emergency bearer services or access to RLOS enters the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.

{898, 0} The UE shall update or delete this list at the end of each attach or combined attach or tracking area updating or combined tracking area updating procedure.
{898, 1} The stored list consists of a list of equivalent PLMNs as downloaded by the network plus the PLMN code of the registered PLMN that downloaded the list.
{898, 2} When the UE is switched off, it shall keep the stored list so that it can be used for PLMN selection after switch on.

{898, 4} The maximum number of possible entries in the stored list is 16.

{900, 0} The periodic tracking area updating procedure is used to periodically notify the availability of the UE to the network.
---

{900, 0} The periodic tracking area updating procedure is used to periodically notify the availability of the UE to the network.
{900, 1} The procedure is controlled in the UE by timer T3412.
---

{900, 0} The periodic tracking area updating procedure is used to periodically notify the availability of the UE to the network.
{900, 1} The procedure is controlled in the UE by timer T3412.
{900, 2} The value of timer T3412 is sent by the network to the UE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message and can be sent in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message.
---

{900, 0} The periodic tracking area updating procedure is used to periodically notify the availability of the UE to the network.
{900, 1} The procedure is controlled in the UE by timer T3412.
{900, 2} The value of timer T3412 is sent by the network to the UE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message and can be sent in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message.
{900, 3} The UE shall apply this value in all tracking areas of the list of tracking areas assigned to the UE until a new value is received.
---

{901, 0} If timer T3412 received by the UE in an ATTACH ACCEPT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contains an indication that the timer is deactivated or the timer value is zero, then timer T3412 is deactivated and the UE shall not perform the periodic tracking area updating procedure.
---

{902, 0} Timer T3412 is reset and started with its initial value, when the UE changes from EMM-CONNECTED to EMM-IDLE mode.
---

{902, 0} Timer T3412 is reset and started with its initial value, when the UE changes from EMM-CONNECTED to EMM-IDLE mode.
{902, 1} Timer T3412 is stopped when the UE enters EMM-CONNECTED mode or the EMM-DEREGISTERED state.
---

{903, 0} If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, and timer T3412 expires, the UE shall not initiate a periodic tracking area updating procedure, but shall locally detach from the network.
---

{903, 0} If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, and timer T3412 expires, the UE shall not initiate a periodic tracking area updating procedure, but shall locally detach from the network.
{903, 1} When the UE is camping on a suitable cell, it may re-attach to regain normal service.
---

{904, 0} When a UE is not attached for emergency bearer services, and timer T3412 expires, the periodic tracking area updating procedure shall be started and the timer shall be set to its initial value for the next start.
---

{905, 0} If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services, and is in a state other than EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE when timer T3412 expires, the periodic tracking area updating procedure is delayed until the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
---

{906, 1} The two separate timers run in the UE for updating MME and SGSN independently.

{906, 1} The two separate timers run in the UE for updating MME and SGSN independently.

{907, 0} EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE;

{909, 0} EMM-REGISTERED.UPDATE-NEEDED;

{911, 0} The UE shall initiate the tracking area updating procedure and stop timer T3423 when it enters state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE before timer T3423 expires.
---

{911, 0} The UE shall initiate the tracking area updating procedure and stop timer T3423 when it enters state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE before timer T3423 expires.
{911, 1} After expiry of timer T3423 the UE shall set its TIN to "P-TMSI".

{912, 0} If timer T3423 expires the UE shall memorize that it has to initiate a tracking area updating procedure when it returns to state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
---

{913, 0} If the UE is attached to both EPS and non-EPS services, and if timer T3412 expires or timer T3423 expires when the UE is in EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE state, then the UE shall initiate the combined tracking area updating procedure indicating "combined TA/LA updating with IMSI attach" when the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state.
---

{914, 0} When the network includes T3412 extended value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the network uses timer T3412 extended value IE as the value of timer T3412.
---

{915, 0} The network supervises the periodic tracking area updating procedure of the UE by means of the mobile reachable timer.
---

{916, 0} If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services, the mobile reachable timer shall be longer than T3412.
---

{916, 0} If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services, the mobile reachable timer shall be longer than T3412.
{916, 1} In this case, by default, the mobile reachable timer is 4 minutes greater than timer T3412.
---

{917, 0} If ISR is not activated, the network behaviour upon expiry of the mobile reachable timer is network dependent, but typically the network stops sending paging messages to the UE on the first expiry, and may take other appropriate actions.
---

{918, 0} If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, the MME shall set the mobile reachable timer with a value equal to timer T3412.
---

{918, 0} If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, the MME shall set the mobile reachable timer with a value equal to timer T3412.
{918, 1} When the mobile reachable timer expires, the MME shall locally detach the UE.
---

{919, 0} The mobile reachable timer shall be reset and started with the value as indicated above, when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE.
---

{919, 0} The mobile reachable timer shall be reset and started with the value as indicated above, when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE.
{919, 1} The mobile reachable timer shall be stopped when a NAS signalling connection is established for the UE.
---

{920, 0} Upon expiry of the mobile reachable timer the network shall start the implicit detach timer.
---

{920, 0} Upon expiry of the mobile reachable timer the network shall start the implicit detach timer.
{920, 1} The value of the implicit detach timer is network dependent.
---

{920, 0} Upon expiry of the mobile reachable timer the network shall start the implicit detach timer.
{920, 1} The value of the implicit detach timer is network dependent.
{920, 2} If ISR is activated, the default value of the implicit detach timer is 4 minutes greater than timer T3423.
---

{920, 0} Upon expiry of the mobile reachable timer the network shall start the implicit detach timer.
{920, 1} The value of the implicit detach timer is network dependent.
{920, 2} If ISR is activated, the default value of the implicit detach timer is 4 minutes greater than timer T3423.
{920, 3} If the implicit detach timer expires before the UE contacts the network, the network shall implicitly detach the UE.
---

{920, 0} Upon expiry of the mobile reachable timer the network shall start the implicit detach timer.
{920, 1} The value of the implicit detach timer is network dependent.
{920, 2} If ISR is activated, the default value of the implicit detach timer is 4 minutes greater than timer T3423.
{920, 3} If the implicit detach timer expires before the UE contacts the network, the network shall implicitly detach the UE.
{920, 4} If the MME includes timer T3346 in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message or the SERVICE REJECT message and timer T3346 is greater than timer T3412, the MME sets the mobile reachable timer and the implicit detach timer such that the sum of the timer values is greater than timer T3346.
---

{921, 0} If the network includes the T3324 value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message,and if the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services and has no PDN connection for emergency bearer services the MME shall set the active timer to a value equal to the value of timer T3324.
---

{922, 0} If the UE has established a PDN connection for emergency services after receiving the timer T3324 value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the last TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the active timer shall not be started.
---

{923, 0} The active timer shall be reset and started with the value as indicated above, when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE.
---

{923, 0} The active timer shall be reset and started with the value as indicated above, when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE.
{923, 1} The active timer shall be stopped when an NAS signalling connection is established for the UE.
---

{924, 0} The network behaviour upon expiry of the active timer is network dependent, but typically the network stops sending paging messages to the UE on the first expiry, and may take other appropriate actions.
---

{925, 0} The implicit detach timer shall be stopped when a NAS signalling connection is established for the UE.
---

{927, 0} The value of timer T3402 can be sent by the network to the UE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message and TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message.
---

{927, 0} The value of timer T3402 can be sent by the network to the UE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message and TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message.
{927, 1} If the value is different from "deactivated", the UE shall apply this value in all tracking areas of the list of tracking areas assigned to the UE, until a new value is received.
---

{928, 0} The value of timer T3402 can be sent by the network to the UE in the ATTACH REJECT message.
---

{928, 0} The value of timer T3402 can be sent by the network to the UE in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{928, 1} If an ATTACH REJECT message including timer T3402 value different from "deactivated", was received integrity protected, the UE shall apply this value until a new value is received with integrity protection or a new PLMN is selected.
---

{928, 0} The value of timer T3402 can be sent by the network to the UE in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{928, 1} If an ATTACH REJECT message including timer T3402 value different from "deactivated", was received integrity protected, the UE shall apply this value until a new value is received with integrity protection or a new PLMN is selected.
{928, 2} Otherwise, the default value of this timer is used.
---

{929, 0} The default value of T3402 is also used by the UE if:
{930, 0} ATTACH ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message is received without a value specified;
---

{929, 0} The default value of T3402 is also used by the UE if, the network indicates that the timer is "deactivated";
---

{929, 0} The default value of T3402 is also used by the UE if, the UE does not have a stored value for this timer;
---

{929, 0} The default value of T3402 is also used by the UE if, a new PLMN which is not in the list of equivalent PLMNs has been entered, the tracking area updating fails and the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5;
---

{929, 0} The default value of T3402 is also used by the UE if, a new PLMN which is not in the list of equivalent PLMNs has been entered, the attach procedure fails, the attach attempt counter is equal to 5 and no ATTACH REJECT message was received from the new PLMN.
---

{936, 0} The Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers list contain additional local emergency numbers used by the serving network.
---

{936, 0} The Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers list contain additional local emergency numbers used by the serving network.
{936, 1} These lists can be downloaded by the network to the UE at successful registration and subsequent registration updates.
---

{936, 0} The Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers list contain additional local emergency numbers used by the serving network.
{936, 1} These lists can be downloaded by the network to the UE at successful registration and subsequent registration updates.
{936, 2} There is only one Local Emergency Numbers List and only one Extended Local Emergency Numbers list in the UE.
---

{936, 0} The Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers list contain additional local emergency numbers used by the serving network.
{936, 1} These lists can be downloaded by the network to the UE at successful registration and subsequent registration updates.
{936, 2} There is only one Local Emergency Numbers List and only one Extended Local Emergency Numbers list in the UE.
{936, 3} The Local Emergency Numbers List can be updated with EMM procedures if the UE is in S1 mode, with GMM and MM procedures if the UE is in A/Gb or Iu mode, and with 5GMM procedures, as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54], if UE is in N1 mode.
---

{936, 0} The Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers list contain additional local emergency numbers used by the serving network.
{936, 1} These lists can be downloaded by the network to the UE at successful registration and subsequent registration updates.
{936, 2} There is only one Local Emergency Numbers List and only one Extended Local Emergency Numbers list in the UE.
{936, 3} The Local Emergency Numbers List can be updated with EMM procedures if the UE is in S1 mode, with GMM and MM procedures if the UE is in A/Gb or Iu mode, and with 5GMM procedures, as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54], if UE is in N1 mode.
{936, 4} The Extended Local Emergency Numbers List can be updated with EMM procedures if the UE is in S1 mode and with 5GMM procedures, as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54], if UE is in N1 mode.
---

{937, 0} The UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List and the stored Extended Local Emergency Numbers List received from the network in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM or user equipment to detect that the number dialled is an emergency number.
---

{938, 0} If the UE determines that the number dialled is an emergency number, the procedures specified in 3GPP TS 23.167 [45] and 3GPP TS 24.229 [13D] are utilised to select a domain for the emergency session attempt.
---

{939, 0} If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the PS domain, then the UE shall perform the session establishment procedures specified in 3GPP TS 24.229 [13D] to initiate an emergency session.
---

{940, 0} If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the CS domain, then the UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List, in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM and the ME, to determine if, the UE is to send an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message, for CS fallback, indicating "mobile originating CS fallback or 1xCS fallback";
---

{940, 0} If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the CS domain, then the UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List, in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM and the ME, to determine if, the UE is to send an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message, for CS fallback for emergency call, indicating "mobile originating CS fallback emergency call or 1xCS fallback emergency call";
---

{940, 0} If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the CS domain, then the UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List, in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM and the ME, to determine if, the call control entity of the UE specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] is to send an EMERGENCY SETUP message or a SETUP message to the network.
---

{945, 0} The network may send a Local Emergency Numbers List or an Extended Local Emergency Numbers List or both, in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT messages, by including the Emergency number list IE and the Extended emergency number list IE, respectively.
---

{945, 1} The user equipment shall store the Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers List, as provided by the network.
---

{945, 0} The network may send a Local Emergency Numbers List or an Extended Local Emergency Numbers List or both, in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT messages, by including the Emergency number list IE and the Extended emergency number list IE, respectively.
{945, 1} The user equipment shall store the Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers List, as provided by the network.
{945, 2} The Local Emergency Numbers List stored in the user equipment shall be replaced on each receipt of the Emergency number list IE.
---

{945, 0} The network may send a Local Emergency Numbers List or an Extended Local Emergency Numbers List or both, in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT messages, by including the Emergency number list IE and the Extended emergency number list IE, respectively.

{945, 2} The Local Emergency Numbers List stored in the user equipment shall be replaced on each receipt of the Emergency number list IE.
{945, 3} The Extended Local Emergency Numbers List stored in the user equipment shall be replaced on each receipt of the Extended emergency number list IE.

{945, 0} The network may send a Local Emergency Numbers List or an Extended Local Emergency Numbers List or both, in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT messages, by including the Emergency number list IE and the Extended emergency number list IE, respectively.
{945, 1} The user equipment shall store the Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers List, as provided by the network.
{945, 2} The Local Emergency Numbers List stored in the user equipment shall be replaced on each receipt of the Emergency number list IE.
{945, 3} The Extended Local Emergency Numbers List stored in the user equipment shall be replaced on each receipt of the Extended emergency number list IE.
{945, 4} The received Local Emergency Numbers List or the received Extended Local Emergency Numbers list or both shall be provided to the upper layers.
---

{946, 0} The emergency number received in the Emergency number list IE are valid only in networks in the same country as the PLMN from which this IE is received.
---

{946, 0} The emergency number received in the Emergency number list IE are valid only in networks in the same country as the PLMN from which this IE is received.
{946, 1} If no Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, then the stored Local Emergency Numbers List in the user equipment shall be kept, except if the user equipment has successfully registered to a PLMN in a country different from that of the PLMN that sent the list.
---

{947, 0} The emergency number received in the Extended emergency number list IE are valid only in, networks in the same country as the PLMN from which this IE is received, if the Extended Emergency Number List Validity field within the Extended emergency number list IE indicates "Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid in the country of the PLMN from which this IE is received";
---

{947, 0} The emergency number received in the Extended emergency number list IE are valid only in, the PLMN from which this IE is received, if the EENLV field within the Extended emergency number list IE indicates "Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid only in the PLMN from which this IE is received".
---

{950, 0} If no Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, and the registered PLMN has not changed, then the stored Extended Local Emergency Numbers List in the user equipment shall be kept.
---

{950, 0} If no Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, and the registered PLMN has not changed, then the stored Extended Local Emergency Numbers List in the user equipment shall be kept.
{950, 1} If no Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, but the registered PLMN has changed, then, if the last received indication in the EENLV field within the Extended emergency number list IE indicates "Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid only in the PLMN from which this IE is received", the stored Extended Local Emergency Numbers List in the user equipment shall be deleted;
---

{950, 0} If no Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, and the registered PLMN has not changed, then the stored Extended Local Emergency Numbers List in the user equipment shall be kept.
{950, 1} If no Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, but the registered PLMN has changed, then, if the last received indication in the EENLV field within the Extended emergency number list IE indicates "Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid in the country of the PLMN from which this IE is received" the list shall be kept except if the user equipment has successfully registered to a PLMN in a country different from that of the PLMN that sent the list.
---

{953, 0} The Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers List shall be deleted at switch off and removal of the USIM.
---

{953, 0} The Local Emergency Numbers List and the Extended Local Emergency Numbers List shall be deleted at switch off and removal of the USIM.
{953, 1} The user equipment shall be able to store up to ten entries in the Local Emergency Numbers List and up to twenty entries in the Extended Local Emergency Numbers List, received from the network.
---

{955, 0} The following requirement applies for an UE that is configured to use timer T3245:
---

{956, 0} When the UE adds a PLMN identity to the "forbidden PLMN list", the "forbidden PLMNs for attach in S101 mode" list, or the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list or sets the USIM as invalid for non-EPS services or EPS services or both, and timer T3245 is not running, the UE shall start timer T3245 as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13], subclause 4.1.1.6.
---

{957, 0} Upon expiry of the timer T3245, the UE shall erase the "forbidden PLMN list", the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list, and the "forbidden PLMNs for attach in S101 mode" list and set the USIM to valid for non-EPS and EPS services.
---

{957, 0} Upon expiry of the timer T3245, the UE shall erase the "forbidden PLMN list", the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list, and the "forbidden PLMNs for attach in S101 mode" list and set the USIM to valid for non-EPS and EPS services.
{957, 1} When the lists are erased, the UE performs cell selection according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21].
---

{958, 0} If the UE is switched off when the timer T3245 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
{959, 0} let t1 be the time remaining for T3245 timeout at switch off and let t be the time elapsed between switch off and switch on.
---

{958, 0} If the UE is switched off when the timer T3245 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
{959, 0} let t1 be the time remaining for T3245 timeout at switch off and let t be the time elapsed between switch off and switch on.
{959, 1} If t1 is greater than t, then the timer shall be restarted with the value t1 – t. If t1 is equal to or less than t, then the UE will follow the behaviour as defined in the paragraph above upon expiry of the timer T3245.
---

{958, 0} If the UE is switched off when the timer T3245 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
{959, 0} let t1 be the time remaining for T3245 timeout at switch off and let t be the time elapsed between switch off and switch on.
{959, 1} If t1 is greater than t, then the timer shall be restarted with the value t1 – t. If t1 is equal to or less than t, then the UE will follow the behaviour as defined in the paragraph above upon expiry of the timer T3245.
{959, 2} If the UE is not capable of determining t, then the UE shall restart the timer with the value t1.
---

{961, 0} This subclause specifies the requirements for a UE that is not configured to use timer T3245 and receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with specific EMM causes.
---

{962, 0} The UE may maintain a list of PLMN-specific attempt counters and a list of PLMN-specific PS-attempt counters.
---

{962, 0} The UE may maintain a list of PLMN-specific attempt counters and a list of PLMN-specific PS-attempt counters.
{962, 1} The maximum number of possible entries in each list is implementation dependent.
---

{963, 0} Additionally, the UE may maintain one counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services" events and one counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events.
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and eKSI;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, delete the list of equivalent PLMNs;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, increment the counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services" and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, increment the counter;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, if an attach or tracking area updating procedure was performed, reset the attach attempt counter or the tracking area updating attempt counter, respectively;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, if A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, handle the GMM parameters GPRS attach attempt counter or routing area updating attempt counter, GMM state, GPRS update status, P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI, GPRS ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the GPRS attach or routing area updating procedure is rejected with the GMM cause of the same value in a NAS message without integrity protection;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall:
{973, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state, 5GS update status, 5G-GUTI, TAI list, ngKSI as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the case when the registration request procedure performed over 3GPP access is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value in a NAS message without integrity protection.
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming", memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message and enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, search for a suitable cell in another tracking area or in another location area according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21];
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, proceed as specified in subclauses 5.5.1, 5.5.3 and 5.6.1;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, increment the counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{964, 1} Additionally, the UE shall take the following actions:
{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services" and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation specific maximum value, increment the counter;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

{965, 0} if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and else the UE shall proceed as specified in subclauses 5.5.1, 5.5.3 and 5.6.1;
---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

{982, 2} Additionally, if an attach or tracking area updating procedure was performed, the UE shall reset the attach attempt counter or the tracking area updating attempt counter, respectively.

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

---

{964, 0} If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.

---

---
