{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall remove all tracking areas from the list of "forbidden tracking areas for regional provision of service" and the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming", which were stored in these lists for non-integrity protected NAS reject message;
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall set the USIM to valid for EPS services, if the UE does not maintain a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events;
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall set the USIM to valid for EPS services, if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and this counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value;
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall set the USIM to valid for non-EPS services, if the UE does not maintain a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services" events;
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall set the USIM to valid for non-EPS services, if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services" events and this counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value;
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall if the UE maintains a list of PLMN-specific attempt counters, for each PLMN-specific attempt counter that has a value greater than zero and less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, remove the respective PLMN from the forbidden PLMN list;
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall if the UE maintains a list of PLMN-specific PS-attempt counters, for each PLMN-specific PS-attempt counter that has a value greater than zero and less than a UE implementation-specifc maximum value, remove the respective PLMN from the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list.
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall if the UE maintains a list of PLMN-specific PS-attempt counters, for each PLMN-specific PS-attempt counter that has a value greater than zero and less than a UE implementation-specifc maximum value, remove the respective PLMN from the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list.
{1004, 1} If the resulting "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list is empty, the UE shall re-enable the E-UTRA capability;
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall if the UE is supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode, handle the list of "forbidden location areas for regional provision of service" and the list of "forbidden location areas for roaming" as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when timer T3247 expires;
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall if the UE is supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode and maintains a list of "forbidden location areas for non-GPRS services" and a list of "forbidden location areas for GPRS services", handle these lists as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when timer T3247 expires;
---

{995, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3247, the UE shall initiate an EPS attach procedure or tracking area updating procedure, if still needed, dependent on EMM state and EPS update status, or perform PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{1008, 0} If the UE maintains a list of PLMN-specific attempt counters and PLMN-specific PS-attempt counters, when the UE is switched off, the UE shall, for each PLMN-specific attempt counter that has a value greater than zero and less than the UE implementation-specific maximum value, remove the respective PLMN from the forbidden PLMN list.
---

{1008, 0} If the UE maintains a list of PLMN-specific attempt counters and PLMN-specific PS-attempt counters, when the UE is switched off, the UE shall, for each PLMN-specific attempt counter that has a value greater than zero and less than the UE implementation-specific maximum value, remove the respective PLMN from the forbidden PLMN list.
{1008, 1} When the USIM is removed, the UE should perform this action.
---

{1009, 0} The PLMN-specific attempt counter and the PLMN-specific PS-attempt counter shall be reset when the UICC containing the USIM is removed or the PLMN is added to a list of "forbidden PLMNs" in the USIM as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{1011, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{1012, 0} EMM uplink message transmission failure indication by lower layers
{1013, 0} When it is specified in the relevant procedure that it is up to the UE implementation to rerun the ongoing procedure that triggered that procedure, the procedure can typically be re-initiated using a retransmission mechanism of the uplink message with new sequence number and message authentication code information thus avoiding to restart the whole procedure.
---

{1015, 0} The network may detect EMM signalling congestion and perform NAS level mobility management congestion control.
---

{1015, 0} The network may detect EMM signalling congestion and perform NAS level mobility management congestion control.
{1015, 1} NAS level mobility management congestion control consists of general NAS level mobility management congestion control and subscribed APN based congestion control.
---

{1016, 0} Under general overload conditions the network may reject mobility management signalling requests from UEs as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10].
---

{1016, 0} Under general overload conditions the network may reject mobility management signalling requests from UEs as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10].
{1016, 1} The network should not reject the following requests:
{1017, 0} requests for emergency bearer services;
---

{1016, 0} Under general overload conditions the network may reject mobility management signalling requests from UEs as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10].
{1016, 1} The network should not reject the following requests:
{1018, 0} DETACH REQUEST message;
---

{1016, 0} Under general overload conditions the network may reject mobility management signalling requests from UEs as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10].
{1016, 1} The network should not reject the following requests:
{1019, 0} service request or tracking area update request triggered by paging;
---

{1016, 0} Under general overload conditions the network may reject mobility management signalling requests from UEs as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10].
{1016, 1} The network should not reject the following requests:
{1020, 0} requests from UEs that were received via NAS signalling connections established with RRC establishment cause "High priority access AC 11 – 15";
---

{1016, 0} Under general overload conditions the network may reject mobility management signalling requests from UEs as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10].
{1016, 1} The network should not reject the following requests:
{1021, 0} requests for CS fallback emergency call or 1xCS fallback emergency call.
---

{1022, 0} When subscribed APN based mobility management congestion control is active for a particular APN, the network may reject attach requests from UEs with a subscription to this APN.
---

{1023, 0} In mobility management the network may detect NAS signalling congestion and start or stop performing the subscribed APN based congestion control based on mobility management level criteria such as, rate of mobility management NAS messages from a group of UEs with a subscription to a particular APN exceeds or falls below certain thresholds;
---

{1023, 0} In mobility management the network may detect NAS signalling congestion and start or stop performing the subscribed APN based congestion control based on mobility management level criteria such as, setting in network management.
---

{1026, 0} When the NAS level mobility management congestion control is active, the network may include a value for the mobility management back-off timer T3346 in the reject messages.
---

{1026, 0} When the NAS level mobility management congestion control is active, the network may include a value for the mobility management back-off timer T3346 in the reject messages.
{1026, 1} The UE starts the timer T3346 with the value received in the mobility management reject messages.
---

{1026, 0} When the NAS level mobility management congestion control is active, the network may include a value for the mobility management back-off timer T3346 in the reject messages.
{1026, 1} The UE starts the timer T3346 with the value received in the mobility management reject messages.
{1026, 2} To avoid that large numbers of UEs simultaneously initiate deferred requests, the network should select the value for the timer T3346 for the rejected UEs so that timeouts are not synchronised.
---

{1027, 0} For subscribed APN based congestion control the value of timer T3346 for a particular APN may be APN dependent.
---

{1028, 0} If the timer T3346 is running when the UE enters state EMM-DEREGISTERED, the UE remains switched on, and the USIM in the UE remains the same, then timer T3346 is kept running until it expires or it is stopped.
---

{1029, 0} If the UE is switched off when the timer T3346 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
{1030, 0} let t1 be the time remaining for T3346 timeout at switch off and let t be the time elapsed between switch off and switch on.
---

{1029, 0} If the UE is switched off when the timer T3346 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
{1030, 0} let t1 be the time remaining for T3346 timeout at switch off and let t be the time elapsed between switch off and switch on.
{1030, 1} If t1 is greater than t, then the timer shall be restarted with the value t1 – t. If t1 is equal to or less than t, then the timer need not be restarted.
---

{1029, 0} If the UE is switched off when the timer T3346 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
{1030, 0} let t1 be the time remaining for T3346 timeout at switch off and let t be the time elapsed between switch off and switch on.
{1030, 1} If t1 is greater than t, then the timer shall be restarted with the value t1 – t. If t1 is equal to or less than t, then the timer need not be restarted.
{1030, 2} If the UE is not capable of determining t, then the UE shall restart the timer with the value t1;
---

{1029, 0} If the UE is switched off when the timer T3346 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
{1031, 0} if prior to switch off, timer T3346 was started due to a NAS request message which contained the low priority indicator set to "MS is configured for NAS signalling low priority", then if timer T3346 is restarted at switch on, the UE configured for dual priority shall handle mobility management requests as indicated in subclauses 5.5.1.2.6, 5.5.3.2.6 and 5.6.1.6.
---

{1032, 0} If the UE enters a new PLMN while timer T3346 is running, and the new PLMN is not equivalent to the PLMN where the UE started timer T3346, the UE shall stop timer T3346 when initiating mobility management procedures in the new PLMN.
---

{1033, 0} After change in TAI which is not part of TAI list, if the timer T3346 is running and EMM update status is EU1 UPDATED then UE shall set the EMM update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED and enter state EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE.
---

{1035, 0} The network may activate congestion control for transport of user data via the control plane, as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10].
---

{1036, 0} If the congestion control for transport of user data via the control plane is active and if the UE has indicated support for the control plane data back-off timer, the network shall include a value for the control plane data back-off timer T3448 in ATTACH ACCEPT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT, SERVICE ACCEPT or SERVICE REJECT message, and shall store an control plane data back-off time on a per UE basis.
---

{1036, 0} If the congestion control for transport of user data via the control plane is active and if the UE has indicated support for the control plane data back-off timer, the network shall include a value for the control plane data back-off timer T3448 in ATTACH ACCEPT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT, SERVICE ACCEPT or SERVICE REJECT message, and shall store an control plane data back-off time on a per UE basis.
{1036, 1} The UE starts the timer T3448 with the value informed in the message.
---

{1036, 0} If the congestion control for transport of user data via the control plane is active and if the UE has indicated support for the control plane data back-off timer, the network shall include a value for the control plane data back-off timer T3448 in ATTACH ACCEPT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT, SERVICE ACCEPT or SERVICE REJECT message, and shall store an control plane data back-off time on a per UE basis.
{1036, 1} The UE starts the timer T3448 with the value informed in the message.
{1036, 2} To avoid that large numbers of UEs simultaneously initiate deferred requests, the network should select the value for the timer T3448 for the informed UEs so that timeouts are not synchronised.
---

{1037, 0} The network sends TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or SERVICE ACCEPT message without T3448 value IE to stop the timer T3448 running in the UE as specified in subclause 5.5.3.2.4 and subclause 5.6.1.4.2.
---

{1038, 0} Based on the stored control plane data back-off time for the UE, the network may reject the transfer of user data via the control plane initiated by the UE.
---

{1039, 0} While the timer T3448 is running, the UE in EMM-IDLE mode shall not initiate the transport of user data via the control plane procedure, except if the UE is allowed to use exception data reporting and the user data is related to an exceptional event.
---

{1040, 0} Upon entering the state EMM-DEREGISTERED or a new PLMN which is not equivalent to the PLMN where the UE started the timer T3448, or upon being switched off while the timer T3448 is running, the UE shall stop the timer T3448.
---

{1040, 0} Upon entering the state EMM-DEREGISTERED or a new PLMN which is not equivalent to the PLMN where the UE started the timer T3448, or upon being switched off while the timer T3448 is running, the UE shall stop the timer T3448.
{1040, 1} For further criteria to stop of timer T3448, refer to subclause 5.5.3.2.4 and subclause 5.6.1.4.2.
---

{1042, 0} The network can restrict the access for certain groups of UEs by means of barring their access class.

{1047, 0} Access Barring.

{1049, 0} The UE can request the use of power saving mode during an attach or tracking area updating procedure.

---

---

---

{1062, 0} If conditions a, b, c and e are fulfilled, but the UE is in a state other than EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE when timer T3324 expires, the UE may activate PSM when the MS returns to state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
---

{1063, 0} A UE that has already been allocated timer T3324 with a value different from "deactivated" and the timer T3324 has expired, may activate PSM if it receives an "Extended wait time" from lower layers.
---

{1064, 0} When PSM is activated all NAS timers are stopped and associated procedures aborted except for T3412, T3346, T3396, T3447, any backoff timers, and the timer T controlling the periodic search for HPLMN or EHPLMN or higher prioritized PLMNs.

{1147, 0} If the UE is switched off when the timer T3447 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
{1148, 0} let t1 be the time remaining for T3447 timeout at switch off and let t be the time elapsed between switch off and switch on.
{1148, 1} If t1 is greater than t, then the timer shall be restarted with the value t1 – t. If t1 is equal to or less than t, then the timer need not be restarted.
{1148, 2} If the UE is not capable of determining t, then the UE shall restart the timer with the value t1.

---

{1150, 0} Restricted local operator services is an optional feature that enables operators to offer access to restricted local operator services to the unauthenticated UEs in limited service state.
{1150, 1} Authenticated UEs in limited service state may also be able to access restricted local operator services.
{1150, 2} The UE requests access to RLOS during the attach procedure by setting the attach type to "EPS RLOS attach" in the ATTACH REQUEST message.

{1152, 0} Broadcast system information may provide information about support of access to RLOS.
---

{1152, 1} At reception of new broadcast system information, the lower layers deliver it to the EMM layer in the UE.

{1152, 1} At reception of new broadcast system information, the lower layers deliver it to the EMM layer in the UE.
{1152, 2} The information provided by lower layers is per PLMN and used by the UE to determine the PLMN is configured to support access to RLOS.
---

{1152, 0} Broadcast system information may provide information about support of access to RLOS.
{1152, 1} At reception of new broadcast system information, the lower layers deliver it to the EMM layer in the UE.
{1152, 2} The information provided by lower layers is per PLMN and used by the UE to determine the PLMN is configured to support access to RLOS.
{1152, 3} The UE shall not attempt to request access to RLOS if the serving PLMN does not support access to RLOS.
---

{1152, 0} Broadcast system information may provide information about support of access to RLOS.
{1152, 1} At reception of new broadcast system information, the lower layers deliver it to the EMM layer in the UE.
{1152, 2} The information provided by lower layers is per PLMN and used by the UE to determine the PLMN is configured to support access to RLOS.
{1152, 3} The UE shall not attempt to request access to RLOS if the serving PLMN does not support access to RLOS.
{1152, 4} If the serving PLMN supports access to RLOS and the UE is in limited service state, the UE shall verify that the MCC of the PLMN ID of the serving PLMN is present in the list of access to RLOS allowed MCCs configured in the UE before requesting access to RLOS.
---

{1152, 0} Broadcast system information may provide information about support of access to RLOS.
{1152, 1} At reception of new broadcast system information, the lower layers deliver it to the EMM layer in the UE.
{1152, 2} The information provided by lower layers is per PLMN and used by the UE to determine the PLMN is configured to support access to RLOS.
{1152, 3} The UE shall not attempt to request access to RLOS if the serving PLMN does not support access to RLOS.
{1152, 4} If the serving PLMN supports access to RLOS and the UE is in limited service state, the UE shall verify that the MCC of the PLMN ID of the serving PLMN is present in the list of access to RLOS allowed MCCs configured in the UE before requesting access to RLOS.
{1152, 5} If the UE has a valid USIM, the UE shall additionally verify that the MCC part of the IMSI configured in the USIM is present in the list of RLOS allowed MCCs before requesting access to RLOS.
---

{1165, 0} UE radio capability signalling optimisation is a feature that is optional at both the UE and the network and which aims to optimise the transmission of UE radio capability over the radio interface.
---

{1165, 0} UE radio capability signalling optimisation is a feature that is optional at both the UE and the network and which aims to optimise the transmission of UE radio capability over the radio interface.
{1165, 1} RACS works by assigning an identifier to represent a set of UE radio capabilities.
---

{1165, 0} UE radio capability signalling optimisation is a feature that is optional at both the UE and the network and which aims to optimise the transmission of UE radio capability over the radio interface.
{1165, 1} RACS works by assigning an identifier to represent a set of UE radio capabilities.
{1165, 2} This identifier is called the UE radio capability ID.
---

{1165, 0} UE radio capability signalling optimisation is a feature that is optional at both the UE and the network and which aims to optimise the transmission of UE radio capability over the radio interface.
{1165, 1} RACS works by assigning an identifier to represent a set of UE radio capabilities.
{1165, 2} This identifier is called the UE radio capability ID.
{1165, 3} A UE radio capability ID can be either manufacturer-assigned or network-assigned.
---

{1165, 0} UE radio capability signalling optimisation is a feature that is optional at both the UE and the network and which aims to optimise the transmission of UE radio capability over the radio interface.
{1165, 1} RACS works by assigning an identifier to represent a set of UE radio capabilities.
{1165, 2} This identifier is called the UE radio capability ID.
{1165, 3} A UE radio capability ID can be either manufacturer-assigned or network-assigned.
{1165, 4} The UE radio capability ID is an alternative to the signalling of the radio capabilities container over the radio interface.
---

{1166, 0} In this release of the specification, RACS is not applicable to NB-S1 mode.

{1167, 0} If the UE supports RACS, the UE shall indicate support for RACS by setting the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST and TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST messages;

---

{1167, 0} If the UE supports RACS, if the radio configuration at the UE changes then, if the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration, the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure, include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and include a UE radio capability ID availability IE set to "UE radio capability ID available" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.

{1167, 0} If the UE supports RACS, if the radio configuration at the UE changes then, if the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration, the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure, include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and include a UE radio capability ID availability IE set to "UE radio capability ID available" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.

{1167, 0} If the UE supports RACS, if the radio configuration at the UE changes then, if the UE does not have an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration, the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure and shall include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;
---

{1167, 0} If the UE supports RACS, upon receiving a network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall store the network-assigned UE radio capability ID and the PLMN ID of the serving network along with a mapping to the current UE radio configuration in its non-volatile memory as specified in annex C. The UE shall be able to store at least the last 16 received network-assigned UE radio capability IDs with the associated PLMN ID and the mapping to the corresponding UE radio configuration;
---

{1167, 0} If the UE supports RACS, the UE shall not use a network-assigned UE radio capability ID in PLMNs equivalent to the PLMN which assigned it;
---

{1167, 0} If the UE supports RACS, upon receiving a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "delete network-assigned UE radio capability IDs" in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall delete all network-assigned UE radio capability IDs stored at the UE for the serving network and initiate a tracking area updating procedure.
---

{1167, 0} If the UE supports RACS, upon receiving a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "delete network-assigned UE radio capability IDs" in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall delete all network-assigned UE radio capability IDs stored at the UE for the serving network and initiate a tracking area updating procedure.
{1177, 1} If the UE has an applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network, the UE shall include a UE radio capability ID availability IE set to "UE radio capability ID available" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
---

{1178, 0} If the network supports RACS, if the UE has included the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message and set the IE to "UE radio capability ID available", the network shall initiate a security mode control procedure to retrieve the UE radio capability ID from the UE;
---

{1178, 0} If the network supports RACS, if the UE has included the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and set the IE to "UE radio capability ID available", the network may initiate a security mode control procedure to retrieve the UE radio capability ID from the UE;
---

{1178, 0} If the network supports RACS, if the UE has included the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, set the URCIDA bit to "UE radio capability ID available" in the UE radio capability ID availability IE and no UE radio capability ID is available in the UE context in the MME, the network shall initiate a security mode control procedure to retrieve the UE radio capability ID from the UE;
---

{1178, 0} If the network supports RACS, the network may assign a network-assigned UE radio capability ID to a UE which supports RACS by including a UE radio capability ID IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message;
---

{1178, 0} If the network supports RACS, the network may trigger the UE to delete all network-assigned UE radio capability IDs stored at the UE for the serving network by including a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "delete network-assigned UE radio capability IDs" in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message.

{1185, 0} A UE supporting wake-up signal assistance can indicate its WUS assistance capability during attach or tracking area updating procedure.

{1185, 2} The UE shall not include its UE paging probability information during, an attach for emergency bearer services procedure;

{1188, 0} The UE is not attached for emergency bearer services and the network may negotiate the UE paging probability information during an attach or tracking area updating procedure when the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services.

{1188, 0} The UE is not attached for emergency bearer services and the network may negotiate the UE paging probability information during an attach or tracking area updating procedure when the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services.
{1188, 1} The UE paging probability information is an assistance information used to determine the WUS group for paging UE.
---

{1189, 0} If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services and the network accepts the use of the WUS assistance for the UE, the network determines the negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE based on the requested UE paging probability information, if any, local configuration or previous statistical information for the UE, and then indicates the negotiated UE paging probability information in the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE to the UE when accepting the attach or the tracking area updating procedure.
---

{1189, 0} If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services and the network accepts the use of the WUS assistance for the UE, the network determines the negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE based on the requested UE paging probability information, if any, local configuration or previous statistical information for the UE, and then indicates the negotiated UE paging probability information in the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE to the UE when accepting the attach or the tracking area updating procedure.
{1189, 1} The network shall store the negotiated UE paging probability information in the EMM context of the UE for paging.

{1190, 0} The UE shall use WUS assistance only if it received the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure.
---

{1190, 0} The UE shall use WUS assistance only if it received the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure.
{1190, 1} If the UE did not receive the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure, the UE shall not use WUS assistance.

{1191, 0} If the network did not accept the request to use WUS assistance, the network shall delete the stored negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE, if available.

---

{1192, 0} When a PDN connection for emergency bearer service is successfully established after the UE received the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure, the UE and the network shall not use WUS assistance information until, the UE receives WUS assistance information during a tracking area updating procedure with EPS bearer context synchronization or upon successful completion of a service request procedure, if the UE or the network locally releases the PDN connection for emergency bearer service.

{1204, 0} The PLMN identity in the GUTI indicates the current registered PLMN.

{1206, 0} The MME shall initiate the GUTI reallocation procedure by sending a GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message to the UE and starting the timer T3450.

{1212, 0} Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, store the GUTI;
---

---

{1212, 0} Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, store the DCN-ID, if provided;
---

{1212, 0} Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, in WB-S1 mode, if the UE supports RACS and the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message includes, a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "Network-assigned UE radio capability IDs deletion requested", delete any network-assigned UE radio capability IDs associated with the registered PLMN stored at the UE, then the UE shall, after the completion of the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure, initiate a tracking area updating procedure as specified in subclause 5.5.3.
---

{1212, 0} Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, in WB-S1 mode, if the UE supports RACS and the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message includes, a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "Network-assigned UE radio capability IDs deletion requested", delete any network-assigned UE radio capability IDs associated with the registered PLMN stored at the UE, then the UE shall, after the completion of the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure, initiate a tracking area updating procedure as specified in subclause 5.5.3.
{1217, 1} If the UE has an applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration, the UE shall include the UE radio capability ID availability IE set to "UE radio capability ID available" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;

---

{1212, 0} Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, send a GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message to the MME.
---

{1220, 0} The UE considers the new GUTI as valid and the old GUTI as invalid.
---

{1220, 0} The UE considers the new GUTI as valid and the old GUTI as invalid.
{1220, 1} If the UE receives a new TAI list in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall consider the new TAI list as valid and the old TAI list as invalid; otherwise, the UE shall consider the old TAI list as valid.
---

{1221, 0} If the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message contains the DCN-ID IE, then the UE shall store the included DCN-ID value together with the PLMN code of the registered PLMN in a DCN-ID list in a non-volatile memory in the ME as specified in annex C.
---

{1223, 0} Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message, the MME shall stop the timer T3450 and consider the new GUTI as valid and the old GUTI as invalid.
---

{1223, 0} Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message, the MME shall stop the timer T3450 and consider the new GUTI as valid and the old GUTI as invalid.
{1223, 1} If a new TAI list is provided in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the MME shall consider the new TAI list as valid and the old TAI list as invalid.

{1225, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1226, 0} Transmission failure of GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{1227, 0} If the current TAI is not in the TAI list, the GUTI reallocation procedure shall be aborted and a tracking area updating procedure shall be initiated.
---

{1225, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1226, 0} Transmission failure of GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{1228, 0} If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list, it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the GUTI reallocation procedure.
---

{1225, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1229, 0} Transmission failure of GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message indication without TAI change from lower layers
{1230, 0} It is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the GUTI reallocation procedure.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1234, 0} If a lower layer failure is detected before the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message is received, the old and the new GUTI shall be considered as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1234, 0} If a lower layer failure is detected before the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message is received, the old and the new GUTI shall be considered as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
{1234, 1} If a new TAI list was provided in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the old and new TAI list shall also be considered as valid until the old TAI list can be considered as invalid by the network.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, may first use the old S-TMSI from the old GUTI for paging within the area defined by the old TAI list for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts for network originated transactions.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, may first use the old S-TMSI from the old GUTI for paging within the area defined by the old TAI list for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts for network originated transactions.
{1236, 1} If a new TAI list was provided with old GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the new TAI list should also be used for paging.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, may first use the old S-TMSI from the old GUTI for paging within the area defined by the old TAI list for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts for network originated transactions.
{1236, 1} If a new TAI list was provided with old GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the new TAI list should also be used for paging.
{1236, 2} Upon response from the UE, the network may re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, may first use the old S-TMSI from the old GUTI for paging within the area defined by the old TAI list for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts for network originated transactions.
{1236, 1} If a new TAI list was provided with old GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the new TAI list should also be used for paging.
{1236, 2} Upon response from the UE, the network may re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
{1236, 3} If the response is received from a tracking area within the old and new TAI list, the network shall re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, may first use the old S-TMSI from the old GUTI for paging within the area defined by the old TAI list for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts for network originated transactions.
{1236, 1} If a new TAI list was provided with old GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the new TAI list should also be used for paging.
{1236, 2} Upon response from the UE, the network may re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
{1236, 3} If the response is received from a tracking area within the old and new TAI list, the network shall re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
{1236, 4} If no response is received to the paging attempts, the network may use the new S-TMSI from the new GUTI for paging for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, may first use the old S-TMSI from the old GUTI for paging within the area defined by the old TAI list for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts for network originated transactions.
{1236, 1} If a new TAI list was provided with old GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the new TAI list should also be used for paging.
{1236, 2} Upon response from the UE, the network may re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
{1236, 3} If the response is received from a tracking area within the old and new TAI list, the network shall re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
{1236, 4} If no response is received to the paging attempts, the network may use the new S-TMSI from the new GUTI for paging for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts.
{1236, 5} In this case, if a new TAI list was provided with new GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCAITON COMMAND message, the new TAI list shall be used instead of the old TAI list.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, may first use the old S-TMSI from the old GUTI for paging within the area defined by the old TAI list for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts for network originated transactions.
{1236, 1} If a new TAI list was provided with old GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the new TAI list should also be used for paging.
{1236, 2} Upon response from the UE, the network may re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
{1236, 3} If the response is received from a tracking area within the old and new TAI list, the network shall re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
{1236, 4} If no response is received to the paging attempts, the network may use the new S-TMSI from the new GUTI for paging for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts.
{1236, 5} In this case, if a new TAI list was provided with new GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCAITON COMMAND message, the new TAI list shall be used instead of the old TAI list.
{1236, 6} Upon response from the UE the network shall consider the new GUTI as valid and the old GUTI as invalid.

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, may first use the old S-TMSI from the old GUTI for paging within the area defined by the old TAI list for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts for network originated transactions.
{1236, 1} If a new TAI list was provided with old GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the new TAI list should also be used for paging.
{1236, 2} Upon response from the UE, the network may re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
{1236, 3} If the response is received from a tracking area within the old and new TAI list, the network shall re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
{1236, 4} If no response is received to the paging attempts, the network may use the new S-TMSI from the new GUTI for paging for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts.
{1236, 5} In this case, if a new TAI list was provided with new GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCAITON COMMAND message, the new TAI list shall be used instead of the old TAI list.
{1236, 6} Upon response from the UE the network shall consider the new GUTI as valid and the old GUTI as invalid.
{1236, 7} If no response is received to the paging attempts, the network may use the IMSI for paging for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts;

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
