{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, if the network accepted to use eDRX for the UE, may determine the next paging window from both old GUTI and new GUTI, and may first use the S-TMSI from the GUTI which led the first eDRX for paging.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, if the network accepted to use eDRX for the UE, may determine the next paging window from both old GUTI and new GUTI, and may first use the S-TMSI from the GUTI which led the first eDRX for paging.
{1239, 1} If no response is received to the paging attempts for the first eDRX, the network may use the other S-TMSI from the other GUTI which led the second eDRX for paging.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1233, 0} Lower layer failure
{1235, 0} During this period the network, if the network accepted to use eDRX for the UE, may determine the next paging window from both old GUTI and new GUTI, and may first use the S-TMSI from the GUTI which led the first eDRX for paging.
{1239, 1} If no response is received to the paging attempts for the first eDRX, the network may use the other S-TMSI from the other GUTI which led the second eDRX for paging.
{1239, 2} For this paging procedure, the network shall start timer T3415 long enough to care the paging attempts for both eDRXs.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1240, 0} Expiry of timer T3450
{1241, 0} The GUTI reallocation procedure is supervised by the timer T3450.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1240, 0} Expiry of timer T3450
{1241, 0} The GUTI reallocation procedure is supervised by the timer T3450.
{1241, 1} The network shall, on the first expiry of timer T3450, reset and restart timer T3450 and shall retransmit the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1240, 0} Expiry of timer T3450
{1241, 0} The GUTI reallocation procedure is supervised by the timer T3450.
{1241, 1} The network shall, on the first expiry of timer T3450, reset and restart timer T3450 and shall retransmit the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND.
{1241, 2} This retransmission is repeated four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3450, the network shall abort the reallocation procedure and shall follow the rules described for case a above.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1242, 0} GUTI reallocation and attach procedure collision
{1243, 0} If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed the network shall proceed with the attach procedure after deletion of the EMM context.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1244, 0} GUTI reallocation and UE initiated detach procedure collision
{1245, 0} If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the GUTI reallocation procedure and shall progress the detach procedure.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1246, 0} GUTI reallocation and tracking area updating procedure collision
{1247, 0} If the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the GUTI reallocation procedure and shall progress the tracking area updating procedure.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1246, 0} GUTI reallocation and tracking area updating procedure collision
{1247, 0} If the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the GUTI reallocation procedure and shall progress the tracking area updating procedure.
{1247, 1} The network may then perform a new GUTI reallocation.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1248, 0} GUTI reallocation and service request procedure collision
{1249, 0} If the network receives an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for CS fallback or 1xCS fallback before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed, the network shall progress both procedures.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1250, 0} Lower layer indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{1251, 0} If the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message.
---

{1232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1250, 0} Lower layer indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{1251, 0} If the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message.
{1251, 1} If a failure of the handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message.
---

{1252, 0} If there is a different new GUTI and optionally a new TAI list included in a subsequent GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE always regards the newest GUTI and the newest TAI list as valid for the recovery time.
---

{1255, 0} The purpose of the EPS authentication and key agreement procedure is to provide mutual authentication between the user and the network and to agree on a key KASME.
---

{1255, 0} The purpose of the EPS authentication and key agreement procedure is to provide mutual authentication between the user and the network and to agree on a key KASME.
{1255, 1} The cases when the EPS AKA procedure should be used are defined in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19].
---

{1256, 0} The EPS AKA procedure is always initiated and controlled by the network.
---

{1256, 0} The EPS AKA procedure is always initiated and controlled by the network.
{1256, 1} However, the UE can reject the EPS authentication challenge sent by the network.
---

{1257, 0} The UE shall proceed with an EPS authentication challenge only if a USIM is present.
---

{1258, 0} A partial native EPS security context is established in the UE and the network when an EPS authentication is successfully performed.
---

{1258, 0} A partial native EPS security context is established in the UE and the network when an EPS authentication is successfully performed.
{1258, 1} During a successful EPS authentication procedure, the CK and IK are computed by the USIM.
---

{1258, 0} A partial native EPS security context is established in the UE and the network when an EPS authentication is successfully performed.
{1258, 1} During a successful EPS authentication procedure, the CK and IK are computed by the USIM.
{1258, 2} CK and IK are then used by the ME as key material to compute a new key, KASME.
---

{1258, 0} A partial native EPS security context is established in the UE and the network when an EPS authentication is successfully performed.
{1258, 1} During a successful EPS authentication procedure, the CK and IK are computed by the USIM.
{1258, 2} CK and IK are then used by the ME as key material to compute a new key, KASME.
{1258, 3} KASME is stored in the EPS security contexts of both the network and in the volatile memory of the ME while attached to the network, and is the root for the EPS integrity protection and ciphering key hierarchy.
---

{1260, 0} When a NAS signalling connection exists, the network can initiate an authentication procedure at any time.
---

{1260, 0} When a NAS signalling connection exists, the network can initiate an authentication procedure at any time.
{1260, 1} For restrictions applicable after handover or inter-system handover to S1 mode see subclause 5.5.3.2.3.
---

{1261, 0} The network initiates the authentication procedure by sending an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE and starting the timer T3460.
---

{1261, 0} The network initiates the authentication procedure by sending an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE and starting the timer T3460.
{1261, 1} The AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message contains the parameters necessary to calculate the authentication response.
---

{1262, 0} If an eKSI is contained in an initial NAS message during an EMM procedure, the network shall include a different eKSI value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message when it initiates an authentication procedure.
---

{1264, 0} The UE shall respond to an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
---

{1264, 0} The UE shall respond to an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
{1264, 1} With the exception of the cases described in subclauses 5.4.2.6 and 5.4.2.7 case k, the UE shall process the authentication challenge data and respond with an AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network.
---

{1265, 0} Upon a successful EPS authentication challenge, the UE shall determine the PLMN identity to be used for the calculation of the new KASME from the authentication challenge data according to the following rules:
{1266, 0} When the UE moves from EMM-IDLE mode to EMM-CONNECTED mode, until the first handover, the UE shall use the PLMN identity of the selected PLMN;
---

{1265, 0} Upon a successful EPS authentication challenge, the UE shall determine the PLMN identity to be used for the calculation of the new KASME from the authentication challenge data according to the following rules:
{1267, 0} After handover or inter-system handover to S1 mode, if the target cell is not a shared network cell, the UE shall use the PLMN identity received as part of the broadcast system information;
---

{1265, 0} Upon a successful EPS authentication challenge, the UE shall determine the PLMN identity to be used for the calculation of the new KASME from the authentication challenge data according to the following rules:
{1267, 0} After handover or inter-system handover to S1 mode, if the target cell is a shared network cell and the UE has a valid GUTI, the UE shall use the PLMN identity that is part of the GUTI;
---

{1265, 0} Upon a successful EPS authentication challenge, the UE shall determine the PLMN identity to be used for the calculation of the new KASME from the authentication challenge data according to the following rules:
{1267, 0} After handover or inter-system handover to S1 mode, if the target cell is a shared network cell, the UE does not have a valid GUTI and, the EPS authentication challenge is performed after inter-system handover from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or from Iu mode to S1 mode and the UE has a valid P-TMSI and RAI, the UE shall use the PLMN identity that is part of the RAI;
---

{1265, 0} Upon a successful EPS authentication challenge, the UE shall determine the PLMN identity to be used for the calculation of the new KASME from the authentication challenge data according to the following rules:
{1267, 0} After handover or inter-system handover to S1 mode, if the target cell is a shared network cell, the UE does not have a valid GUTI and, the EPS authentication challenge is performed after inter-system handover from N1 mode to S1 mode and the UE has a valid 5G-GUTI, the UE shall use the PLMN identity that is part of the 5G-GUTI.
---

{1273, 0} Upon a successful EPS authentication challenge, the new KASME calculated from the authentication challenge data shall be stored in a new EPS security context in the volatile memory of the ME.
---

{1274, 0} The USIM will compute the authentication response using the authentication challenge data received from the ME, and pass RES to the ME.
---

{1275, 0} In order to avoid a synchronisation failure, when the UE receives an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, the UE shall store the received RAND together with the RES returned from the USIM in the volatile memory of the ME.
---

{1275, 0} In order to avoid a synchronisation failure, when the UE receives an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, the UE shall store the received RAND together with the RES returned from the USIM in the volatile memory of the ME.
{1275, 1} When the UE receives a subsequent AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, if the stored RAND value is equal to the new received value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, then the ME shall not pass the RAND to the USIM, but shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message with the stored RES.
---

{1275, 0} In order to avoid a synchronisation failure, when the UE receives an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, the UE shall store the received RAND together with the RES returned from the USIM in the volatile memory of the ME.
{1275, 1} When the UE receives a subsequent AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, if the stored RAND value is equal to the new received value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, then the ME shall not pass the RAND to the USIM, but shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message with the stored RES.
{1275, 2} If there is no valid stored RAND in the ME or the stored RAND is different from the new received value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, the ME shall pass the RAND to the USIM, shall override any previously stored RAND and RES with the new ones and start, or reset and restart timer T3416.
---

{1276, 0} The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, upon receipt of a
{1278, 0} SECURITY MODE COMMAND,
---

{1276, 0} The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, upon receipt of a
{1279, 0} SERVICE REJECT,
---

{1276, 0} The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, upon receipt of a
{1280, 0} SERVICE ACCEPT,
---

{1276, 0} The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, upon receipt of a
{1281, 0} TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT,
---

{1276, 0} The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, upon receipt of a
{1282, 0} TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT, or
---

{1276, 0} The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, upon receipt of a
{1283, 0} AUTHENTICATION REJECT message;
---

{1276, 0} The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, upon expiry of timer T3416;
---

{1276, 0} The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, if the UE enters the EMM state EMM-DEREGISTERED or EMM-NULL;
---

{1276, 0} The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, if the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode.
---

{1288, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message, the network stops the timer T3460 and checks the correctness of RES.
---

{1289, 0} If the authentication procedure has been completed successfully and the related eKSI is stored in the EPS security context of the network, the network shall include a different eKSI value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message when it initiates a new authentication procedure.
---

{1290, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, the network stops the timer T3460.
---

{1290, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, the network stops the timer T3460.
{1290, 1} In the case where the EMM cause #21 "synch failure" is received, the core network may renegotiate with the HSS/AuC and provide the UE with new authentication parameters.
---

{1292, 0} If the authentication response returned by the UE is not valid, the network response depends upon the type of identity used by the UE in the initial NAS message, that is, if the GUTI was used;
---

{1292, 0} If the authentication response returned by the UE is not valid, the network response depends upon the type of identity used by the UE in the initial NAS message, that is, if the IMSI was used.
---

{1295, 0} If the GUTI was used, the network should initiate an identification procedure.
---

{1295, 0} If the GUTI was used, the network should initiate an identification procedure.
{1295, 1} If the IMSI given by the UE during the identification procedure differs from the IMSI the network had associated with the GUTI, the authentication should be restarted with the correct parameters.
---

{1295, 0} If the GUTI was used, the network should initiate an identification procedure.
{1295, 1} If the IMSI given by the UE during the identification procedure differs from the IMSI the network had associated with the GUTI, the authentication should be restarted with the correct parameters.
{1295, 2} Otherwise, if the IMSI provided by the UE is the same as the IMSI stored in the network, the network should send an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message to the UE.
---

{1296, 0} If the IMSI was used for identification in the initial NAS message, or the network decides not to initiate the identification procedure after an unsuccessful authentication procedure, the network should send an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message to the UE.
---

{1297, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS, the UE shall set the update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED, delete the stored GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI and KSIASME.
---

{1297, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS, the UE shall set the update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED, delete the stored GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI and KSIASME.
{1298, 1} The USIM shall be considered invalid until switching off the UE or the UICC containing the USIM is removed.
---

{1297, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS, the UE shall set the update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED, delete the stored GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI and KSIASME.
{1298, 1} The USIM shall be considered invalid until switching off the UE or the UICC containing the USIM is removed.
{1298, 2} If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
---

{1297, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS, the UE shall set the update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED, delete the stored GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI and KSIASME.
{1298, 1} The USIM shall be considered invalid until switching off the UE or the UICC containing the USIM is removed.
{1298, 2} If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
{1298, 3} If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
---

{1297, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS, the UE shall set the update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED, delete the stored GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI and KSIASME.
{1298, 1} The USIM shall be considered invalid until switching off the UE or the UICC containing the USIM is removed.
{1298, 2} If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
{1298, 3} If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
{1299, 0} If A/Gb or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status, P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number and the MM parameters update status, TMSI, LAI and ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the authentication and ciphering procedure is not accepted by the network;
---

{1297, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message is received without integrity protection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
---

{1297, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message is received without integrity protection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{1300, 1} Additionally, the UE shall, if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, proceed as specified in subclause 5.3.7b, list item 1a for the case that the EMM cause value received is #3;
---

{1297, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message is received without integrity protection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
{1300, 1} Additionally, the UE shall, otherwise proceed as specified under list item a above for the case that the message has been successfully integrity checked.
---

{1303, 0} If the AUTHENTICATION REJECT message is received by the UE, the UE shall abort any EMM signalling procedure, stop any of the retransmission timers that are running and enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{1304, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause.
---

{1304, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause.
{1304, 1} The MME may continue a current EMM specific procedure or PDN connectivity request procedure.
---

{1304, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause.
{1304, 1} The MME may continue a current EMM specific procedure or PDN connectivity request procedure.
{1304, 2} Upon completion of the authentication procedure, if not initiated as part of another procedure, or upon completion of the EMM procedure or PDN connectivity request procedure, the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearers, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure.
---

{1304, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause.
{1304, 1} The MME may continue a current EMM specific procedure or PDN connectivity request procedure.
{1304, 2} Upon completion of the authentication procedure, if not initiated as part of another procedure, or upon completion of the EMM procedure or PDN connectivity request procedure, the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearers, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure.
{1304, 3} The network shall consider the UE to be attached for emergency bearer services only.
---

{1305, 0} Depending on local regulation and operator policy, if the UE is requesting attach for access to RLOS, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause.
---

{1305, 0} Depending on local regulation and operator policy, if the UE is requesting attach for access to RLOS, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause.
{1305, 1} The MME may continue a current EMM specific procedure.
---

{1307, 0} In an EPS authentication challenge, the UE shall check the authenticity of the core network by means of the AUTN parameter received in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
---

{1307, 0} In an EPS authentication challenge, the UE shall check the authenticity of the core network by means of the AUTN parameter received in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
{1307, 1} This enables the UE to detect a false network.
---

{1308, 0} During an EPS authentication procedure, the UE may reject the core network due to an incorrect AUTN parameter.
---

{1308, 0} During an EPS authentication procedure, the UE may reject the core network due to an incorrect AUTN parameter.
{1308, 1} This parameter contains three possible causes for authentication failure:
{1309, 0} MAC code failure:
{1310, 0} If the UE finds the MAC code to be invalid, the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, with the EMM cause #20 "MAC failure".
---

{1308, 0} During an EPS authentication procedure, the UE may reject the core network due to an incorrect AUTN parameter.
{1308, 1} This parameter contains three possible causes for authentication failure:
{1309, 0} MAC code failure:
{1310, 0} If the UE finds the MAC code to be invalid, the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, with the EMM cause #20 "MAC failure".
{1310, 1} The UE shall then follow the procedure described in subclause 5.4.2.7, item c.
---

{1308, 0} During an EPS authentication procedure, the UE may reject the core network due to an incorrect AUTN parameter.
{1308, 1} This parameter contains three possible causes for authentication failure:
{1311, 0} Non-EPS authentication unacceptable:
{1312, 0} If the UE finds that the "separation bit" in the AMF field of AUTN supplied by the core network is 0, the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, with the EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable".
---

{1308, 0} During an EPS authentication procedure, the UE may reject the core network due to an incorrect AUTN parameter.
{1308, 1} This parameter contains three possible causes for authentication failure:
{1311, 0} Non-EPS authentication unacceptable:
{1312, 0} If the UE finds that the "separation bit" in the AMF field of AUTN supplied by the core network is 0, the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, with the EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable".
{1312, 1} The UE shall then follow the procedure described in subclause 5.4.2.7, item d.
---

{1308, 0} During an EPS authentication procedure, the UE may reject the core network due to an incorrect AUTN parameter.
{1308, 1} This parameter contains three possible causes for authentication failure:
{1313, 0} SQN failure:
{1314, 0} If the UE finds the SQN to be out of range, the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, with the EMM cause #21 "synch failure" and a re-synchronization token AUTS provided by the USIM.
---

{1308, 0} During an EPS authentication procedure, the UE may reject the core network due to an incorrect AUTN parameter.
{1308, 1} This parameter contains three possible causes for authentication failure:
{1313, 0} SQN failure:
{1314, 0} If the UE finds the SQN to be out of range, the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, with the EMM cause #21 "synch failure" and a re-synchronization token AUTS provided by the USIM.
{1314, 1} The UE shall then follow the procedure described in subclause 5.4.2.7, item e.
---

{1315, 0} If the UE returns an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, the UE shall delete any previously stored RAND and RES and shall stop timer T3416, if running.
---

{1316, 0} If the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing such a PDN connection, additional UE requirements are specified in subclause 5.4.2.7, under "for items c, d, e".
---

{1317, 0} If the UE is attached for access to RLOS and has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing such a PDN connection, additional UE requirements are specified in subclause 5.4.2.7, under "for items c, d, e".
---

{1319, 0} Lower layer failure:
{1320, 0} Upon detection of lower layer failure before the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message is received, the network shall abort the procedure.
---

{1321, 0} Expiry of timer T3460:
{1322, 0} The network shall, on the first expiry of the timer T3460, retransmit the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message and shall reset and start timer T3460.
---

{1321, 0} Expiry of timer T3460:
{1322, 0} The network shall, on the first expiry of the timer T3460, retransmit the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message and shall reset and start timer T3460.
{1322, 1} This retransmission is repeated four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3460, the network shall abort the authentication procedure and any ongoing EMM specific procedure and release the NAS signalling connection.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1324, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure" according to subclause 5.4.2.6, to the network and start timer T3418.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1324, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure" according to subclause 5.4.2.6, to the network and start timer T3418.
{1324, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1324, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure" according to subclause 5.4.2.6, to the network and start timer T3418.
{1324, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1324, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1324, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure" according to subclause 5.4.2.6, to the network and start timer T3418.
{1324, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1324, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
{1324, 3} This is to allow the network to obtain the IMSI from the UE.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1324, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure" according to subclause 5.4.2.6, to the network and start timer T3418.
{1324, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1324, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
{1324, 3} This is to allow the network to obtain the IMSI from the UE.
{1324, 4} The network may then check that the GUTI originally used in the authentication challenge corresponded to the correct IMSI.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1324, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure" according to subclause 5.4.2.6, to the network and start timer T3418.
{1324, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1324, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
{1324, 3} This is to allow the network to obtain the IMSI from the UE.
{1324, 4} The network may then check that the GUTI originally used in the authentication challenge corresponded to the correct IMSI.
{1324, 5} Upon receipt of the IDENTITY REQUEST message from the network, the UE shall send the IDENTITY RESPONSE message.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1325, 0} If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was incorrect, the network should respond by sending a new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1325, 0} If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was incorrect, the network should respond by sending a new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE.
{1325, 1} Upon receiving the new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message from the network, the UE shall stop the timer T3418, if running, and then process the challenge information as normal.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1325, 0} If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was incorrect, the network should respond by sending a new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE.
{1325, 1} Upon receiving the new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message from the network, the UE shall stop the timer T3418, if running, and then process the challenge information as normal.
{1325, 2} If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was correct, the network should terminate the authentication procedure by sending an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1326, 0} If the network is validated successfully, the UE shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network and shall start any retransmission timers if they were running and stopped when the UE received the first failed AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1327, 0} If the UE receives the second AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message while T3418 is running, and the MAC value cannot be resolved, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in this subclause, item c, starting again from the beginning, or if the message contains a UMTS authentication challenge, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in item d. If the SQN is invalid, the UE shall proceed as specified in item e.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1328, 0} It can be assumed that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine if any of the following occur:
{1329, 0} the timer T3418 expires;
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1328, 0} It can be assumed that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine if any of the following occur:
{1330, 0} the UE detects any combination of the authentication failures: EMM causes #20 "MAC failure", #21 "synch failure" or #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", during three consecutive authentication challenges.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1328, 0} It can be assumed that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine if any of the following occur:
{1330, 0} the UE detects any combination of the authentication failures: EMM causes #20 "MAC failure", #21 "synch failure" or #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", during three consecutive authentication challenges.
{1330, 1} The authentication challenges shall be considered as consecutive only, if the authentication challenges causing the second and third authentication failure are received by the UE, while the timer T3418 or T3420 started after the previous authentication failure is running.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1331, 0} The UE shall stop timer T3418, if the timer is running and the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode, e.g. upon detection of a lower layer failure, release of the NAS signalling connection, or as the result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode or Iu mode.
---

{1323, 0} Authentication failure:
{1332, 0} When it has been deemed by the UE that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine, the UE shall proceed as described in item f.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1334, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", to the network and start the timer T3418.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1334, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", to the network and start the timer T3418.
{1334, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1334, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", to the network and start the timer T3418.
{1334, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1334, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1334, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", to the network and start the timer T3418.
{1334, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1334, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
{1334, 3} This is to allow the network to obtain the IMSI from the UE.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1334, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", to the network and start the timer T3418.
{1334, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1334, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
{1334, 3} This is to allow the network to obtain the IMSI from the UE.
{1334, 4} The network may then check that the GUTI originally used in the authentication challenge corresponded to the correct IMSI.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1334, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", to the network and start the timer T3418.
{1334, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1334, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
{1334, 3} This is to allow the network to obtain the IMSI from the UE.
{1334, 4} The network may then check that the GUTI originally used in the authentication challenge corresponded to the correct IMSI.
{1334, 5} Upon receipt of the IDENTITY REQUEST message from the network, the UE shall send the IDENTITY RESPONSE message.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1335, 0} If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was incorrect, the network should respond by sending a new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1335, 0} If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was incorrect, the network should respond by sending a new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE.
{1335, 1} Upon receiving the new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message from the network, the UE shall stop the timer T3418, if running, and then process the challenge information as normal.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1335, 0} If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was incorrect, the network should respond by sending a new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE.
{1335, 1} Upon receiving the new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message from the network, the UE shall stop the timer T3418, if running, and then process the challenge information as normal.
{1335, 2} If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was correct, the network should terminate the authentication procedure by sending an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1336, 0} It can be assumed that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine if any of the following occur:
{1337, 0} the timer T3418 expires;
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1336, 0} It can be assumed that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine if any of the following occur:
{1338, 0} the UE detects any combination of the authentication failures: EMM causes #20 "MAC failure", #21 "synch failure" or #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", during three consecutive authentication challenges.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1336, 0} It can be assumed that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine if any of the following occur:
{1338, 0} the UE detects any combination of the authentication failures: EMM causes #20 "MAC failure", #21 "synch failure" or #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", during three consecutive authentication challenges.
{1338, 1} The authentication challenges shall be considered as consecutive only, if the authentication challenges causing the second and third authentication failure are received by the UE, while the timer T3418 or T3420 started after the previous authentication failure is running.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1339, 0} The UE shall stop timer T3420, if the timer is running and the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode, e.g. upon detection of a lower layer failure, release of the NAS signalling connection, or as the result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode or Iu mode.
---

{1333, 0} Authentication failure:
{1340, 0} When it has been deemed by the UE that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine, the UE shall proceed as described in item f.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1342, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #21 "synch failure", to the network and start the timer T3420.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1342, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #21 "synch failure", to the network and start the timer T3420.
{1342, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1342, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #21 "synch failure", to the network and start the timer T3420.
{1342, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1342, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with the EMM cause #21 "synch failure", the network shall use the returned AUTS parameter from the authentication failure parameter IE in the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, to re-synchronise.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1342, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #21 "synch failure", to the network and start the timer T3420.
{1342, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1342, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with the EMM cause #21 "synch failure", the network shall use the returned AUTS parameter from the authentication failure parameter IE in the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, to re-synchronise.
{1342, 3} The re-synchronisation procedure requires the MME to delete all unused authentication vectors for that IMSI and obtain new vectors from the HSS.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1342, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #21 "synch failure", to the network and start the timer T3420.
{1342, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1342, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with the EMM cause #21 "synch failure", the network shall use the returned AUTS parameter from the authentication failure parameter IE in the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, to re-synchronise.
{1342, 3} The re-synchronisation procedure requires the MME to delete all unused authentication vectors for that IMSI and obtain new vectors from the HSS.
{1342, 4} When re-synchronisation is complete, the network shall initiate the authentication procedure.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1342, 0} The UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, with EMM cause #21 "synch failure", to the network and start the timer T3420.
{1342, 1} Furthermore, the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running.
{1342, 2} Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with the EMM cause #21 "synch failure", the network shall use the returned AUTS parameter from the authentication failure parameter IE in the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, to re-synchronise.
{1342, 3} The re-synchronisation procedure requires the MME to delete all unused authentication vectors for that IMSI and obtain new vectors from the HSS.
{1342, 4} When re-synchronisation is complete, the network shall initiate the authentication procedure.
{1342, 5} Upon receipt of the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, the UE shall stop the timer T3420, if running.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1343, 0} If the network is validated successfully while T3420 is running, the UE shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network and shall start any retransmission timers, if they were running and stopped when the UE received the first failed AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1344, 0} If the UE receives the second AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message while T3420 is running, and the MAC value cannot be resolved, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in item c or if the message contains a UMTS authentication challenge, the UE shall proceed as specified in item d; if the SQN is invalid, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in this subclause, item e, starting again from the beginning.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1345, 0} The UE shall deem that the network has failed the authentication check and proceed as described in item f if any of the following occurs:
{1346, 0} the timer T3420 expires;
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1345, 0} The UE shall deem that the network has failed the authentication check and proceed as described in item f if any of the following occurs:
{1347, 0} the UE detects any combination of the authentication failures: EMM cause #20 "MAC failure", #21 "synch failure", or #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", during three consecutive authentication challenges.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1345, 0} The UE shall deem that the network has failed the authentication check and proceed as described in item f if any of the following occurs:
{1347, 0} the UE detects any combination of the authentication failures: EMM cause #20 "MAC failure", #21 "synch failure", or #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", during three consecutive authentication challenges.
{1347, 1} The authentication challenges shall be considered as consecutive only if the authentication challenges causing the second and third authentication failure are received by the UE while the timer T3418 or T3420 started after the previous authentication failure is running.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1348, 0} When it has been deemed by the UE that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine, the UE shall proceed as described in item f.
---

{1341, 0} Authentication failure:
{1349, 0} Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, the UE shall perform the actions as specified in subclause 5.4.2.5.
---

{1350, 0} Network failing the authentication check:
{1351, 0} If the UE deems that the network has failed the authentication check, then it shall request RRC to locally release the RRC connection and treat the active cell as barred.
---

{1350, 0} Network failing the authentication check:
{1351, 0} If the UE deems that the network has failed the authentication check, then it shall request RRC to locally release the RRC connection and treat the active cell as barred.
{1351, 1} The UE shall start any retransmission timers, if they were running and stopped when the UE received the first AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message containing an incorrect authentication challenge data causing the authentication failure.
---

{1352, 0} Transmission failure of AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message or AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message indication from lower layers
{1353, 0} The UE shall stop any of the timers T3418 and T3420, if running, and re-initiate the tracking area updating procedure.
---

{1354, 0} Transmission failure of AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message or AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{1355, 0} The UE shall stop any of the timers T3418 and T3420, if running.
---

{1354, 0} Transmission failure of AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message or AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{1356, 0} If the current TAI is not in the TAI list, the authentication procedure shall be aborted and a tracking area updating procedure shall be initiated.
---

{1354, 0} Transmission failure of AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message or AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{1357, 0} If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list, it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the authentication procedure.
---

{1358, 0} Transmission failure of AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message or AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message indication without TAI change from lower layers
{1359, 0} The UE shall stop any of the timers T3418 and T3420, if running.
---

{1358, 0} Transmission failure of AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message or AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message indication without TAI change from lower layers
{1359, 0} The UE shall stop any of the timers T3418 and T3420, if running.
{1359, 1} It is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the authentication procedure.
---

{1360, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{1361, 0} If the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
---

{1360, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{1361, 0} If the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
{1361, 1} If a failure of handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
---

{1362, 0} Change of cell into a new tracking area
{1363, 0} If a cell change into a new tracking area that is not in the TAI list occurs before the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message is sent, the UE may discard sending the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network and continue with the initiation of tracking area updating procedure as described in subclause 5.5.3.
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1365, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1365, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
{1365, 1} The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1365, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
{1365, 1} The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
{1365, 2} The MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure.
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1365, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
{1365, 1} The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
{1365, 2} The MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure.
{1365, 3} If there is an ongoing PDN connectivity procedure, the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts upon completion of the PDN connectivity procedure.
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1365, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
{1365, 1} The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
{1365, 2} The MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure.
{1365, 3} If there is an ongoing PDN connectivity procedure, the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts upon completion of the PDN connectivity procedure.
{1365, 4} The network shall consider the UE to be attached for emergency bearer services only.
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1365, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
{1365, 1} The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
{1365, 2} The MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure.
{1365, 3} If there is an ongoing PDN connectivity procedure, the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts upon completion of the PDN connectivity procedure.
{1365, 4} The network shall consider the UE to be attached for emergency bearer services only.
{1366, 0} If a UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services and sends an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the MME with the EMM cause appropriate for these cases and receives the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message before the timeout of timer T3418 or T3420, the UE shall deem that the network has passed the authentication check successfully, stop timer T3418 or T3420, respectively, and execute the security mode control procedure.
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1365, 0} Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
{1365, 1} The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
{1365, 2} The MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure.
{1365, 3} If there is an ongoing PDN connectivity procedure, the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts upon completion of the PDN connectivity procedure.
{1365, 4} The network shall consider the UE to be attached for emergency bearer services only.
{1367, 0} If a UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services when timer T3418 or T3420 expires, the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f. Instead the UE shall continue using the current security context, if any, deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating UE requested PDN disconnect procedure.
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1371, 0} Depending on local regulation and operator policy, if the UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
{1371, 1} The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
{1371, 2} The network shall consider the UE to be attached for access to RLOS.
{1373, 0} If a UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS when timer T3418 or T3420 expires, the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f. Instead the UE shall continue using the current security context, if any.
{1373, 1} The UE shall start any retransmission timers if, they were running and stopped when the UE received the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message and detected an authentication failure;
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1371, 0} Depending on local regulation and operator policy, if the UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
{1371, 1} The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
{1371, 2} The network shall consider the UE to be attached for access to RLOS.
{1373, 0} If a UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS when timer T3418 or T3420 expires, the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f. Instead the UE shall continue using the current security context, if any.
{1373, 1} The UE shall start any retransmission timers if, the procedures associated with these timers have not yet been completed.
---

{1364, 0} For items c, d, and e:
{1371, 0} Depending on local regulation and operator policy, if the UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
{1371, 1} The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
{1371, 2} The network shall consider the UE to be attached for access to RLOS.
{1376, 0} The UE shall consider itself to be attached for access to RLOS.
---

{1379, 0} The purpose of the NAS security mode control procedure is to take an EPS security context into use, and initialise and start NAS signalling security between the UE and the MME with the corresponding EPS NAS keys and EPS security algorithms.
---

{1380, 0} Furthermore, the network may also initiate the security mode control procedure, in order to change the NAS security algorithms for a current EPS security context already in use;
---

{1380, 0} Furthermore, the network may also initiate the security mode control procedure, in order to change the value of uplink NAS COUNT used in the latest SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19], subclause 7.2.9.2;
---

{1380, 0} Furthermore, the network may also initiate the security mode control procedure, in order to request the UE radio capability ID from the UE.
---

{1384, 0} For restrictions concerning the concurrent running of a security mode control procedure with other security related procedures in the AS or inside the core network see 3GPP TS 33.401 [19], subclause 7.2.10.
---

{1386, 0} The MME initiates the NAS security mode control procedure by sending a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message to the UE and starting timer T3460.
---

{1387, 0} The MME shall reset the downlink NAS COUNT counter and use it to integrity protect the initial SECURITY MODE COMMAND message if the security mode control procedure is initiated, to take into use the EPS security context created after a successful execution of the EPS authentication procedure;
---

{1387, 0} The MME shall reset the downlink NAS COUNT counter and use it to integrity protect the initial SECURITY MODE COMMAND message if the security mode control procedure is initiated, upon receipt of TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message including a GPRS ciphering key sequence number IE, if the MME wishes to create a mapped EPS security context.
---

{1390, 0} The MME shall send the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message unciphered, but shall integrity protect the message with the NAS integrity key based on KASME or mapped K'ASME indicated by the eKSI included in the message.
---

{1390, 0} The MME shall send the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message unciphered, but shall integrity protect the message with the NAS integrity key based on KASME or mapped K'ASME indicated by the eKSI included in the message.
{1390, 1} The MME shall set the security header type of the message to "integrity protected with new EPS security context".

{1409, 0} Upon receipt of a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message including a GPRS ciphering key sequence number IE, if the MME does not have the valid current EPS security context indicated by the UE, the MME shall either, indicate the use of the new mapped EPS security context to the UE by setting the type of security context flag in the NAS key set identifier IE to "mapped security context" and the KSI value related to the security context of the source system;

{1416, 0} If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the MME is initiating a SECURITY MODE COMMAND and the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is received without integrity protection or does not successfully pass the integrity check at the MME, the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] and shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
