{1438, 0} Upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message, the UE shall check whether the security mode command can be accepted or not.
---

{1438, 0} Upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message, the UE shall check whether the security mode command can be accepted or not.
{1438, 1} This is done by performing the integrity check of the message and by checking that the received replayed UE security capabilities, the received replayed UE additional security capabilities, if included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message, and the received nonceUE have not been altered compared to the latest values that the UE sent to the network.
---

{1438, 0} Upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message, the UE shall check whether the security mode command can be accepted or not.
{1438, 1} This is done by performing the integrity check of the message and by checking that the received replayed UE security capabilities, the received replayed UE additional security capabilities, if included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message, and the received nonceUE have not been altered compared to the latest values that the UE sent to the network.
{1438, 2} However, the UE is not required to perform the checking of the received nonceUE if the UE does not want to re-generate the K'ASME.
---

{1438, 0} Upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message, the UE shall check whether the security mode command can be accepted or not.
{1438, 1} This is done by performing the integrity check of the message and by checking that the received replayed UE security capabilities, the received replayed UE additional security capabilities, if included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message, and the received nonceUE have not been altered compared to the latest values that the UE sent to the network.
{1438, 2} However, the UE is not required to perform the checking of the received nonceUE if the UE does not want to re-generate the K'ASME.
{1438, 3} When the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or the UE is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or the UE is requesting attach for access to RLOS, the UE is not required to locally re-generate the KASME.
---

{1439, 0} The UE shall accept a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message indicating the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0 as the selected NAS integrity algorithm only if the message is received for a UE that has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established, or a UE that is attached for access to RLOS, or a UE that is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or a UE that is requesting attach for access to RLOS.
---

{1440, 0} If the type of security context flag included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message is set to "native security context" and if the KSI matches a valid non-current native EPS security context held in the UE while the UE has a mapped EPS security context as the current EPS security context, the UE shall take the non-current native EPS security context into use which then becomes the current native EPS security context and delete the mapped EPS security context.
---

{1441, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall take the EPS security context indicated in the message into use.
---

{1441, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall take the EPS security context indicated in the message into use.
{1441, 1} The UE shall in addition reset the uplink NAS COUNT counter if, the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message is received in order to take an EPS security context into use created after a successful execution of the EPS authentication procedure;
---

{1441, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall take the EPS security context indicated in the message into use.
{1441, 1} The UE shall in addition reset the uplink NAS COUNT counter if, the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message received includes the type of security context flag set to "mapped security context" in the NAS key set identifier IE the eKSI does not match the current EPS security context, if it is a mapped EPS security context.
---

{1444, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted and a new EPS security context is taken into use and SECURITY MODE COMMAND message does not indicate the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0 as the selected NAS integrity algorithm, the UE shall, if the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message has been successfully integrity checked using an estimated downlink NAS COUNT equal 0, then the UE shall set the downlink NAS COUNT of this new EPS security context to 0;
---

{1444, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted and a new EPS security context is taken into use and SECURITY MODE COMMAND message does not indicate the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0 as the selected NAS integrity algorithm, the UE shall, otherwise the UE shall set the downlink NAS COUNT of this new EPS security context to the downlink NAS COUNT that has been used for the successful integrity checking of the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
---

{1447, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message integrity protected with the selected NAS integrity algorithm and the EPS NAS integrity key based on the KASME or mapped K'ASME if the type of security context flag is set to "mapped security context" indicated by the eKSI.
---

{1447, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message integrity protected with the selected NAS integrity algorithm and the EPS NAS integrity key based on the KASME or mapped K'ASME if the type of security context flag is set to "mapped security context" indicated by the eKSI.
{1447, 1} When the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes the type of security context flag set to "mapped security context" in the NAS key set identifier IE, the nonceMME and the nonceUE, then the UE shall either, generate K'ASME from both the nonceMME and the nonceUE as indicated in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19];
---

{1447, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message integrity protected with the selected NAS integrity algorithm and the EPS NAS integrity key based on the KASME or mapped K'ASME if the type of security context flag is set to "mapped security context" indicated by the eKSI.
{1447, 1} When the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes the type of security context flag set to "mapped security context" in the NAS key set identifier IE, the nonceMME and the nonceUE, then the UE shall either, check whether the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message indicates the eKSI of the current EPS security context, if it is a mapped EPS security context, in order not to re-generate the K'ASME.
---

{1450, 0} Furthermore, if the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall cipher the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message with the selected NAS ciphering algorithm and the EPS NAS ciphering key based on the KASME or mapped K'ASME indicated by the eKSI.
---

{1450, 0} Furthermore, if the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall cipher the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message with the selected NAS ciphering algorithm and the EPS NAS ciphering key based on the KASME or mapped K'ASME indicated by the eKSI.
{1450, 1} The UE shall set the security header type of the message to "integrity protected and ciphered with new EPS security context".
---

{1451, 0} From this time onward the UE shall cipher and integrity protect all NAS signalling messages with the selected NAS ciphering and NAS integrity algorithms.
---

{1452, 0} If the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the IMEISV is requested, the UE shall include its IMEISV in the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message.
---

{1453, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested, the UE shall, if the UE has an applicable network-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected PLMN, include the applicable network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the UE radio capability ID IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message;
---

{1453, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested, the UE shall, if the UE, does not have an applicable network-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected PLMN;
---

{1453, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested, the UE shall, if the UE, has an applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration,
---

{1453, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested, the UE shall, if the UE, include the applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID in the UE radio capability ID IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message.
---

{1459, 0} If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes a HASHMME, the UE shall compare HASHMME with a hash value locally calculated as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] from the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message that the UE had sent to initiate the procedure.
---

{1459, 0} If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes a HASHMME, the UE shall compare HASHMME with a hash value locally calculated as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] from the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message that the UE had sent to initiate the procedure.
{1459, 1} If HASHMME and the locally calculated hash value are different, the UE shall include the complete ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message which the UE had previously sent in the Replayed NAS message container IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message.
---

{1461, 0} The MME shall, upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message, stop timer T3460.
---

{1461, 0} The MME shall, upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message, stop timer T3460.
{1461, 1} From this time onward the MME shall integrity protect and encipher all signalling messages with the selected NAS integrity and ciphering algorithms.
---

{1462, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message contains a Replayed NAS container message IE with an ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, the MME shall complete the ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure by considering the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message contained in the Replayed NAS message container IE as the message that triggered the procedure.
---

{1464, 0} If the security mode command cannot be accepted, the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE REJECT message.
---

{1464, 0} If the security mode command cannot be accepted, the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE REJECT message.
{1464, 1} The SECURITY MODE REJECT message contains an EMM cause that typically indicates
{1465, 0} #23:	UE security capabilities mismatch;
---

{1464, 0} If the security mode command cannot be accepted, the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE REJECT message.
{1464, 1} The SECURITY MODE REJECT message contains an EMM cause that typically indicates
{1466, 0} #24:	security mode rejected, unspecified.
---

{1467, 0} Upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE REJECT message, the MME shall stop timer T3460.
---

{1467, 0} Upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE REJECT message, the MME shall stop timer T3460.
{1467, 1} The MME shall also abort the ongoing procedure that triggered the initiation of the NAS security mode control procedure.
---

{1468, 0} Both the UE and the MME shall apply the EPS security context in use before the initiation of the security mode control procedure, if any, to protect the SECURITY MODE REJECT message and any other subsequent messages according to the rules in subclauses 4.4.4 and 4.4.5.
---

{1470, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1471, 0} Transmission failure of SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message or SECURITY MODE REJECT message indication from lower layers
{1472, 0} The UE shall abort the security mode control procedure and re-initiate the tracking area updating procedure.
---

{1470, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1473, 0} Transmission failure of SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message or SECURITY MODE REJECT message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{1474, 0} If the current TAI is not in the TAI list, the security mode control procedure shall be aborted and a tracking area updating procedure shall be initiated.
---

{1470, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1473, 0} Transmission failure of SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message or SECURITY MODE REJECT message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{1475, 0} If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list, the security mode control procedure shall be aborted and it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the security mode control procedure.
---

{1470, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1476, 0} Transmission failure of SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message or SECURITY MODE REJECT message indication without TAI change from lower layers
{1477, 0} The security mode control procedure shall be aborted and it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the security mode control procedure.
---

{1479, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1480, 0} Lower layer failure before the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE or SECURITY MODE REJECT message is received
{1481, 0} The network shall abort the security mode control procedure.
---

{1479, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1482, 0} Expiry of timer T3460
{1483, 0} The network shall, on the first expiry of the timer T3460, retransmit the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message and shall reset and start timer T3460.
---

{1479, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1482, 0} Expiry of timer T3460
{1483, 0} The network shall, on the first expiry of the timer T3460, retransmit the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message and shall reset and start timer T3460.
{1483, 1} This retransmission is repeated four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3460, the procedure shall be aborted.
---

{1479, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1484, 0} Collision between security mode control procedure and attach, service request, tracking area updating procedure or detach procedure not indicating switch off
{1485, 0} The network shall abort the security mode control procedure and proceed with the UE initiated procedure.
---

{1479, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1486, 0} Collision between security mode control procedure and other EMM procedures than in item c
{1487, 0} The network shall progress both procedures.
---

{1479, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1488, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{1489, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
---

{1479, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1488, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{1489, 0} If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
{1489, 1} If a failure of the handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
---

{1492, 0} The identification procedure is used by the network to request a particular UE to provide specific identification parameters, e.g. the International Mobile Subscriber Identity or the International Mobile Equipment Identity.
---

{1492, 0} The identification procedure is used by the network to request a particular UE to provide specific identification parameters, e.g. the International Mobile Subscriber Identity or the International Mobile Equipment Identity.
{1492, 1} IMEI and IMSI definition and structure are specified in 3GPP TS 23.003 [2].
---

{1493, 0} For mobile device supporting both 3GPP access and cdma2000® access a single IMEI is used to identify the device as specified in 3GPP TS 22.278 [1C].
---

{1495, 0} The network initiates the identification procedure by sending an IDENTITY REQUEST message to the UE and starting the timer T3470.
---

{1495, 0} The network initiates the identification procedure by sending an IDENTITY REQUEST message to the UE and starting the timer T3470.
{1495, 1} The IDENTITY REQUEST message specifies the requested identification parameters in the Identity type information element.
---

{1497, 0} A UE shall be ready to respond to an IDENTITY REQUEST message at any time whilst in EMM-CONNECTED mode.
---

{1498, 0} Upon receipt of the IDENTITY REQUEST message the UE shall send an IDENTITY RESPONSE message to the network.
---

{1498, 0} Upon receipt of the IDENTITY REQUEST message the UE shall send an IDENTITY RESPONSE message to the network.
{1498, 1} The IDENTITY RESPONSE message shall contain the identification parameters as requested by the network.
---

{1500, 0} Upon receipt of the IDENTITY RESPONSE the network shall stop the timer T3470.
---

{1502, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1503, 0} Requested identity is not available
{1504, 0} If the UE cannot encode the requested identity in the IDENTITY RESPONSE message, e.g. because no valid USIM is available, then it shall encode the identity type as "no identity".
---

{1502, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1505, 0} Transmission failure of IDENTITY RESPONSE message indication from lower layers
{1506, 0} The UE shall abort the identification procedure and re-initiate the tracking area updating procedure.
---

{1502, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1507, 0} Transmission failure of IDENTITY RESPONSE message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{1508, 0} If the current TAI is not in the TAI list, the identification procedure shall be aborted and a tracking area updating procedure shall be initiated.
---

{1502, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1507, 0} Transmission failure of IDENTITY RESPONSE message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{1509, 0} If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list, the identification procedure shall be aborted and it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the identification procedure.
---

{1502, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1510, 0} Transmission failure of IDENTITY RESPONSE message indication without TAI change from lower layers
{1511, 0} The identification procedure shall be aborted and it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the identification procedure.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1514, 0} Lower layer failure
{1515, 0} Upon detection of a lower layer failure before the IDENTITY RESPONSE is received, the network shall abort any ongoing EMM procedure.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1516, 0} Expiry of timer T3470
{1517, 0} The identification procedure is supervised by the network by the timer T3470.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1516, 0} Expiry of timer T3470
{1517, 0} The identification procedure is supervised by the network by the timer T3470.
{1517, 1} The network shall, on the first expiry of the timer T3470, retransmit the IDENTITY REQUEST message and reset and restart the timer T3470.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1516, 0} Expiry of timer T3470
{1517, 0} The identification procedure is supervised by the network by the timer T3470.
{1517, 1} The network shall, on the first expiry of the timer T3470, retransmit the IDENTITY REQUEST message and reset and restart the timer T3470.
{1517, 2} This retransmission is repeated four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3470, the network shall abort the identification procedure and any ongoing EMM procedure.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1518, 0} Collision of an identification procedure with an attach procedure
{1519, 0} If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed and no attach procedure is pending on the network, the network shall proceed with the attach procedure.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1520, 0} Collision of an identification procedure with an attach procedure when the identification procedure has been caused by an attach procedure
{1521, 0} If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed and an attach procedure is pending, then:
{1522, 0} If one or more of the information elements in the ATTACH REQUEST message differ from the ones received within the previous ATTACH REQUEST message, the network shall proceed with the new attach procedure;
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1520, 0} Collision of an identification procedure with an attach procedure when the identification procedure has been caused by an attach procedure
{1521, 0} If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed and an attach procedure is pending, then:
{1523, 0} If the information elements do not differ, then the network shall not treat any further this new ATTACH REQUEST.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1524, 0} Collision of an identification procedure with a UE initiated detach procedure
{1525, 0} Detach containing cause "switch off" within the Detach type IE:
{1526, 0} If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the identification procedure and shall progress the detach procedure.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1524, 0} Collision of an identification procedure with a UE initiated detach procedure
{1527, 0} Detach containing other causes than "switch off" within the Detach type IE:
{1528, 0} If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall complete the identification procedure and shall respond to the detach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.2.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1529, 0} Collision of an identification procedure with a tracking area updating procedure
{1530, 0} If the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall progress both procedures.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1531, 0} Collision of an identification procedure with a service request procedure
{1532, 0} If the network receives an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for CS fallback or 1xCS fallback before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall progress both procedures.
---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

---

{1513, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

{1534, 0} If the IDENTITY REQUEST message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the IDENTITY REQUEST message.

{1537, 0} The purpose of sending the EMM INFORMATION message is to allow the network to provide information to the UE.
---

{1537, 0} The purpose of sending the EMM INFORMATION message is to allow the network to provide information to the UE.
{1537, 1} The message implementation is optional in the network.
---

{1537, 0} The purpose of sending the EMM INFORMATION message is to allow the network to provide information to the UE.
{1537, 1} The message implementation is optional in the network.
{1537, 2} The UE may use the received information if the UE supports implementing this message.
---

{1538, 0} The EMM information procedure may be invoked by the network at any time during an established EMM context.
---

{1540, 0} The EMM information procedure consists only of the EMM INFORMATION message sent from the network to the UE.
---

{1540, 0} The EMM information procedure consists only of the EMM INFORMATION message sent from the network to the UE.
{1540, 1} During an established EMM context, the network may send none, one, or more EMM INFORMATION messages to the UE.
---

{1540, 0} The EMM information procedure consists only of the EMM INFORMATION message sent from the network to the UE.
{1540, 1} During an established EMM context, the network may send none, one, or more EMM INFORMATION messages to the UE.
{1540, 2} If more than one EMM INFORMATION message is sent, the messages need not have the same content.
---

{1542, 0} When the UE receives an EMM INFORMATION message, it shall accept the message and optionally use the contents to update appropriate information stored within the UE.
---

{1543, 0} If the UE does not support the EMM information message the UE shall ignore the contents of the message and return an EMM STATUS message with EMM cause #97 "message type non-existent or not implemented".
---

{1551, 0} The attach procedure is used to attach to an EPC for packet services in EPS.
---

{1552, 0} The attach procedure is used for the following purposes:
{1553, 0} by a UE in PS mode of operation to attach for EPS services only;
---

{1552, 0} The attach procedure is used for the following purposes:
{1554, 0} by a UE in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation to attach for both EPS and non-EPS services;
---

{1552, 0} The attach procedure is used for the following purposes:
{1555, 0} by a UE supporting NB-S1 mode only in PS mode of operation to attach for EPS services and "SMS only";
---

{1552, 0} The attach procedure is used for the following purposes:
{1556, 0} to attach for emergency bearer services;
---

{1552, 0} The attach procedure is used for the following purposes:
{1557, 0} an attach for access to RLOS.
---

{1558, 0} The lower layers indicate to NAS that the network does not support emergency bearer services for the UE in limited service state.
---

{1558, 0} The lower layers indicate to NAS that the network does not support emergency bearer services for the UE in limited service state.
{1558, 1} This information is taken into account when deciding whether to initiate attach for emergency bearer services in WB-S1 mode.
---

{1559, 0} If the MME does not support an attach for emergency bearer services, the MME shall reject any request to attach with an attach type set to "EPS emergency attach".
---

{1560, 0} The lower layers may indicate to NAS whether the network supports access to RLOS.
---

{1560, 0} The lower layers may indicate to NAS whether the network supports access to RLOS.
{1560, 1} This information is taken into account when deciding whether to initiate attach for access to RLOS in WB-S1 mode.
---

{1561, 0} With a successful attach procedure, a context is established for the UE in the MME.
---

{1561, 0} With a successful attach procedure, a context is established for the UE in the MME.
{1561, 1} Furthermore, if the UE requested PDN connectivity, a default bearer is established between the UE and the PDN GW, thus enabling always-on IP connectivity to the UE.
---

{1561, 0} With a successful attach procedure, a context is established for the UE in the MME.
{1561, 1} Furthermore, if the UE requested PDN connectivity, a default bearer is established between the UE and the PDN GW, thus enabling always-on IP connectivity to the UE.
{1561, 2} In WB-S1 mode, the network may also initiate the activation of dedicated bearers as part of the attach procedure.
---

{1561, 0} With a successful attach procedure, a context is established for the UE in the MME.
{1561, 1} Furthermore, if the UE requested PDN connectivity, a default bearer is established between the UE and the PDN GW, thus enabling always-on IP connectivity to the UE.
{1561, 2} In WB-S1 mode, the network may also initiate the activation of dedicated bearers as part of the attach procedure.
{1561, 3} In NB-S1 mode the network shall not initiate the activation of dedicated bearers.
---

{1562, 0} With a successful attach procedure in NB-S1 mode, a context is established for the UE in the MME.
---

{1562, 0} With a successful attach procedure in NB-S1 mode, a context is established for the UE in the MME.
{1562, 1} If the attach request included information to request PDN connectivity, a default bearer is also established between the UE and the PDN.
---

{1563, 0} If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME, a default bearer need not be requested by the UE during the attach procedure.
---

{1563, 0} If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME, a default bearer need not be requested by the UE during the attach procedure.
{1563, 1} If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, then the UE shall request establishment of a default bearer.
---

{1564, 0} During the attach procedure with default bearer establishment, the UE may also obtain the home agent IPv4 or IPv6 address or both.
---

{1565, 0} In a shared network, the UE shall choose one of the PLMN identities as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{1565, 0} In a shared network, the UE shall choose one of the PLMN identities as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{1565, 1} The UE shall construct the TAI of the cell from this chosen PLMN identity and the TAC received for this PLMN identity as part of the broadcast system information.
---

{1565, 0} In a shared network, the UE shall choose one of the PLMN identities as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{1565, 1} The UE shall construct the TAI of the cell from this chosen PLMN identity and the TAC received for this PLMN identity as part of the broadcast system information.
{1565, 2} The chosen PLMN identity shall be indicated to the E-UTRAN.
---

{1565, 0} In a shared network, the UE shall choose one of the PLMN identities as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{1565, 1} The UE shall construct the TAI of the cell from this chosen PLMN identity and the TAC received for this PLMN identity as part of the broadcast system information.
{1565, 2} The chosen PLMN identity shall be indicated to the E-UTRAN.
{1565, 3} Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause #11 "PLMN not allowed" is received by the UE, the chosen PLMN identity shall be stored in the "forbidden PLMN list" and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
---

{1565, 0} In a shared network, the UE shall choose one of the PLMN identities as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{1565, 1} The UE shall construct the TAI of the cell from this chosen PLMN identity and the TAC received for this PLMN identity as part of the broadcast system information.
{1565, 2} The chosen PLMN identity shall be indicated to the E-UTRAN.
{1565, 3} Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause #11 "PLMN not allowed" is received by the UE, the chosen PLMN identity shall be stored in the "forbidden PLMN list" and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
{1565, 4} Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause #14 "EPS services not allowed in this PLMN" is received by the UE, the chosen PLMN identity shall be stored in the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
---

{1565, 0} In a shared network, the UE shall choose one of the PLMN identities as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{1565, 1} The UE shall construct the TAI of the cell from this chosen PLMN identity and the TAC received for this PLMN identity as part of the broadcast system information.
{1565, 2} The chosen PLMN identity shall be indicated to the E-UTRAN.
{1565, 3} Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause #11 "PLMN not allowed" is received by the UE, the chosen PLMN identity shall be stored in the "forbidden PLMN list" and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
{1565, 4} Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause #14 "EPS services not allowed in this PLMN" is received by the UE, the chosen PLMN identity shall be stored in the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
{1565, 5} Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message is received by the UE with the EMM cause #12 "tracking area not allowed", #13 "roaming not allowed in this tracking area", or #15 "no suitable cells in tracking area", the constructed TAI shall be stored in the suitable list.

{1566, 2} Depending on the value of the attach attempt counter, specific actions shall be performed.
---

{1566, 2} Depending on the value of the attach attempt counter, specific actions shall be performed.
{1566, 3} The attach attempt counter shall be reset when, the UE is powered on;

{1582, 0} This procedure can be used by a UE to attach for:
{1583, 0} EPS services only;
---

{1582, 0} This procedure can be used by a UE to attach for:
{1584, 0} EPS services and "SMS only" if the UE supports NB-S1 mode only.
---

{1585, 0} When the UE initiates the attach procedure for normal service, the UE shall indicate "EPS attach" in the EPS attach type IE.
---

{1586, 0} When the UE initiates the attach procedure for emergency bearer services, the UE shall indicate "EPS emergency attach" in the EPS attach type IE.

{1586, 1} The attach procedure for emergency bearer services is not applicable for NB-S1 mode.

---

{1590, 0} In state EMM-DEREGISTERED, the UE initiates the attach procedure by sending an ATTACH REQUEST message to the MME, starting timer T3410 and entering state EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED.
---

{1590, 0} In state EMM-DEREGISTERED, the UE initiates the attach procedure by sending an ATTACH REQUEST message to the MME, starting timer T3410 and entering state EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED.
{1590, 1} If timer T3402 is currently running, the UE shall stop timer T3402.
---

{1590, 0} In state EMM-DEREGISTERED, the UE initiates the attach procedure by sending an ATTACH REQUEST message to the MME, starting timer T3410 and entering state EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED.
{1590, 1} If timer T3402 is currently running, the UE shall stop timer T3402.
{1590, 2} If timer T3411 is currently running, the UE shall stop timer T3411.
---

{1591, 0} The UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message if the selected PLMN is neither the registered PLMN nor in the list of equivalent PLMNs and, the UE is configured for "AttachWithIMSI" as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [15A] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [17];
---

{1591, 0} The UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message if the selected PLMN is neither the registered PLMN nor in the list of equivalent PLMNs and, the UE is in NB-S1 mode.
---

{1594, 0} For all other cases, the UE shall handle the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message as follows:
{1595, 0} if the UE operating in the single-registration mode is performing an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or the UE was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and, the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface supported" from the network and, if the UE holds a valid GUTI, the UE shall include the valid GUTI into the EPS mobile identity IE, include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI" and include the UE status IE with a 5GMM registration status set to "UE is in 5GMM-REGISTERED state" if the UE is in 5GMM-REGISTERED state;
---

{1594, 0} For all other cases, the UE shall handle the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message as follows:
{1595, 0} if the UE operating in the single-registration mode is performing an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or the UE was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and, the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface supported" from the network and, if the UE holds a valid GUTI, the UE shall include the valid GUTI into the EPS mobile identity IE, include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI" and include the UE status IE with a 5GMM registration status set to "UE is in 5GMM-DEREGISTERED state" if the UE is in 5GMM-DEREGISTERED state;
---

{1594, 0} For all other cases, the UE shall handle the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message as follows:
{1595, 0} if the UE operating in the single-registration mode is performing an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or the UE was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and, the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface supported" from the network and, if the UE does not hold a valid GUTI, the UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE;
---

{1594, 0} For all other cases, the UE shall handle the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message as follows:
{1595, 0} if the UE operating in the single-registration mode is performing an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or the UE was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and, the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" from the network and, if the UE holds a valid 5G-GUTI, the UE shall include a GUTI, mapped from 5G-GUTI into the EPS mobile identity IE, include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI" and include the UE status IE with a 5GMM registration status set to "UE is in 5GMM-DEREGISTERED state";
---

{1594, 0} For all other cases, the UE shall handle the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message as follows:
{1595, 0} if the UE operating in the single-registration mode is performing an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or the UE was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and, the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" from the network and, if the UE holds a valid GUTI and does not hold a valid 5G-GUTI, the UE shall indicate the GUTI in the EPS mobile identity IE and include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI";
---

{1594, 0} For all other cases, the UE shall handle the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message as follows:
{1595, 0} if the UE operating in the single-registration mode is performing an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or the UE was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and, the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" from the network and, if the UE holds neither a valid GUTI nor a vaild 5G-GUTI, the UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE;
---

{1594, 0} For all other cases, the UE shall handle the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message as follows:
{1604, 0} otherwise, if the UE supports neither A/Gb mode nor Iu mode, the UE shall include in the ATTACH REQUEST message a valid GUTI together with the last visited registered TAI, if available.
---

{1594, 0} For all other cases, the UE shall handle the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message as follows:
{1604, 0} otherwise, if the UE supports neither A/Gb mode nor Iu mode, the UE shall include in the ATTACH REQUEST message a valid GUTI together with the last visited registered TAI, if available.
{1605, 1} In addition, the UE shall include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI".

{1594, 0} For all other cases, the UE shall handle the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message as follows:

{1643, 0} If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, or if the UE wants to request PDN connection with the attach procedure, the UE shall send the ATTACH REQUEST message together with a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message contained in the ESM message container IE.

{1654, 0} The network may initiate EMM common procedures, e.g. the identification, authentication and security mode control procedures during the attach procedure, depending on the information received in the ATTACH REQUEST message.
---

{1655, 0} If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message containing the Old GUTI type IE and the EPS mobile identity IE with type of identity indicating "GUTI", and the network does not follow the use of the most significant bit of the <MME group id> as specified in 3GPP TS 23.003 [2], subclause 2.8.2.2.2, the network shall use the Old GUTI type IE to determine whether the mobile identity included in the EPS mobile identity IE is a native GUTI or a mapped GUTI.
---

{1656, 0} During an attach for emergency bearer services or an attach for access to RLOS, the MME may choose to skip the authentication procedure even if no EPS security context is available and proceed directly to the execution of the security mode control procedure as specified in subclause 5.4.3.
---

{1658, 0} During an attach for emergency bearer services, if not restricted by local regulations, the MME shall not check for mobility and access restrictions, regional restrictions, subscription restrictions, or perform CSG access control when processing the ATTACH REQUEST message.
---

{1658, 0} During an attach for emergency bearer services, if not restricted by local regulations, the MME shall not check for mobility and access restrictions, regional restrictions, subscription restrictions, or perform CSG access control when processing the ATTACH REQUEST message.
{1658, 1} The network shall not apply subscribed APN based congestion control during an attach procedure for emergency bearer services.
---

{1659, 0} During an attach for access to RLOS, the MME shall not check for access restrictions, regional restrictions and subscription restrictions when processing the ATTACH REQUEST message.
---

{1660, 0} If the attach request is accepted by the network, the MME shall send an ATTACH ACCEPT message to the UE and start timer T3450.

{1661, 0} If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, otherwise, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message contained in the ESM message container information element to activate the default bearer.

{1669, 0} If the attach request is accepted by the network, the MME shall delete the stored UE radio capability information or the UE radio capability ID, if any.

{1674, 0} In NB-S1 mode, if the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE, supports NB-S1 mode only and the MME decides to accept the attach request for EPS services and "SMS only", the MME shall indicate "SMS only" in the Additional update result IE and shall set the EPS attach result IE to "EPS only" in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.

{1679, 0} then the MME shall determine the negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE, store it in the EMM context of the UE, and if the UE is not attaching for emergency bearer services, the MME shall include it in the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.

{1684, 0} If the UE indicates support for EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME supports EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection, the MME shall indicate support for EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1684, 0} If the UE indicates support for EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME supports EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection, the MME shall indicate support for EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
{1684, 1} The UE and the MME shall use the information whether the peer entity supports EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection as specified in the present clause 5 and in clause 6.
---

{1685, 0} If the UE requests "control plane CIoT EPS optimization" in the Additional update type IE, indicates support of control plane CIoT EPS optimization in the UE network capability IE and the MME decides to accept the requested CIoT EPS optimization and the attach request, the MME shall indicate "control plane CIoT EPS optimization supported" in the EPS network feature support IE.
---

{1686, 0} If the MME supports NB-S1 mode, Non-IP or Ethernet PDN type, inter-system change with 5GS or the network wants to enforce the use of DNS over TLS, then the MME shall support the extended protocol configuration options IE.
---

{1687, 0} If the MME supports the extended protocol configuration options IE and the UE indicated support of the extended protocol configuration options IE, then the MME shall set the ePCO bit to "extended protocol configuration options supported" in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1688, 0} If the UE indicates support for restriction on use of enhanced coverage in the ATTACH REQUEST message, and the network decides to restrict the use of enhanced coverage for the UE, then the MME shall set the RestrictEC bit to "Use of enhanced coverage is restricted" in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1689, 0} If the UE has indicated support for the control plane data back-off timer, and the MME decides to activate the congestion control for transport of user data via the control plane, then the MME shall include the T3448 value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1690, 0} If the UE indicates support for dual connectivity with NR in the ATTACH REQUEST message, and the MME decides to restrict the use of dual connectivity with NR for the UE, then the MME shall set the RestrictDCNR bit to "Use of dual connectivity with NR is restricted" in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1691, 0} If the UE indicates support for N1 mode in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME supports inter-system interworking with 5GS, the MME may set the IWK N26 bit to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" if the MME supports N26 interface in the EPS network feature support IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1692, 0} If the UE indicates support for N1 mode in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME supports inter-system interworking with 5GS, the MME may set the IWK N26 bit to "interworking without N26 interface supported" if the MME does not support N26 interface in the EPS network feature support IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1693, 0} If the UE requests ciphering keys for ciphered broadcast assistance data in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME has valid ciphering key data applicable to the UE's subscription, then the MME shall include the ciphering key data in the Ciphering key data IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1694, 0} If due to operator policies unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed in the current PLMN, the MME shall set the redir-policy bit to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" in the Network policy IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1695, 0} The MME may include the T3447 value IE set to the service gap time value in the ATTACH ACCEPT message if, the UE has indicated support for service gap control;
---

{1695, 0} The MME may include the T3447 value IE set to the service gap time value in the ATTACH ACCEPT message if, a service gap time value is available in the EMM context.
---

{1698, 0} If the network supports signalling for a maximum number of 15 EPS bearer contexts and the UE indicated support of signalling for a maximum number of 15 EPS bearer contexts in the ATTACH REQUEST message, then the MME shall set the 15 bearers bit to "Signalling for a maximum number of 15 EPS bearer contexts supported" in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
---

{1699, 0} Upon receiving the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall stop timer T3410.

{1700, 0} The GUTI reallocation may be part of the attach procedure.
---

{1700, 0} The GUTI reallocation may be part of the attach procedure.
{1700, 1} When the ATTACH REQUEST message includes the IMSI or IMEI, or the MME considers the GUTI provided by the UE is invalid, or the GUTI provided by the UE was assigned by another MME, the MME shall allocate a new GUTI to the UE.
---

{1700, 0} The GUTI reallocation may be part of the attach procedure.
{1700, 1} When the ATTACH REQUEST message includes the IMSI or IMEI, or the MME considers the GUTI provided by the UE is invalid, or the GUTI provided by the UE was assigned by another MME, the MME shall allocate a new GUTI to the UE.
{1700, 2} The MME shall include in the ATTACH ACCEPT message the new assigned GUTI together with the assigned TAI list.
---

{1700, 0} The GUTI reallocation may be part of the attach procedure.
{1700, 1} When the ATTACH REQUEST message includes the IMSI or IMEI, or the MME considers the GUTI provided by the UE is invalid, or the GUTI provided by the UE was assigned by another MME, the MME shall allocate a new GUTI to the UE.
{1700, 2} The MME shall include in the ATTACH ACCEPT message the new assigned GUTI together with the assigned TAI list.
{1700, 3} In this case the MME shall enter state EMM-COMMON-PROCEDURE-INITIATED as described in subclause 5.4.1.

{1701, 1} The MME indicates the selected core network operator PLMN identity to the UE in the GUTI.

---

{1702, 1} The UE shall delete its old GUTI and store the new assigned GUTI.
---

{1702, 0} If the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains a GUTI, the UE shall use this GUTI as the new temporary identity.

{1707, 3} In addition, the UE shall add to the stored list the PLMN code of the registered PLMN that sent the list.
{1707, 4} The UE shall replace the stored list on each receipt of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.

{1707, 0} The MME may also include a list of equivalent PLMNs in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
{1707, 1} Each entry in the list contains a PLMN code.
{1707, 2} The UE shall store the list as provided by the network, and if the attach procedure is neither for emergency bearer services nor for access to RLOS, the UE shall remove from the list any PLMN code that is already in the list of "forbidden PLMNs" or in the list of "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service".
{1707, 3} In addition, the UE shall add to the stored list the PLMN code of the registered PLMN that sent the list.
{1707, 4} The UE shall replace the stored list on each receipt of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
{1707, 5} If the ATTACH ACCEPT message does not contain a list, then the UE shall delete the stored list.

{1709, 0} The network informs the UE about the support of specific features, such as IMS voice over PS session, location services, emergency bearer services, or CIoT EPS optimizations, in the EPS network feature support information element.

---

{1709, 0} The network informs the UE about the support of specific features, such as IMS voice over PS session, location services, emergency bearer services, or CIoT EPS optimizations, in the EPS network feature support information element.
{1709, 1} In a UE with IMS voice over PS capability, the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator shall be provided to the upper layers.

{1709, 3} When initiating an emergency call, the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection.
---

{1709, 0} The network informs the UE about the support of specific features, such as IMS voice over PS session, location services, emergency bearer services, or CIoT EPS optimizations, in the EPS network feature support information element.

{1709, 3} When initiating an emergency call, the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection.

---

{1709, 0} The network informs the UE about the support of specific features, such as IMS voice over PS session, location services, emergency bearer services, or CIoT EPS optimizations, in the EPS network feature support information element.
{1709, 1} In a UE with IMS voice over PS capability, the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator shall be provided to the upper layers.
{1709, 2} The upper layers take the IMS voice over PS session indicator into account as specified in 3GPP TS 23.221 [8A], subclause 7.2a and subclause 7.2b, when selecting the access domain for voice sessions or calls.
{1709, 3} When initiating an emergency call, the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection.
{1709, 4} In a UE with LCS capability, location services indicators shall be provided to the upper layers.
{1709, 5} When MO-LR procedure is triggered by the UE's application, those indicators are taken into account as specified in 3GPP TS 24.171 [13C].

{1751, 0} The UE shall not attempt normal attach or tracking area updating procedures indicating "SMS only" with current PLMN until switching off the UE or the UICC containing the USIM is removed.

{1748, 0} "SMS services not available in this PLMN"

{1760, 0} Other values and the case that no SMS services status IE was received are considered as abnormal cases.

{1762, 0} If the attach request cannot be accepted by the network, the MME shall send an ATTACH REJECT message to the UE including an appropriate EMM cause value.
---

{1763, 0} If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, the attach request included a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message, the attach procedure fails due to, a default EPS bearer setup failure;
---

{1763, 0} If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, the attach request included a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message, the attach procedure fails due to, an ESM procedure failure;
---

{1763, 0} If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, the attach request included a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message, the attach procedure fails due to, operator determined barring is applied on default EPS bearer context activation during attach procedure,
---

{1767, 0} the MME shall, combine the ATTACH REJECT message with a PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message contained in the ESM message container information element.
---

{1768, 1} In this case the EMM cause value in the ATTACH REJECT message shall be set to #19 "ESM failure";
---

{1767, 0} the MME shall, send the ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause set to #15 "No suitable cells in tracking area", if the PDN connectivity reject is due to ESM cause #29 subject to operator policies.
---

{1767, 0} the MME shall, send the ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause set to #15 "No suitable cells in tracking area", if the PDN connectivity reject is due to ESM cause #29 subject to operator policies.
{1769, 1} In this case, the network may additionally include the Extended EMM cause IE with value "E-UTRAN not allowed".
---

{1770, 0} If the attach request is rejected due to NAS level mobility management congestion control, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and assign a value for back-off timer T3346.
---

{1771, 0} In NB-S1 mode, if the attach request is rejected due to operator determined barring, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and assign a value for back-off timer T3346.
---

{1772, 0} If the attach request is rejected due to service gap control as specified in subclause 5.3.17 i.e. the T3447 timer is running, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and may assign a back-off timer T3346 with the remaining time of the running T3447 timer.
---

{1773, 0} If the attach request is rejected due to incompatibility between the CIoT EPS optimizations supported by the UE and what the network supports and the network sets the EMM cause value to #15 "no suitable cells in tracking area", the network may additionally include the Extended EMM cause IE with value "requested EPS optimization not supported".
---

{1774, 0} Based on operator policy, if the attach request is rejected due to core network redirection for CIoT optimizations, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #31 "Redirection to 5GCN required".
---

{1775, 0} Upon receiving the ATTACH REJECT message, if the message is integrity protected or contains a reject cause other than EMM cause value #25, the UE shall stop timer T3410.
---

{1776, 0} If the ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25 was received without integrity protection, then the UE shall discard the message.

{1805, 0} In S1 mode, the UE shall store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming".
{1805, 1} If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1803, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #13	;
{1805, 0} In S1 mode, the UE shall store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming".
{1805, 1} If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message.
{1805, 2} Additionally, the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE or optionally EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1803, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #13	;
{1805, 0} In S1 mode, the UE shall store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming".
{1805, 1} If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message.
{1805, 2} Additionally, the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE or optionally EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH.
{1805, 3} If the UE is registered in N1 mode and operating in dual-registration mode, the PLMN that the UE chooses to register in is specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] subclause 4.8.3.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1803, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #13	;
{1805, 0} In S1 mode, the UE shall store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming".
{1805, 1} If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message.
{1805, 2} Additionally, the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE or optionally EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH.
{1805, 3} If the UE is registered in N1 mode and operating in dual-registration mode, the PLMN that the UE chooses to register in is specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] subclause 4.8.3.
{1805, 4} Otherwise the UE shall perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1803, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #13	;
{1806, 0} In S101 mode, the UE shall store the PLMN identity provided with the indication from the lower layers to prepare for an S101 mode to S1 mode handover in the list of "forbidden PLMNs for attach in S101 mode" and enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1803, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #13	;
{1807, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status, P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI, GPRS ciphering key sequence number and GPRS attach attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the normal attach procedure is rejected with the GMM cause with the same value.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1803, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #13	;
{1808, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state, 5GS update status, 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the case when the initial registration procedure performed over 3GPP access is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1809, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #14	;
{1810, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and eKSI.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1809, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #14	;
{1810, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and eKSI.
{1810, 1} Additionally, the UE shall delete the list of equivalent PLMNs and reset the attach attempt counter.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1809, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #14	;
{1811, 0} In S1 mode, the UE shall store the PLMN identity in the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1809, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #14	;
{1811, 0} In S1 mode, the UE shall store the PLMN identity in the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list.
{1811, 1} Additionally, the UE shall enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
---

{1809, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #14	;
{1811, 0} In S1 mode, the UE shall store the PLMN identity in the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list.
{1811, 1} Additionally, the UE shall enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
{1811, 2} The UE shall perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1809, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #14	;
{1811, 0} In S1 mode, the UE shall store the PLMN identity in the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list.
{1811, 1} Additionally, the UE shall enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
{1811, 2} The UE shall perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{1811, 3} If the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS and the UE maintains a PLMN-specific PS-attempt counter for that PLMN, then the UE shall set this counter to the UE implementation-specific maximum value.
---

---

---

---

---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1815, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #15	;
{1817, 0} The UE shall store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming".
{1817, 1} If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message.
{1817, 2} Additionally, the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE and, if the UE is in WB-S1 mode and the Extended EMM cause IE with value "E-UTRAN not allowed" is included in the ATTACH REJECT message, the UE supports "E-UTRA Disabling for EMM cause #15", and the "E-UTRA Disabling Allowed for EMM cause #15" parameter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [15A] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] is present and set to enabled; then the UE shall disable the E-UTRA capability as specified in subclause 4.5 and search for a suitable cell in GERAN, UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology;
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1815, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #15	;
{1817, 0} The UE shall store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming".
{1817, 1} If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message.
{1817, 2} Additionally, the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE and, if the UE is in NB-S1 mode and the Extended EMM cause IE with value "NB-IoT not allowed" is included in the ATTACH REJECT message, then the UE may disable the NB-IoT capability as specified in subclause 4.9 and search for a suitable cell in E-UTRAN radio access technology;
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1815, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #15	;
{1817, 0} The UE shall store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming".
{1817, 1} If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message.
{1817, 2} Additionally, the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE and, otherwise, the UE shall search for a suitable cell in another tracking area or in another location area according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21].
---
