---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1824, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{1825, 0} If the T3346 value IE is present in the ATTACH REJECT message and the value indicates that this timer is neither zero nor deactivated, the UE shall proceed as described below; otherwise it shall be considered as an abnormal case and the behaviour of the UE for this case is specified in subclause 5.5.1.2.6.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1824, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{1826, 0} The UE shall abort the attach procedure, reset the attach attempt counter, set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED and enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1824, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{1827, 0} The UE shall stop timer T3346 if it is running.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1824, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{1828, 0} If the ATTACH REJECT message is integrity protected, the UE shall start timer T3346 with the value provided in the T3346 value IE.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1824, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{1829, 0} If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall start timer T3346 with a random value from the default range specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13].
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1824, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{1830, 0} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1824, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{1830, 0} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
{1830, 1} The attach procedure is started if still needed when timer T3346 expires or is stopped.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1824, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{1831, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status and GPRS attach attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the normal attach procedure is rejected with the GMM cause with the same value.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1824, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{1832, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state, 5GS update status and registration attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the case when the initial registration procedure performed over 3GPP access is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1833, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25	;
{1834, 0} EMM cause #25 is only applicable when received from a CSG cell.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1833, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25	;
{1834, 0} EMM cause #25 is only applicable when received from a CSG cell.
{1834, 1} EMM cause #25 received from a non-CSG cell is considered as an abnormal case and the behaviour of the UE is specified in subclause 5.5.1.2.6.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1833, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25	;
{1835, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1833, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25	;
{1835, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED.
{1835, 1} Additionally, the UE shall reset the attach attempt counter and shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1833, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25	;
{1836, 0} If the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell where the UE has sent the ATTACH REQUEST message are contained in the Allowed CSG list, the UE shall remove the entry corresponding to this CSG ID and associated PLMN identity from the Allowed CSG list.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1833, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25	;
{1837, 0} If the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell where the UE has sent the ATTACH REQUEST message are contained in the Operator CSG list, the UE shall apply the procedures defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6] subclause 3.1A.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1833, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25	;
{1838, 0} The UE shall search for a suitable cell according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21].
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1833, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25	;
{1839, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status and GPRS attach attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the normal attach procedure is rejected with the GMM cause with the same value.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1833, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #25	;
{1840, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and set the 5GS update status to 5U3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1841, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{1842, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs, and set the attach attempt counter to 5.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1841, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{1842, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs, and set the attach attempt counter to 5.
{1842, 1} The UE shall start an implementation specific timer setting its value to 2 times the value of T as defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1841, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{1842, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs, and set the attach attempt counter to 5.
{1842, 1} The UE shall start an implementation specific timer setting its value to 2 times the value of T as defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{1842, 2} While this timer is running, the UE shall not consider the PLMN + RAT combination that provided this reject cause a candidate for PLMN selection.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1841, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{1842, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs, and set the attach attempt counter to 5.
{1842, 1} The UE shall start an implementation specific timer setting its value to 2 times the value of T as defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{1842, 2} While this timer is running, the UE shall not consider the PLMN + RAT combination that provided this reject cause a candidate for PLMN selection.
{1842, 3} The UE then enters state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1841, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{1843, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition set the GMM state to GMM-DEREGISTERED, GPRS update status to GU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete the P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1841, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{1844, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED, 5GS update status to 5U2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1845, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #31	;
{1846, 0} EMM cause #31 received by a UE that has not indicated support for CIoT optimizations is considered as an abnormal case and the behaviour of the UE is specified in subclause 5.5.1.2.6.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1845, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #31	;
{1847, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and eKSI.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1845, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #31	;
{1847, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and eKSI.
{1847, 1} Additionally, the UE shall reset the attach attempt counter.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1845, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #31	;
{1848, 0} The UE shall enable N1 mode capability for 3GPP access if it was disabled and disable the E-UTRA capability and enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE.
---

{1777, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the ATTACH REJECT message.
{1845, 0} When the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT message with EMM cause #31	;
{1849, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state, 5GS update status, 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the case when the initial registration procedure performed over 3GPP access is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value.
---

{1850, 0} Other values are considered as abnormal cases.
---

{1850, 0} Other values are considered as abnormal cases.
{1850, 1} The behaviour of the UE in those cases is specified in subclause 5.5.1.2.6.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1906, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB, ACDC or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network without "Extended wait time" received from lower layers
{1907, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the attach procedure shall not be started.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1906, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB, ACDC or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network without "Extended wait time" received from lower layers
{1907, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the attach procedure shall not be started.
{1907, 1} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1906, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB, ACDC or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network without "Extended wait time" received from lower layers
{1907, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the attach procedure shall not be started.
{1907, 1} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
{1907, 2} The attach procedure is started as soon as possible, i.e. when access for "originating signalling" is granted on the current cell or when the UE moves to a cell where access for "originating signalling" is granted.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1906, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB, ACDC or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network without "Extended wait time" received from lower layers
{1908, 0} In NB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the attach procedure shall not be started.

{1906, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB, ACDC or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network without "Extended wait time" received from lower layers
{1908, 0} In NB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the attach procedure shall not be started.
{1908, 1} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
---

{1906, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB, ACDC or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network without "Extended wait time" received from lower layers

{1908, 1} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
{1908, 2} Further UE behaviour is implementation specific, e.g. the attach procedure is started again after an implementation dependent time.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1906, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB, ACDC or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network without "Extended wait time" received from lower layers
{1909, 0} In NB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", a request for an exceptional event is received from the upper layers, then the attach procedure shall be started.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1906, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB, ACDC or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network without "Extended wait time" received from lower layers

{1911, 0} If access is barred for a certain ACDC category, a request with a higher ACDC category is received from the upper layers and the UE supports ACDC, then the attach procedure shall be started.

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1917, 0} ATTACH REJECT, other EMM cause values than those treated in subclause 5.5.1.2.5, and cases of EMM cause values #22, #25 and #31, if considered as abnormal cases according to subclause 5.5.1.2.5

{1918, 1} Subsequently, if the UE needs to retransmit the ATTACH REQUEST message to request PDN connectivity towards a different APN, the UE may stop T3411 or T3402, if running, and send the ATTACH REQUEST message.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1917, 0} ATTACH REJECT, other EMM cause values than those treated in subclause 5.5.1.2.5, and cases of EMM cause values #22, #25 and #31, if considered as abnormal cases according to subclause 5.5.1.2.5
{1918, 0} Upon reception of the EMM cause #19 "ESM failure", if the UE is not configured for NAS signalling low priority and the ESM cause value received in the PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message is not #54 "PDN connection does not exist", the UE may set the attach attempt counter to 5.
{1918, 1} Subsequently, if the UE needs to retransmit the ATTACH REQUEST message to request PDN connectivity towards a different APN, the UE may stop T3411 or T3402, if running, and send the ATTACH REQUEST message.
{1918, 2} If the UE needs to attempt EPS attach to request transfer of a PDN connection for emergency bearer services by including a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message with request type set to "handover of emergency bearer services", the UE shall stop T3411 or T3402, if running, and send the ATTACH REQUEST message.

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1921, 0} Change of cell into a new tracking area
{1922, 0} If a cell change into a new tracking area occurs before the attach procedure is completed, the attach procedure shall be aborted and re-initiated immediately.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1921, 0} Change of cell into a new tracking area
{1922, 0} If a cell change into a new tracking area occurs before the attach procedure is completed, the attach procedure shall be aborted and re-initiated immediately.
{1922, 1} If a tracking area border is crossed when the ATTACH ACCEPT message has been received but before an ATTACH COMPLETE message is sent, the attach procedure shall be re-initiated.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1921, 0} Change of cell into a new tracking area
{1922, 0} If a cell change into a new tracking area occurs before the attach procedure is completed, the attach procedure shall be aborted and re-initiated immediately.
{1922, 1} If a tracking area border is crossed when the ATTACH ACCEPT message has been received but before an ATTACH COMPLETE message is sent, the attach procedure shall be re-initiated.
{1922, 2} If a GUTI was allocated during the attach procedure, this GUTI shall be used in the attach procedure.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1923, 0} Mobile originated detach required
{1924, 0} The attach procedure shall be aborted, and the UE initiated detach procedure shall be performed.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1925, 0} Detach procedure collision
{1926, 0} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message from the network in state EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED and the detach type indicates "re-attach not required" and no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the detach procedure shall be progressed and the attach procedure shall be aborted.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1925, 0} Detach procedure collision
{1926, 0} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message from the network in state EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED and the detach type indicates "re-attach not required" and no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the detach procedure shall be progressed and the attach procedure shall be aborted.
{1926, 1} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message from the network in state EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED and the detach type indicates "re-attach required", the detach procedure shall be progressed and the UE shall locally release the NAS signalling connection, before re-initiating the attach procedure.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1925, 0} Detach procedure collision
{1926, 0} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message from the network in state EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED and the detach type indicates "re-attach not required" and no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the detach procedure shall be progressed and the attach procedure shall be aborted.
{1926, 1} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message from the network in state EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED and the detach type indicates "re-attach required", the detach procedure shall be progressed and the UE shall locally release the NAS signalling connection, before re-initiating the attach procedure.
{1926, 2} Otherwise the attach procedure shall be progressed and the DETACH REQUEST message shall be ignored.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1927, 0} Transmission failure of ATTACH REQUEST message indication from lower layers
{1928, 0} The UE shall restart the attach procedure immediately.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1929, 0} Transmission failure of ATTACH COMPLETE message indication from lower layers
{1930, 0} If the current TAI is not in the TAI list, the UE shall restart the attach procedure.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1929, 0} Transmission failure of ATTACH COMPLETE message indication from lower layers
{1931, 0} If the current TAI is still in the TAI list, it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1929, 0} Transmission failure of ATTACH COMPLETE message indication from lower layers
{1931, 0} If the current TAI is still in the TAI list, it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure.
{1931, 1} The EMM sublayer notifies the ESM sublayer that the ESM message in the ESM message container IE of the ATTACH COMPLETE has failed to be transmitted.
---

{1905, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1965, 0} Timer T3410 shall be stopped if still running.
---

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1966, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l when the "Extended wait time" is ignored, and la when the "Extended wait time CP data" is ignored, if the attach request is neither for emergency bearer services nor for initiating a PDN connection for emergency bearer services with attach type not set to "EPS emergency attach", the attach attempt counter shall be incremented, unless it was already set to 5.
---

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1967, 0} If the attach attempt counter is less than 5, for the cases l, la and m, the attach procedure is started, if still necessary, when timer T3346 expires or is stopped;
---

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1967, 0} If the attach attempt counter is less than 5, for the cases b, c, d, l when the "Extended wait time" is ignored, and la when the "Extended wait time CP data" is ignore, if the attach request is neither for emergency bearer services nor for initiating a PDN connection for emergency bearer services with attach type not set to "EPS emergency attach", timer T3411 is started and the state is changed to EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH.
---

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1967, 0} If the attach attempt counter is less than 5, for the cases b, c, d, l when the "Extended wait time" is ignored, and la when the "Extended wait time CP data" is ignore, if the attach request is neither for emergency bearer services nor for initiating a PDN connection for emergency bearer services with attach type not set to "EPS emergency attach", timer T3411 is started and the state is changed to EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH.
{1969, 1} When timer T3411 expires the attach procedure shall be restarted, if still required by ESM sublayer.

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1970, 0} If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall delete any GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI, list of equivalent PLMNs and KSI, shall set the update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall start timer T3402.
---

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1970, 0} If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall delete any GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI, list of equivalent PLMNs and KSI, shall set the update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall start timer T3402.
{1971, 1} The state is changed to EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH or optionally to EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6];
---

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1970, 0} If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status, P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the abnormal case when a normal attach procedure fails and the attach attempt counter is equal to 5;
---

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1970, 0} If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state, 5GS update status, 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the abnormal case when an initial registration procedure performed over 3GPP access fails and the registration attempt counter is equal to 5;
---

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1970, 0} If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN, UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology and proceed with appropriate GMM or 5GMM specific procedures.
---

{1964, 0} For the cases b, c, d, l, la and m:
{1970, 0} If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN, UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology and proceed with appropriate GMM or 5GMM specific procedures.
{1975, 1} Additionally, the UE may disable the E-UTRA capability as specified in subclause 4.5.
---

{1977, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{1978, 0} if the attach was successful for EPS services only and the ATTACH ACCEPT message contained a value included in the SMS services status IE not treated in subclause 5.5.1.2.4A or the SMS services status IE is not included in the message, the UE shall proceed as follows:
---

{1977, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{1979, 0} The UE shall stop timer T3410 if still running.
---

{1977, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{1979, 0} The UE shall stop timer T3410 if still running.
{1979, 1} The tracking area updating attempt counter shall be incremented, unless it was already set to 5;
---

{1977, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{1980, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the UE shall start timer T3411, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
---

{1977, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{1980, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the UE shall start timer T3411, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
{1981, 1} When timer T3411 expires the normal tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" or the combined tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" is triggered;
---

{1977, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{1982, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3402, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
---

{1977, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{1982, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3402, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
{1983, 1} When timer T3402 expires the normal tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" or the combined tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" is triggered;
---

{1977, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{1984, 0} otherwise, the abnormal cases specified in subclause 5.5.1.2.6 apply.

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1987, 0} Lower layer failure
{1988, 0} If a lower layer failure occurs before the message ATTACH COMPLETE has been received from the UE, the network shall locally abort the attach procedure, enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED and shall not resend the message ATTACH ACCEPT.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1987, 0} Lower layer failure
{1988, 0} If a lower layer failure occurs before the message ATTACH COMPLETE has been received from the UE, the network shall locally abort the attach procedure, enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED and shall not resend the message ATTACH ACCEPT.
{1988, 1} If a new GUTI was assigned to the UE in the attach procedure, the MME shall consider both the old and the new GUTI as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network or the EMM context which has been marked as detached in the network is released.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1987, 0} Lower layer failure
{1989, 0} If the old GUTI was allocated by an MME other than the current MME, the current MME does not need to retain the old GUTI.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1987, 0} Lower layer failure
{1989, 0} If the old GUTI was allocated by an MME other than the current MME, the current MME does not need to retain the old GUTI.
{1989, 1} If the old GUTI is used by the UE in a subsequent attach message, the network may use the identification procedure to request the UE's IMSI.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1990, 0} Protocol error
{1991, 0} If the ATTACH REQUEST message is received with a protocol error, the network shall return an ATTACH REJECT message with one of the following EMM cause values:
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1990, 0} Protocol error
{1992, 0} #96:	invalid mandatory information;

{1993, 0} #99:	information element non-existent or not implemented;
---

{1994, 0} #100:	conditional IE error;
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1990, 0} Protocol error
{1995, 0} #111:	protocol error, unspecified.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1996, 0} T3450 time-out
{1997, 0} On the first expiry of the timer, the network shall retransmit the ATTACH ACCEPT message and shall reset and restart timer T3450.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1996, 0} T3450 time-out
{1998, 0} This retransmission is repeated four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3450, the attach procedure shall be aborted and the MME enters state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1996, 0} T3450 time-out
{1998, 0} This retransmission is repeated four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3450, the attach procedure shall be aborted and the MME enters state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
{1998, 1} If a new GUTI was allocated in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the network shall consider both the old and the new GUTI as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network or the EMM context which has been marked as detached in the network is released.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1996, 0} T3450 time-out
{1998, 0} This retransmission is repeated four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3450, the attach procedure shall be aborted and the MME enters state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
{1998, 1} If a new GUTI was allocated in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the network shall consider both the old and the new GUTI as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network or the EMM context which has been marked as detached in the network is released.
{1998, 2} If the old GUTI was allocated by an MME other than the current MME, the current MME does not need to retain the old GUTI.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{1996, 0} T3450 time-out
{1999, 0} If the old GUTI is used by the UE in a subsequent attach message, the network acts as specified for case a above.

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2000, 0} ATTACH REQUEST received after the ATTACH ACCEPT message has been sent and before the ATTACH COMPLETE message is received
{2001, 0} If one or more of the information elements in the ATTACH REQUEST message differ from the ones received within the previous ATTACH REQUEST message, the previously initiated attach procedure shall be aborted if the ATTACH COMPLETE message has not been received and the new attach procedure shall be progressed;
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2000, 0} ATTACH REQUEST received after the ATTACH ACCEPT message has been sent and before the ATTACH COMPLETE message is received
{2002, 0} If the information elements do not differ, then the ATTACH ACCEPT message shall be resent and the timer T3450 shall be restarted if an ATTACH COMPLETE message is expected.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2000, 0} ATTACH REQUEST received after the ATTACH ACCEPT message has been sent and before the ATTACH COMPLETE message is received
{2002, 0} If the information elements do not differ, then the ATTACH ACCEPT message shall be resent and the timer T3450 shall be restarted if an ATTACH COMPLETE message is expected.
{2002, 1} In that case, the retransmission counter related to T3450 is not incremented.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2003, 0} More than one ATTACH REQUEST received and no ATTACH ACCEPT or ATTACH REJECT message has been sent
{2004, 0} If one or more of the information elements in the ATTACH REQUEST message differs from the ones received within the previous ATTACH REQUEST message, the previously initiated attach procedure shall be aborted and the new attach procedure shall be executed;
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2003, 0} More than one ATTACH REQUEST received and no ATTACH ACCEPT or ATTACH REJECT message has been sent
{2005, 0} If the information elements do not differ, then the network shall continue with the previous attach procedure and shall ignore the second ATTACH REQUEST message.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2006, 0} ATTACH REQUEST received in state EMM-REGISTERED
{2007, 0} If an ATTACH REQUEST message is received in state EMM-REGISTERED the network may initiate the EMM common procedures; if it turned out that the ATTACH REQUEST message was sent by a genuine UE that has already been attached, the EMM context, EPS bearer contexts, if any, are deleted and the new ATTACH REQUEST is progressed.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2008, 0} TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message received before ATTACH COMPLETE message.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2008, 0} TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message received before ATTACH COMPLETE message.
{2009, 0} Timer T3450 shall be stopped.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2008, 0} TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message received before ATTACH COMPLETE message.

{2009, 1} The allocated GUTI in the attach procedure shall be considered as valid and the tracking area updating procedure shall be rejected with the EMM cause #10 "implicitly detached" as described in subclause 5.5.3.2.5.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2010, 0} DETACH REQUEST message received before ATTACH COMPLETE message.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2012, 0} If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME, the MME receives an ATTACH REQUEST message with an ESM message included in the ESM message container information element, and the ESM sublayer in the MME detects a message error according to clause 7, the MME may decide to proceed with the attach procedure or to reject it.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2012, 0} If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME, the MME receives an ATTACH REQUEST message with an ESM message included in the ESM message container information element, and the ESM sublayer in the MME detects a message error according to clause 7, the MME may decide to proceed with the attach procedure or to reject it.
{2012, 1} When sending the ATTACH ACCEPT or ATTACH REJECT message to the UE, the MME shall include the ESM message provide by the ESM layer in the ESM message container information element.
---

{1986, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2013, 0} UE security capabilities invalid or unacceptable
{2014, 0} If the ATTACH REQUEST message is received with invalid or unacceptable UE security capabilities, the MME shall return an ATTACH REJECT message.
---

{2186, 0} The detach procedure is used, by the UE to detach for EPS services only;
---

{2186, 0} The detach procedure is used, by the UE to disconnect from the last remaining PDN it is connected to if EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME;
---

{2186, 0} The detach procedure is used, by the UE in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation to detach for both EPS services and non-EPS services or for non-EPS services only via a combined detach procedure;
---

{2186, 0} The detach procedure is used, by the network to inform the UE that it is detached for EPS services or non-EPS services or both;
---

{2186, 0} The detach procedure is used, by the network to disconnect the UE from the last remaining PDN to which it is connected if EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME;
---

{2186, 0} The detach procedure is used, by the network to inform the UE to re-attach to the network and re-establish all PDN connections.
---

{2193, 0} The detach procedure also applies to the UE which is IMSI attached for "SMS only".
---

{2194, 0} The detach procedure with appropriate detach type shall be invoked by the UE if the UE is switched off, the USIM card is removed from the UE, the UE wishes to detach for EPS services, the UE wishes to detach for non-EPS services or as part of the eCall inactivity procedure defined in subclause 5.5.4.
---

{2195, 0} If the detach procedure is triggered due to USIM removal, the UE shall indicate "switch off" in the detach type IE.
---

{2196, 0} When upper layers indicates that emergency bearer services are no longer required, the UE if still attached for emergency bearer services, may perform a detach followed by a re-attach to regain normal services, if the UE is in or moves to a suitable cell.
---

{2197, 0} If a detach is requested by the HSS for a UE that has bearers for emergency services, the MME shall not send a DETACH REQUEST message to the UE, and shall follow the procedures in subclause 6.4.4.1 for a UE that has bearers for emergency services.
---

{2198, 0} If the detach procedure for EPS services is performed, the EPS bearer context, if any, for this particular UE are deactivated locally without peer-to-peer signalling between the UE and the MME.
---

{2199, 0} If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both, the UE shall store the TIN in the non-volatile memory in the ME, as described in annex C, for a subsequent attach procedure.
---

{2200, 0} The UE is allowed to initiate the detach procedure even if the timer T3346 is running.
---

{2201, 0} The network proceeds with the detach procedure even if NAS level mobility management congestion control is active.
---

{2204, 0} The detach procedure is initiated by the UE by sending a DETACH REQUEST message.
---

{2204, 0} The detach procedure is initiated by the UE by sending a DETACH REQUEST message.
{2204, 1} The Detach type IE included in the message indicates whether detach is due to a "switch off" or not.
---

{2204, 0} The detach procedure is initiated by the UE by sending a DETACH REQUEST message.
{2204, 1} The Detach type IE included in the message indicates whether detach is due to a "switch off" or not.
{2204, 2} The Detach type IE also indicates whether the detach is for EPS services only, for non-EPS services only, or for both.
---

{2204, 0} The detach procedure is initiated by the UE by sending a DETACH REQUEST message.
{2204, 1} The Detach type IE included in the message indicates whether detach is due to a "switch off" or not.
{2204, 2} The Detach type IE also indicates whether the detach is for EPS services only, for non-EPS services only, or for both.
{2204, 3} If the UE has a mapped EPS security context as the current EPS security context, the UE shall set the type of security context flag to "mapped security context".
---

{2204, 0} The detach procedure is initiated by the UE by sending a DETACH REQUEST message.
{2204, 1} The Detach type IE included in the message indicates whether detach is due to a "switch off" or not.
{2204, 2} The Detach type IE also indicates whether the detach is for EPS services only, for non-EPS services only, or for both.
{2204, 3} If the UE has a mapped EPS security context as the current EPS security context, the UE shall set the type of security context flag to "mapped security context".
{2204, 4} Otherwise, the UE shall set the type of security context flag to "native security context".
---

{2205, 0} If the UE has a valid GUTI, the UE shall populate the EPS mobile identity IE with the valid GUTI.
---

{2205, 0} If the UE has a valid GUTI, the UE shall populate the EPS mobile identity IE with the valid GUTI.
{2205, 1} If the UE does not have a valid GUTI, the UE shall populate the EPS mobile identity IE with its IMSI.
---

{2206, 0} If the UE does not have a valid GUTI and it does not have a valid IMSI, then the UE shall populate the EPS mobile identity IE with its IMEI.
---

{2207, 0} If the detach is not due to switch off and the UE is in the state EMM-REGISTERED or EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED, timer T3421 shall be started in the UE after the DETACH REQUEST message has been sent.
---

{2207, 0} If the detach is not due to switch off and the UE is in the state EMM-REGISTERED or EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED, timer T3421 shall be started in the UE after the DETACH REQUEST message has been sent.
{2207, 1} If the detach type indicates that the detach is for non-EPS services only the UE shall enter the state EMM-REGISTERED.IMSI-DETACH-INITIATED, otherwise the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED-INITIATED.
---

{2207, 0} If the detach is not due to switch off and the UE is in the state EMM-REGISTERED or EMM-REGISTERED-INITIATED, timer T3421 shall be started in the UE after the DETACH REQUEST message has been sent.
{2207, 1} If the detach type indicates that the detach is for non-EPS services only the UE shall enter the state EMM-REGISTERED.IMSI-DETACH-INITIATED, otherwise the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED-INITIATED.
{2207, 2} If the detach type indicates that the detach is for non-EPS services or both EPS and non-EPS services, the UE shall enter the state MM IMSI DETACH PENDING.
---

{2208, 0} If the UE to be switched off is not operating in NB-S1 mode and not operating in WB-S1 mode in any enhanced coverage CE mode, the UE shall try for a period of 5 seconds to send the DETACH REQUEST message.
---

{2208, 0} If the UE to be switched off is not operating in NB-S1 mode and not operating in WB-S1 mode in any enhanced coverage CE mode, the UE shall try for a period of 5 seconds to send the DETACH REQUEST message.
{2208, 1} If the UE to be switched off:-
{2209, 0} is operating in NB-S1 mode, then the UE should try for at least a period of 85 seconds to send the DETACH REQUEST;
---

{2208, 0} If the UE to be switched off is not operating in NB-S1 mode and not operating in WB-S1 mode in any enhanced coverage CE mode, the UE shall try for a period of 5 seconds to send the DETACH REQUEST message.
{2208, 1} If the UE to be switched off:-
{2210, 0} is operating in WB-S1 mode in any enhanced coverage CE mode, then the UE should try for at least a period of 14 seconds to send the DETACH REQUEST.
---

{2211, 0} During this period, the UE may be switched off as soon as the DETACH REQUEST message has been sent.
---

{2212, 0} After the last DETACH REQUEST message is sent, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2213, 0} if the current EPS security context is a native EPS security context, then the UE shall store the current EPS security context as specified in annex C and mark it as valid;
---

{2212, 0} After the last DETACH REQUEST message is sent, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2214, 0} else if the current EPS security context is a mapped EPS security context and a non-current full native EPS security context exists, then the UE shall store the non-current EPS security context as specified in annex C and mark it as valid, and finally the UE shall delete any mapped EPS security context or partial native EPS security context.
---

{2216, 0} When the DETACH REQUEST message is received by the network, the network shall send a DETACH ACCEPT message to the UE, if the Detach type IE does not indicate "switch off".
---

{2216, 0} When the DETACH REQUEST message is received by the network, the network shall send a DETACH ACCEPT message to the UE, if the Detach type IE does not indicate "switch off".
{2216, 1} Otherwise, the procedure is completed when the network receives the DETACH REQUEST message.
---

{2217, 0} The network and the UE shall deactivate the EPS bearer context, if any, for this UE locally without peer-to-peer signalling between the UE and the MME.
---

{2218, 0} The UE is marked as inactive in the network for EPS services.
---

{2218, 0} The UE is marked as inactive in the network for EPS services.
{2218, 1} The network shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{2219, 0} The UE, when receiving the DETACH ACCEPT message, shall stop timer T3421.

{2219, 1} Furthermore, if the UE is operating in PS mode of operation, or is operating in CS/PS mode of operation and supports S1 mode only then:
{2220, 0} If the detach procedure was performed due to disabling of EPS services, then the UE shall enter the EMM-NULL state.
---

{2219, 0} The UE, when receiving the DETACH ACCEPT message, shall stop timer T3421.
{2219, 1} Furthermore, if the UE is operating in PS mode of operation, or is operating in CS/PS mode of operation and supports S1 mode only then:
{2221, 0} Otherwise, the UE shall enter the EMM-DEREGISTERED state.

{2222, 0} The UE operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation, and supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode, shall further set the update status to U2 NOT UPDATED, disable the EUTRA capability and attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN access technology.
---

{2224, 0} When the DETACH REQUEST message is received by the network, a DETACH ACCEPT message shall be sent to the UE, if the Detach type IE does not indicate "switch off".
---

{2224, 0} When the DETACH REQUEST message is received by the network, a DETACH ACCEPT message shall be sent to the UE, if the Detach type IE does not indicate "switch off".
{2224, 1} Otherwise, the procedure is completed when the network receives the DETACH REQUEST message.

{2225, 0} Depending on the value of the Detach type IE the following applies:
{2226, 0} combined EPS/IMSI detach:
{2227, 0} The network and the UE shall deactivate the EPS bearer context for this UE locally without peer-to-peer signalling between the UE and the MME.
---

{2226, 0} combined EPS/IMSI detach:
{2227, 0} The network and the UE shall deactivate the EPS bearer context for this UE locally without peer-to-peer signalling between the UE and the MME.
{2227, 1} The UE is marked as inactive in the network for EPS and for non-EPS services.
---

{2225, 0} Depending on the value of the Detach type IE the following applies:
{2226, 0} combined EPS/IMSI detach:
{2227, 0} The network and the UE shall deactivate the EPS bearer context for this UE locally without peer-to-peer signalling between the UE and the MME.
{2227, 1} The UE is marked as inactive in the network for EPS and for non-EPS services.

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

{2234, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the detach signalling procedure shall not be started.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2233, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network
{2234, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the detach signalling procedure shall not be started.
{2234, 1} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2233, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network
{2234, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the detach signalling procedure shall not be started.
{2234, 1} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
{2234, 2} The detach signalling procedure is started as soon as possible and if still necessary, i.e. when access for "originating signalling" is granted on the current cell or when the UE moves to a cell where access for "originating signalling" is granted.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2233, 0} Access barred because of access class barring, EAB or NAS signalling connection establishment rejected by the network
{2234, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the detach signalling procedure shall not be started.
{2234, 1} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
{2234, 2} The detach signalling procedure is started as soon as possible and if still necessary, i.e. when access for "originating signalling" is granted on the current cell or when the UE moves to a cell where access for "originating signalling" is granted.
{2234, 3} The UE may perform a local detach either immediately or after an implementation dependent time.

---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2248, 0} Detach procedure collision
{2249, 0} Detach containing cause "switch off" within the Detach type IE:
{2250, 0} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the UE initiated detach procedure has been completed, this message shall be ignored and the UE initiated detach procedure shall continue.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2248, 0} Detach procedure collision
{2251, 0} Detach containing other causes than "switch off" within the Detach type IE:
{2252, 0} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the UE initiated detach procedure has been completed, it shall treat the message as specified in subclause 5.5.2.3.2 with the following modifications:
{2253, 0} If the DETACH REQUEST message received by the UE contains detach type "re-attach required", and the UE initiated detach procedure is with detach type "EPS detach" or "combined EPS/IMSI detach", the UE need not initiate the attach or combined attach procedure.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2248, 0} Detach procedure collision
{2251, 0} Detach containing other causes than "switch off" within the Detach type IE:
{2252, 0} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the UE initiated detach procedure has been completed, it shall treat the message as specified in subclause 5.5.2.3.2 with the following modifications:
{2254, 0} If the DETACH REQUEST message received by the UE contains detach type "IMSI detach", and the UE initiated detach procedure is with detach type "IMSI detach", the UE need not re-attach to non-EPS services.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2248, 0} Detach procedure collision
{2251, 0} Detach containing other causes than "switch off" within the Detach type IE:
{2252, 0} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the UE initiated detach procedure has been completed, it shall treat the message as specified in subclause 5.5.2.3.2 with the following modifications:
{2255, 0} If the DETACH REQUEST message received by the UE contains detach type "IMSI detach", and the UE initiated detach procedure is with detach type "EPS detach" or "combined EPS/IMSI detach", the UE shall progress both procedures.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2248, 0} Detach procedure collision
{2251, 0} Detach containing other causes than "switch off" within the Detach type IE:
{2252, 0} If the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the UE initiated detach procedure has been completed, it shall treat the message as specified in subclause 5.5.2.3.2 with the following modifications:
{2255, 0} If the DETACH REQUEST message received by the UE contains detach type "IMSI detach", and the UE initiated detach procedure is with detach type "EPS detach" or "combined EPS/IMSI detach", the UE shall progress both procedures.
{2255, 1} The UE need not re-attach to non-EPS services.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2256, 0} Detach and EMM common procedure collision
{2257, 0} Detach containing cause "switch off":
{2258, 0} If the UE receives a message used in an EMM common procedure before the detach procedure has been completed, this message shall be ignored and the detach procedure shall continue.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2256, 0} Detach and EMM common procedure collision
{2259, 0} Detach containing other causes than "switch off" and containing detach type "IMSI detach":
{2260, 0} If the UE receives a message used in an EMM common procedure before the detach procedure has been completed, both the EMM common procedure and the detach procedure shall continue.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2256, 0} Detach and EMM common procedure collision
{2261, 0} Detach containing other causes than "switch off" and containing other detach types than "IMSI detach":
{2262, 0} If the UE receives a GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND, an EMM STATUS or an EMM INFORMATION message before the detach procedure is completed, this message shall be ignored and the detach procedure shall continue.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2256, 0} Detach and EMM common procedure collision
{2261, 0} Detach containing other causes than "switch off" and containing other detach types than "IMSI detach":
{2263, 0} If the UE receives an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST, SECURITY MODE COMMAND or IDENTITY REQUEST message before the detach procedure has been completed, the UE shall respond to it as described in subclause 5.4.2, 5.4.3 and 5.4.4 respectively and the detach procedure shall continue.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2264, 0} Change of cell into a new tracking area
{2265, 0} If a cell change into a new tracking area that is not in the stored TAI list occurs before the UE initiated detach procedure is completed, the detach procedure shall be aborted and re-initiated after successfully performing a tracking area updating procedure.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2264, 0} Change of cell into a new tracking area
{2265, 0} If a cell change into a new tracking area that is not in the stored TAI list occurs before the UE initiated detach procedure is completed, the detach procedure shall be aborted and re-initiated after successfully performing a tracking area updating procedure.
{2265, 1} If the detach procedure was initiated due to removal of the USIM or the UE is to be switched off, the UE shall abort the detach procedure and enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2266, 0} Transmission failure of DETACH REQUEST message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{2267, 0} If the current TAI is not in the TAI list, the detach procedure shall be aborted and re-initiated after successfully performing a tracking area updating procedure.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2266, 0} Transmission failure of DETACH REQUEST message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{2267, 0} If the current TAI is not in the TAI list, the detach procedure shall be aborted and re-initiated after successfully performing a tracking area updating procedure.
{2267, 1} If the detach procedure was initiated due to removal of the USIM or the UE is to be switched off, the UE shall abort the detach procedure and enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2266, 0} Transmission failure of DETACH REQUEST message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{2268, 0} If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list, the UE shall restart the detach procedure.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2269, 0} Transmission failure of DETACH REQUEST message indication without TAI change from lower layers
{2270, 0} The UE shall restart the detach procedure.
---

{2232, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2271, 0} Detach and paging procedure collision
{2272, 0} If the UE receives a CS SERVICE NOTIFICATION message before the UE initiated combined detach procedure with detach type "IMSI detach" or "combined EPS/IMSI detach" has been completed, then this message shall be ignored and the UE initiated combined detach procedure shall continue.
---

{2273, 0} For the cases b, f and g:
{2274, 0} Timer T3421 shall be stopped if still running.
---

{2276, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2277, 0} Detach request received in a CSG cell for which the UE has no valid CSG subscription
{2278, 0} If the UE initiates a detach procedure in a CSG cell the CSG ID of which is not valid for the UE, and the detach procedure is not due to "switch off", the network shall proceed as follows:
{2279, 0} if the detach type is "IMSI detach" and the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services active, the MME shall send a DETACH ACCEPT message and deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearers, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure;
---

{2276, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2277, 0} Detach request received in a CSG cell for which the UE has no valid CSG subscription
{2278, 0} If the UE initiates a detach procedure in a CSG cell the CSG ID of which is not valid for the UE, and the detach procedure is not due to "switch off", the network shall proceed as follows:
{2280, 0} otherwise, the network shall initiate the detach procedure.
---

{2276, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2277, 0} Detach request received in a CSG cell for which the UE has no valid CSG subscription
{2278, 0} If the UE initiates a detach procedure in a CSG cell the CSG ID of which is not valid for the UE, and the detach procedure is not due to "switch off", the network shall proceed as follows:
{2280, 0} otherwise, the network shall initiate the detach procedure.
{2280, 1} The MME shall send a DETACH REQUEST message including the EMM cause #25,"not authorized for this CSG".
---

{2276, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2281, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{2282, 0} If the DETACH ACCEPT message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the DETACH ACCEPT message.
---

{2276, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2281, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{2282, 0} If the DETACH ACCEPT message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the DETACH ACCEPT message.
{2282, 1} If a failure of the handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the DETACH ACCEPT message.

{2285, 0} The network initiates the detach procedure by sending a DETACH REQUEST message to the UE.
---

{2286, 0} The network may include an EMM cause IE to specify the reason for the detach request.
---

{2286, 0} The network may include an EMM cause IE to specify the reason for the detach request.
{2286, 1} The network shall start timer T3422.
---

{2286, 0} The network may include an EMM cause IE to specify the reason for the detach request.
{2286, 1} The network shall start timer T3422.
{2286, 2} If the Detach type IE indicates "re-attach required" or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", or if the MME performs a local detach, the MME shall either store the current EPS security context if it is a native EPS security context, or the MME shall delete the current EPS security context if it is a mapped EPS security context.
---

{2286, 0} The network may include an EMM cause IE to specify the reason for the detach request.
{2286, 1} The network shall start timer T3422.
{2286, 2} If the Detach type IE indicates "re-attach required" or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", or if the MME performs a local detach, the MME shall either store the current EPS security context if it is a native EPS security context, or the MME shall delete the current EPS security context if it is a mapped EPS security context.
{2286, 3} If the detach type IE indicates "re-attach required" or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the network shall deactivate the EPS bearer context, if any, for the UE locally and enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED-INITIATED.
---

{2288, 1} The UE shall stop the timer T3346, if it is running.

{2288, 4} Furthermore, the UE shall, after the completion of the detach procedure, and the release of the existing NAS signalling connection, initiate an attach or combined attach procedure.

{2288, 0} When receiving the DETACH REQUEST message and the detach type indicates "re-attach required", the UE shall deactivate the EPS bearer context, if any, including the default EPS bearer context locally without peer-to-peer signalling between the UE and the MME.
{2288, 1} The UE shall stop the timer T3346, if it is running.
{2288, 2} The UE shall also stop timer T3396, if it is running.
{2288, 3} The UE shall send a DETACH ACCEPT message to the network and enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
{2288, 4} Furthermore, the UE shall, after the completion of the detach procedure, and the release of the existing NAS signalling connection, initiate an attach or combined attach procedure.
{2288, 5} The UE should also re-establish any previously established PDN connection.

{2289, 0} A UE which receives a DETACH REQUEST message with detach type indicating "re-attach required" or "re-attach not required" and no EMM cause IE, is detached only for EPS services.
---

{2290, 0} When receiving the DETACH REQUEST message and the detach type indicates "IMSI detach", the UE shall not deactivate the EPS bearer context including the default EPS bearer context.
---

{2290, 0} When receiving the DETACH REQUEST message and the detach type indicates "IMSI detach", the UE shall not deactivate the EPS bearer context including the default EPS bearer context.
{2290, 1} The UE shall set the MM update status to U2 NOT UPDATED.
---

{2290, 0} When receiving the DETACH REQUEST message and the detach type indicates "IMSI detach", the UE shall not deactivate the EPS bearer context including the default EPS bearer context.
{2290, 1} The UE shall set the MM update status to U2 NOT UPDATED.
{2290, 2} A UE may send a DETACH ACCEPT message to the network, and shall re-attach to non-EPS services by performing the combined tracking area updating procedure according to subclause 5.5.3.3, sending a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message with EPS update type IE indicating "combined TA/LA updating with IMSI attach".
---

{2291, 0} If the UE is attached for EPS and non-EPS services, then the UE shall set the update status to U2 NOT UPDATED if, the Detach type IE indicates "re-attach required";
---

{2291, 0} If the UE is attached for EPS and non-EPS services, then the UE shall set the update status to U2 NOT UPDATED if, the Detach type IE indicates "re-attach not required" and no EMM cause IE is included.
---

{2294, 0} When receiving the DETACH REQUEST message and the detach type indicates "re-attach not required" and no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the UE shall deactivate the EPS bearer context, if any, including the default EPS bearer context locally without peer-to-peer signalling between the UE and the MME.
---

{2294, 0} When receiving the DETACH REQUEST message and the detach type indicates "re-attach not required" and no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the UE shall deactivate the EPS bearer context, if any, including the default EPS bearer context locally without peer-to-peer signalling between the UE and the MME.
{2294, 1} The UE shall then send a DETACH ACCEPT message to the network and enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{2295, 0} If the detach type indicates "IMSI detach" or "re-attach required", then the UE shall ignore the EMM cause IE if received.
---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2297, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #2	;
{2298, 0} The UE shall handle the MM parameters update status, TMSI, LAI and ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when a DETACH REQUEST is received with the GMM cause with the same value and with detach type set to "re-attach not required".
---

{2297, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #2	;
{2298, 0} The UE shall handle the MM parameters update status, TMSI, LAI and ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when a DETACH REQUEST is received with the GMM cause with the same value and with detach type set to "re-attach not required".
{2298, 1} The USIM shall be considered as invalid for non-EPS services until switching off or the UICC containing the USIM is removed or the timer T3245 expires as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2297, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #2	;
{2298, 0} The UE shall handle the MM parameters update status, TMSI, LAI and ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when a DETACH REQUEST is received with the GMM cause with the same value and with detach type set to "re-attach not required".
{2298, 1} The USIM shall be considered as invalid for non-EPS services until switching off or the UICC containing the USIM is removed or the timer T3245 expires as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
{2298, 2} If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2297, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #2	;
{2299, 0} The UE is still attached for EPS services in the network.

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:

---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:

{2306, 0} For the EMM cause value #8, if the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED, 5GS update status to 5U3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED, and shall delete any 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI.

{2308, 3} If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2307, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #7	;
{2309, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall handle the GMM parameters GMM state, RAI, PTMSI, P-TMSI signature, GPRS ciphering key sequence number and GPRS update status as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when a DETACH REQUEST is received with the GMM cause with the same value and with detach type set to "re-attach not required".
---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2307, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #7	;
{2310, 0} A UE operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation which is IMSI attached for non-EPS services is still IMSI attached for non-EPS services in the network.
---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2307, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #7	;
{2310, 0} A UE operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation which is IMSI attached for non-EPS services is still IMSI attached for non-EPS services in the network.
{2310, 1} The UE operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation shall set the update status to U2 NOT UPDATED, shall attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN access technology and shall proceed with the appropriate MM specific procedure according to the MM service state.
---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2307, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #7	;
{2310, 0} A UE operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation which is IMSI attached for non-EPS services is still IMSI attached for non-EPS services in the network.
{2310, 1} The UE operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation shall set the update status to U2 NOT UPDATED, shall attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN access technology and shall proceed with the appropriate MM specific procedure according to the MM service state.
{2310, 2} The UE shall not reselect E-UTRAN radio access technology until switching off or the UICC containing the USIM is removed.

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2345, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #25	;
{2350, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status and GPRS attach attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when a DETACH REQUEST is received with GMM cause with the same value and with detach type set to "re-attach not required".
---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2345, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #25	;
{2350, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status and GPRS attach attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when a DETACH REQUEST is received with GMM cause with the same value and with detach type set to "re-attach not required".
{2350, 1} If the UE is IMSI attached for non-EPS services, the UE shall in addition handle the MM parameters update status and location update attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when a DETACH REQUEST is received with the GMM cause with the same value and with detach type set to "re-attach not required".
---

{2296, 0} If the detach type indicates "re-attach not required", the UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value:
{2345, 0} When the UE receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "re-attach not required" detach type and EMM cause #25	;
{2351, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and set the 5GS update status to 5U3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED.
---

{2352, 0} Other EMM cause values or if no EMM cause IE is included is considered as abnormal cases.
---

{2352, 0} Other EMM cause values or if no EMM cause IE is included is considered as abnormal cases.
{2352, 1} The behaviour of the UE in those cases is described in subclause 5.5.2.3.4.
---

{2354, 0} The network shall stop timer T3422 upon receipt of the DETACH ACCEPT message.
---

{2354, 0} The network shall stop timer T3422 upon receipt of the DETACH ACCEPT message.
{2354, 1} If the Detach type IE indicates "IMSI detach", or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the network shall not change the current EMM state; otherwise the network shall enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{2356, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2357, 0} Transmission failure of DETACH ACCEPT message indication from lower layers
{2358, 0} The detach procedure shall be progressed and the UE shall send the DETACH ACCEPT message.
---

{2356, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2359, 0} DETACH REQUEST, other EMM cause values than those treated in subclause 5.5.2.3.2 or no EMM cause IE is included, and the Detach type IE indicates "re-attach not required"
{2360, 0} The UE shall delete any GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI, list of equivalent PLMNs, KSI, shall set the update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED and shall start timer T3402.
---

{2356, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2359, 0} DETACH REQUEST, other EMM cause values than those treated in subclause 5.5.2.3.2 or no EMM cause IE is included, and the Detach type IE indicates "re-attach not required"
{2361, 0} A UE operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation which is IMSI attached for non-EPS services is still IMSI attached for non-EPS services and shall set the update status to U2 NOT UPDATED.
---

{2356, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2362, 0} A UE not supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode, or operating in PS mode of operation may enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6]; otherwise the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH.
---

{2356, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2362, 0} A UE not supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode, or operating in PS mode of operation may enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6]; otherwise the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH.
{2363, 0} A UE supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode and operating in CS/PS mode 1 of operation or CS/PS mode 2 of operation shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED and attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN radio access technology and proceed with the appropriate MM or GMM specific procedures.
---

{2356, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2362, 0} A UE not supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode, or operating in PS mode of operation may enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6]; otherwise the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH.
{2363, 0} A UE supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode and operating in CS/PS mode 1 of operation or CS/PS mode 2 of operation shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED and attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN radio access technology and proceed with the appropriate MM or GMM specific procedures.
{2364, 1} In this case, the UE may disable the E-UTRA capability;

{2356, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2362, 0} A UE not supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode, or operating in PS mode of operation may enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6]; otherwise the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH.
{2363, 0} A UE supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode and operating in CS/PS mode 1 of operation or CS/PS mode 2 of operation shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].

{2356, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2362, 0} A UE not supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode, or operating in PS mode of operation may enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6]; otherwise the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH.
