{2356, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2362, 0} A UE not supporting A/Gb mode or Iu mode, or operating in PS mode of operation may enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6]; otherwise the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH.
{2367, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED, 5GS update status to 5U2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI.

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2370, 0} T3422 time-out
{2371, 0} On the first expiry of the timer, the network shall retransmit the DETACH REQUEST message and shall start timer T3422.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2370, 0} T3422 time-out
{2371, 0} On the first expiry of the timer, the network shall retransmit the DETACH REQUEST message and shall start timer T3422.
{2371, 1} This retransmission is repeated four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3422, the detach procedure shall be aborted.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2370, 0} T3422 time-out
{2371, 0} On the first expiry of the timer, the network shall retransmit the DETACH REQUEST message and shall start timer T3422.
{2371, 1} This retransmission is repeated four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3422, the detach procedure shall be aborted.
{2371, 2} If the detach type is "IMSI detach", or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the network shall not change the current EMM state; otherwise the network shall change to state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2372, 0} Lower layer failure
{2373, 0} The detach procedure is aborted.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2372, 0} Lower layer failure
{2373, 0} The detach procedure is aborted.
{2373, 1} If the detach type indicates "IMSI detach", or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the network shall not change the current EMM state; otherwise the network shall change to state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2374, 0} Detach procedure collision
{2375, 0} If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message with "switch off" indication, before the network initiated detach procedure has been completed, both procedures shall be considered completed.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2374, 0} Detach procedure collision
{2376, 0} If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message without "switch off" indication, before the network initiated detach procedure has been completed, the network shall send a DETACH ACCEPT message to the UE.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2377, 0} Detach and attach procedure collision
{2378, 0} If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the network initiated detach procedure with detach type "re-attach not required" with no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", has been completed, the network shall ignore the ATTACH REQUEST message.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2377, 0} Detach and attach procedure collision
{2378, 0} If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the network initiated detach procedure with detach type "re-attach not required" with no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", has been completed, the network shall ignore the ATTACH REQUEST message.
{2378, 1} If the Detach type IE, sent in the DETACH REQUEST message, indicates "re-attach required" the detach procedure is aborted and the attach procedure shall be progressed after the EPS bearer context have been deleted.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2377, 0} Detach and attach procedure collision
{2378, 0} If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the network initiated detach procedure with detach type "re-attach not required" with no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value not #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", has been completed, the network shall ignore the ATTACH REQUEST message.
{2378, 1} If the Detach type IE, sent in the DETACH REQUEST message, indicates "re-attach required" the detach procedure is aborted and the attach procedure shall be progressed after the EPS bearer context have been deleted.
{2378, 2} If the Detach type IE, sent in DETACH REQUEST message, indicates "IMSI detach", or "re-attach not required" and the EMM cause value is #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", the detach procedure is aborted and the attach procedure shall be progressed.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2379, 0} Detach and tracking area updating procedure collision
{2380, 0} If the Detach type IE, sent in DETACH REQUEST message, indicates "re-attach not required" with no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" with EMM cause other than #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS" or indicates "re-attach required", and the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the network initiated detach procedure has been completed, the detach procedure shall be progressed, i.e. the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message shall be ignored.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2379, 0} Detach and tracking area updating procedure collision
{2381, 0} If the Detach type IE, sent in DETACH REQUEST message, indicates "re-attach not required" with EMM cause #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS" or indicates "IMSI detach" and the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the network initiated detach procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the detach procedure, shall stop T3422 and shall progress the tracking area updating procedure.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2382, 0} Detach and service request procedure collision
{2383, 0} If the network receives a SERVICE REQUEST message or an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for packet services before the network initiated detach procedure has been completed and the DETACH REQUEST contains detach type "re-attach not required" with EMM cause #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS" or detach type "IMSI detach", the network shall progress both procedures.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2382, 0} Detach and service request procedure collision
{2383, 0} If the network receives a SERVICE REQUEST message or an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for packet services before the network initiated detach procedure has been completed and the DETACH REQUEST contains detach type "re-attach not required" with EMM cause #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS" or detach type "IMSI detach", the network shall progress both procedures.
{2383, 1} If the DETACH REQUEST message contains detach type "re-attach not required" with no EMM cause IE, or "re-attach not required" with EMM cause other than #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS" or detach type "re-attach required", the network shall progress the detach procedure.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2382, 0} Detach and service request procedure collision
{2384, 0} If the network receives an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for CS fallback, but not for CS fallback for emergency call, before the network initiated detach procedure has been completed and the DETACH REQUEST contains detach type "re-attach not required" with EMM cause #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS" or detach type "IMSI detach", the network shall ignore the EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message and progress the detach procedure.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2382, 0} Detach and service request procedure collision
{2385, 0} If the network receives an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for CS fallback for emergency call before the network initiated detach procedure has been completed and the DETACH REQUEST contains detach type "re-attach not required" with EMM cause #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS" or detach type "IMSI detach", the network shall progress both procedures.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2386, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{2387, 0} If the DETACH REQUEST message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the DETACH REQUEST message.
---

{2369, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2386, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{2387, 0} If the DETACH REQUEST message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the DETACH REQUEST message.
{2387, 1} If a failure of the handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the DETACH REQUEST message.

---

{2390, 0} The tracking area updating procedure is always initiated by the UE and is used for the following purposes:
{2404, 0} to indicate to the network that the UE has locally released EPS bearer context.

{2405, 0} Details on the conditions for the UE to initiate the tracking area updating procedure are specified in subclause 5.5.3.2.2 and subclause 5.5.3.3.2.

{2406, 0} While a UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall not perform manual CSG selection.
---

{2407, 0} If control plane CIoT EPS optimization is not used by the UE, a UE initiating the tracking area updating procedure in EMM-IDLE mode may request the network to re-establish the radio and S1 bearers for all active EPS bearer contexts during the procedure.
---

{2407, 0} If control plane CIoT EPS optimization is not used by the UE, a UE initiating the tracking area updating procedure in EMM-IDLE mode may request the network to re-establish the radio and S1 bearers for all active EPS bearer contexts during the procedure.
{2407, 1} If control plane CIoT EPS optimization is used by the UE, a UE initiating the tracking area updating procedure in EMM-IDLE mode may request the network to re-establish the radio and S1 bearers for all active EPS bearer contexts associated with PDN connections established without control plane only indication during the procedure.

{2408, 1} The UE shall construct the TAI of the cell from this chosen PLMN identity and the TAC received for this PLMN identity on the broadcast system information.

{2415, 0} Additionally the tracking area updating attempt counter shall be reset when the UE is in substate EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE or EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE-MM, and, a new tracking area is entered;

{2421, 0} The periodic tracking area updating procedure is controlled in the UE by timer T3412.
---

{2421, 1} When timer T3412 expires, the periodic tracking area updating procedure is started.

{2421, 1} When timer T3412 expires, the periodic tracking area updating procedure is started.
{2421, 2} Start and reset of timer T3412 is described in subclause 5.3.5.

{2423, 0} The UE in state EMM-REGISTERED shall initiate the tracking area updating procedure by sending a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message to the MME, when the UE detects entering a tracking area that is not in the list of tracking areas that the UE previously registered in the MME, unless the UE is configured for "AttachWithIMSI" as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [15A] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] and is entering a tracking area in a new PLMN that is neither the registered PLMN nor in the list of equivalent PLMNs;
---

{2423, 0} The UE in state EMM-REGISTERED shall initiate the tracking area updating procedure by sending a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message to the MME, when the periodic tracking area updating timer T3412 expires;
---

{2423, 0} The UE in state EMM-REGISTERED shall initiate the tracking area updating procedure by sending a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message to the MME, when the UE enters EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE and the UE's TIN indicates "P-TMSI";
---

{2423, 0} The UE in state EMM-REGISTERED shall initiate the tracking area updating procedure by sending a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message to the MME, when the UE performs an inter-system change from S101 mode to S1 mode and has no user data pending;

{2562, 2} The MME shall not deactivate the emergency EPS bearer contexts.
---

{2562, 0} If due to regional subscription restrictions or access restrictions the UE is not allowed to access the TA, but it has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established, the MME may accept the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure when the tracking area updating procedure is initiated in EMM-CONNECTED mode.
{2562, 1} When the tracking area updating procedure is initiated in EMM-IDLE mode, the MME locally deactivates all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts and informs the UE via the EPS bearer context status IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message.
{2562, 2} The MME shall not deactivate the emergency EPS bearer contexts.
{2562, 3} The network shall consider the UE to be attached for emergency bearer services only and shall indicate in the EPS update result IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message that ISR is not activated.

{2608, 2} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contains, an indication that ISR is activated, then, if the UE had initiated the tracking area updating procedure due to a change in the UE's usage setting or the voice domain preference for E-UTRAN, the UE shall set the TIN to "GUTI" and shall stop the periodic routing area update timer T3312 or T3323, if running;

{2608, 0} The network may also indicate in the EPS update result IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message that ISR is active.

{2608, 0} The network may also indicate in the EPS update result IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message that ISR is active.
{2608, 1} If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, the network shall indicate in the EPS update result IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message that ISR is not activated.
{2608, 2} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contains, an indication that ISR is activated, then, the UE shall regard a previously assigned P-TMSI and RAI as valid and registered with the network.
{2614, 1} If the TIN currently indicates "P-TMSI" and the periodic routing area update timer T3312 is running or is deactivated, the UE shall set the TIN to "RAT-related TMSI".
{2614, 2} If the TIN currently indicates "P-TMSI" and the periodic routing area update timer T3312 has already expired, the UE shall set the TIN to "GUTI".

---

{2615, 0} The network informs the UE about the support of specific features, such as IMS voice over PS session, location services, emergency bearer services, or CIoT EPS optimizations, in the EPS network feature support information element.
{2615, 1} In a UE with IMS voice over PS capability, the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator shall be provided to the upper layers.
{2615, 2} The upper layers take the IMS voice over PS session indicator into account as specified in 3GPP TS 23.221 [8A], subclause 7.2a and subclause 7.2b, when selecting the access domain for voice sessions or calls.
{2615, 3} When initiating an emergency call, the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection.
---

{2615, 0} The network informs the UE about the support of specific features, such as IMS voice over PS session, location services, emergency bearer services, or CIoT EPS optimizations, in the EPS network feature support information element.
{2615, 1} In a UE with IMS voice over PS capability, the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator shall be provided to the upper layers.
{2615, 2} The upper layers take the IMS voice over PS session indicator into account as specified in 3GPP TS 23.221 [8A], subclause 7.2a and subclause 7.2b, when selecting the access domain for voice sessions or calls.
{2615, 3} When initiating an emergency call, the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection.
{2615, 4} When the UE determines via the IMS voice over PS session indicator that the network does not support IMS voice over PS sessions in S1 mode, then the UE shall not locally release any persistent EPS bearer context.
---

{2615, 0} The network informs the UE about the support of specific features, such as IMS voice over PS session, location services, emergency bearer services, or CIoT EPS optimizations, in the EPS network feature support information element.
{2615, 1} In a UE with IMS voice over PS capability, the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator shall be provided to the upper layers.
{2615, 2} The upper layers take the IMS voice over PS session indicator into account as specified in 3GPP TS 23.221 [8A], subclause 7.2a and subclause 7.2b, when selecting the access domain for voice sessions or calls.
{2615, 3} When initiating an emergency call, the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection.
{2615, 4} When the UE determines via the IMS voice over PS session indicator that the network does not support IMS voice over PS sessions in S1 mode, then the UE shall not locally release any persistent EPS bearer context.
{2615, 5} When the UE determines via the emergency bearer services indicator that the network does not support emergency bearer services in S1 mode, then the UE shall not locally release any emergency EPS bearer context if there is a radio bearer associated with that context.
---

{2615, 0} The network informs the UE about the support of specific features, such as IMS voice over PS session, location services, emergency bearer services, or CIoT EPS optimizations, in the EPS network feature support information element.
{2615, 1} In a UE with IMS voice over PS capability, the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator shall be provided to the upper layers.
{2615, 2} The upper layers take the IMS voice over PS session indicator into account as specified in 3GPP TS 23.221 [8A], subclause 7.2a and subclause 7.2b, when selecting the access domain for voice sessions or calls.
{2615, 3} When initiating an emergency call, the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection.
{2615, 4} When the UE determines via the IMS voice over PS session indicator that the network does not support IMS voice over PS sessions in S1 mode, then the UE shall not locally release any persistent EPS bearer context.
{2615, 5} When the UE determines via the emergency bearer services indicator that the network does not support emergency bearer services in S1 mode, then the UE shall not locally release any emergency EPS bearer context if there is a radio bearer associated with that context.
{2615, 6} In a UE with LCS capability, location services indicators shall be provided to the upper layers.
---

{2615, 0} The network informs the UE about the support of specific features, such as IMS voice over PS session, location services, emergency bearer services, or CIoT EPS optimizations, in the EPS network feature support information element.
{2615, 1} In a UE with IMS voice over PS capability, the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator shall be provided to the upper layers.
{2615, 2} The upper layers take the IMS voice over PS session indicator into account as specified in 3GPP TS 23.221 [8A], subclause 7.2a and subclause 7.2b, when selecting the access domain for voice sessions or calls.
{2615, 3} When initiating an emergency call, the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection.
{2615, 4} When the UE determines via the IMS voice over PS session indicator that the network does not support IMS voice over PS sessions in S1 mode, then the UE shall not locally release any persistent EPS bearer context.
{2615, 5} When the UE determines via the emergency bearer services indicator that the network does not support emergency bearer services in S1 mode, then the UE shall not locally release any emergency EPS bearer context if there is a radio bearer associated with that context.
{2615, 6} In a UE with LCS capability, location services indicators shall be provided to the upper layers.
{2615, 7} When MO-LR procedure is triggered by the UE's application, those indicators are taken into account as specified in 3GPP TS 24.171 [13C].
---

{2616, 0} If the RestrictDCNR bit is set to "Use of dual connectivity with NR is restricted" in the EPS network feature support IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall provide the indication that dual connectivity with NR is restricted to the upper layers.
---

{2617, 0} The UE supporting N1 mode shall operate in the mode for inter-system interworking with 5GS as follows:
{2618, 0} if the IWK N26 bit in the EPS network feature support IE is set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported", the UE shall operate in single-registration mode;
---

{2617, 0} The UE supporting N1 mode shall operate in the mode for inter-system interworking with 5GS as follows:
{2619, 0} if the IWK N26 bit in the EPS network feature support IE is set to "interworking without N26 interface supported" and the UE supports dual-registration mode, the UE may operate in dual-registration mode;
---

{2617, 0} The UE supporting N1 mode shall operate in the mode for inter-system interworking with 5GS as follows:
{2620, 0} if the IWK N26 bit in the EPS network feature support IE is set to "interworking without N26 interface supported" and the UE only supports single-registration mode, the UE shall operate in single-registration mode.
---

{2621, 0} The UE shall treat the interworking without N26 interface indicator as valid in the entire PLMN and equivalent PLMNs.
---

{2621, 0} The UE shall treat the interworking without N26 interface indicator as valid in the entire PLMN and equivalent PLMNs.
{2621, 1} The interworking procedures required for coordination between 5GMM and EMM without N26 interface are specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54].
---

{2622, 0} If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" in the Network policy IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed.
---

{2622, 0} If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" in the Network policy IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed.
{2622, 1} If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" or if the Network policy IE is not included in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed.
---

{2622, 0} If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" in the Network policy IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed.
{2622, 1} If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" or if the Network policy IE is not included in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed.
{2622, 2} The UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate this to the lower layers when, the UE initiates an EPS attach or tracking area updating procedure in a PLMN different from the PLMN where the UE performed the last successful EPS attach or tracking area updating procedure;
---

{2622, 0} If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" in the Network policy IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed.
{2622, 1} If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" or if the Network policy IE is not included in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed.
{2622, 2} The UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate this to the lower layers when, the UE is switched on;
---

{2622, 0} If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" in the Network policy IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed.
{2622, 1} If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" or if the Network policy IE is not included in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed.
{2622, 2} The UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate this to the lower layers when, the UICC containing the USIM is removed.
---

{2626, 0} If the UE has initiated the tracking area updating procedure due to manual CSG selection and receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, and the UE sent the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message in a CSG cell, the UE shall check if the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell where the UE has sent the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message are contained in the Allowed CSG list.
---

{2626, 0} If the UE has initiated the tracking area updating procedure due to manual CSG selection and receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, and the UE sent the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message in a CSG cell, the UE shall check if the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell where the UE has sent the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message are contained in the Allowed CSG list.
{2626, 1} If not, the UE shall add that CSG ID and associated PLMN identity to the Allowed CSG list and the UE may add the HNB Name to the Allowed CSG list if the HNB Name is present in neither the Operator CSG list nor the Allowed CSG list.
---

{2627, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contained a GUTI, the UE shall return a TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message to the MME to acknowledge the received GUTI.
---

{2628, 0} If the UE which was previously successfully attached for EPS and non-EPS services receives the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message with EPS update result IE indicating "combined TA/LA updated" or "combined TA/LA updated and ISR activated" as the response of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message with EPS update type IE indicating "periodic updating", the UE shall behave as follows:
{2629, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contains an IMSI, the UE is not allocated any TMSI, and shall delete any old TMSI accordingly.
---

{2628, 0} If the UE which was previously successfully attached for EPS and non-EPS services receives the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message with EPS update result IE indicating "combined TA/LA updated" or "combined TA/LA updated and ISR activated" as the response of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message with EPS update type IE indicating "periodic updating", the UE shall behave as follows:
{2630, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contains a TMSI, the UE shall use this TMSI as new temporary identity.
---

{2628, 0} If the UE which was previously successfully attached for EPS and non-EPS services receives the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message with EPS update result IE indicating "combined TA/LA updated" or "combined TA/LA updated and ISR activated" as the response of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message with EPS update type IE indicating "periodic updating", the UE shall behave as follows:
{2630, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contains a TMSI, the UE shall use this TMSI as new temporary identity.
{2630, 1} The UE shall delete its old TMSI and shall store the new TMSI.
---

{2628, 0} If the UE which was previously successfully attached for EPS and non-EPS services receives the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message with EPS update result IE indicating "combined TA/LA updated" or "combined TA/LA updated and ISR activated" as the response of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message with EPS update type IE indicating "periodic updating", the UE shall behave as follows:
{2630, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contains a TMSI, the UE shall use this TMSI as new temporary identity.
{2630, 1} The UE shall delete its old TMSI and shall store the new TMSI.
{2630, 2} In this case, a TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message is returned to the network to confirm the received TMSI.
---

{2628, 0} If the UE which was previously successfully attached for EPS and non-EPS services receives the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message with EPS update result IE indicating "combined TA/LA updated" or "combined TA/LA updated and ISR activated" as the response of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message with EPS update type IE indicating "periodic updating", the UE shall behave as follows:
{2631, 0} If neither a TMSI nor an IMSI has been included by the network in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the old TMSI, if any is available, shall be kept.
---

{2632, 0} If the header compression configuration status is included in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall stop using header compression and decompression for those EPS bearers using Control plane CIoT EPS optimisation for which the MME indicated that the header compression configuration is not used.
---

{2633, 0} If the T3448 value IE is present in the received TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall stop timer T3448 if it is running, and start timer T3448 with the value provided in the T3448 value IE.
---

{2634, 0} If the UE is using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization, the T3448 value IE is present in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message and the value indicates that this timer is either zero or deactivated, the UE shall consider this case as an abnormal case and proceed as if the T3448 value IE is not present.
---

{2634, 0} If the UE is using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization, the T3448 value IE is present in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message and the value indicates that this timer is either zero or deactivated, the UE shall consider this case as an abnormal case and proceed as if the T3448 value IE is not present.
{2635, 0} If the UE in EMM-IDLE mode initiated the tracking area updating procedure and the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message does not include the T3448 value IE and if timer T3448 is running, then the UE shall stop timer T3448.
---

{2636, 0} If the UE has indicated "service gap control supported" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and, the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contains the T3447 value IE, then the UE shall store the new T3447 value, erase any previous stored T3447 value if exists and use the the new T3447 value with the T3447 timer next time it is started;
---

{2636, 0} If the UE has indicated "service gap control supported" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and, the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message does not contain the T3447 value IE, then the UE shall erase any previous stored T3447 value if exists and stop the T3447 timer if running.
---

{2639, 0} Upon receiving a TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message, the MME shall stop timer T3450 and change to state EMM-REGISTERED.
---

{2639, 0} Upon receiving a TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message, the MME shall stop timer T3450 and change to state EMM-REGISTERED.
{2639, 1} The GUTI, if sent in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, shall be considered as valid.
---

{2640, 0} For inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode, if the UE has included an eKSI in the NAS Key Set Identifier IE indicating a current EPS security context in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message by which the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is integrity protected, the MME shall take one of the following actions:
{2641, 0} if the MME retrieves the current EPS security context as indicated by the eKSI and GUTI sent by the UE, the MME shall integrity check the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current EPS security context and integrity protect the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message using the current EPS security context;
---

{2640, 0} For inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode, if the UE has included an eKSI in the NAS Key Set Identifier IE indicating a current EPS security context in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message by which the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is integrity protected, the MME shall take one of the following actions:
{2642, 0} if the MME cannot retrieve the current EPS security context as indicated by the eKSI and GUTI sent by the UE, and if the UE has included a valid GPRS ciphering key sequence number, the MME shall create a new mapped EPS security context as specified in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19], and then perform a security mode control procedure to indicate the use of the new mapped EPS security context to the UE;
---

{2640, 0} For inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode, if the UE has included an eKSI in the NAS Key Set Identifier IE indicating a current EPS security context in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message by which the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is integrity protected, the MME shall take one of the following actions:
{2643, 0} if the UE has not included an Additional GUTI IE, the MME may treat the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as in the previous item, i.e. as if it cannot retrieve the current EPS security context.
---

{2644, 0} For inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode, if the UE has not included a valid eKSI in the NAS Key Set Identifier IE and has included a valid GPRS ciphering key sequence number in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, the MME shall create a new mapped EPS security context as specified in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19], and then perform a security mode control procedure to indicate the use of the new mapped EPS security context to the UE.
---

{2645, 0} For inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode, if the UE has included an eKSI in the NAS Key Set Identifier IE indicating a 5G NAS security context in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message by which the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is integrity protected, the MME shall take actions as specified in subclause 4.4.2.3.
---

{2646, 0} For inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
---

{2646, 0} For inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
{2646, 1} The MME shall verify the received UE security capabilities in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
---

{2646, 0} For inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
{2646, 1} The MME shall verify the received UE security capabilities in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
{2646, 2} The MME shall then take one of the following actions:
{2647, 0} if the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST does not contain a valid KSIASME in the Non-current native NAS key set identifier IE, the MME shall remove the non-current native EPS security context, if any, for any GUTI for this UE.
---

{2646, 0} For inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
{2646, 1} The MME shall verify the received UE security capabilities in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
{2646, 2} The MME shall then take one of the following actions:
{2647, 0} if the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST does not contain a valid KSIASME in the Non-current native NAS key set identifier IE, the MME shall remove the non-current native EPS security context, if any, for any GUTI for this UE.
{2647, 1} The MME shall then integrity protect and cipher the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message using the security context based on K'ASME and take the mapped EPS security context into use;
---

{2646, 0} For inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
{2646, 1} The MME shall verify the received UE security capabilities in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
{2646, 2} The MME shall then take one of the following actions:
{2648, 0} if the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST contains a valid KSIASME in the Non-current native NAS key set identifier IE, the MME may initiate a security mode control procedure to take the corresponding native EPS security context into use.
---

{2649, 0} For inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
---

{2649, 0} For inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
{2649, 1} The MME shall verify the received UE security capabilities in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
---

{2649, 0} For inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
{2649, 1} The MME shall verify the received UE security capabilities in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
{2649, 2} The MME shall then take one of the following actions:
{2650, 0} if the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST does not contain a valid KSIASME in the Non-current native NAS key set identifier IE, the MME shall remove the non-current native EPS security context, if any, for any GUTI for this UE.
---

{2649, 0} For inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
{2649, 1} The MME shall verify the received UE security capabilities in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
{2649, 2} The MME shall then take one of the following actions:
{2650, 0} if the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST does not contain a valid KSIASME in the Non-current native NAS key set identifier IE, the MME shall remove the non-current native EPS security context, if any, for any GUTI for this UE.
{2650, 1} The MME shall then integrity protect and cipher the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message using the security context based on K'ASME and take the mapped EPS security context into use;
---

{2649, 0} For inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall integrity check TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message using the current K'ASME as derived when triggering the handover to E-UTRAN.
{2649, 1} The MME shall verify the received UE security capabilities in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
{2649, 2} The MME shall then take one of the following actions:
{2651, 0} if the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST contains a valid KSIASME in the Non-current native NAS key set identifier IE, the MME may initiate a security mode control procedure to take the corresponding native EPS security context into use.
---

{2652, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the UE has set the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, the MME may include a UE radio capability ID IE or a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message.
---

{2652, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the UE has set the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, the MME may include a UE radio capability ID IE or a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message.
{2652, 1} In this case the MME shall enter state EMM-COMMON-PROCEDURE-INITIATED as described in subclause 5.4.1.
---

{2653, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the UE has set the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message includes, a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "Network-assigned UE radio capability IDs deletion requested", the UE shall, delete any network-assigned UE radio capability IDs associated with the registered PLMN stored at the UE;
---

{2653, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the UE has set the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message includes, a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "Network-assigned UE radio capability IDs deletion requested", the UE shall, send a TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message to the network to acknowledge the received UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE;
---

{2653, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the UE has set the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message includes, a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "Network-assigned UE radio capability IDs deletion requested", the UE shall, after the completion of the ongoing tracking area updating procedure, initiate a tracking area updating procedure as specified in subclause 5.5.3 over the existing NAS signalling connection;
---

{2653, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the UE has set the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message includes, a UE radio capability ID IE, the UE shall, store the UE radio capability ID as specified in annex C;
---

{2653, 0} In WB-S1 mode, if the UE has set the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message includes, a UE radio capability ID IE, the UE shall, send a TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message to the network to acknowledge the received UE radio capability ID IE.
---

{2662, 0} Apart from the actions on the tracking area updating attempt counter, the description for tracking area update for EPS services as specified in subclause 5.5.3.2.4 shall be followed.
---

{2662, 0} Apart from the actions on the tracking area updating attempt counter, the description for tracking area update for EPS services as specified in subclause 5.5.3.2.4 shall be followed.
{2662, 1} In addition, the following description for tracking area updating for SMS services applies.
---

{2663, 0} In NB-S1 mode, if the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE and supports NB-S1 mode only, the MME decides to accept the tracking area update request for EPS services only and, the location update for non-EPS services is not accepted by the VLR as specified in 3GPP TS 29.118 [16A];
---

---

{2666, 0} the MME shall set the EPS update result IE to "EPS only", shall not indicate "SMS only" in the Additional update result IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message and shall include an appropriate SMS services status value.

{2684, 0} If the tracking area updating cannot be accepted by the network, the MME sends a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message to the UE including an appropriate EMM cause value.
---

{2685, 0} If a tracking area update request from a UE with a LIPA PDN connection is not accepted due to the reasons specified in subclause 5.5.3.2.4, the MME shall send the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message with EMM cause value #10 "Implicitly detached".
---

{2686, 0} If the tracking area update request is rejected due to general NAS level mobility management congestion control, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and assign a value for back-off timer T3346.
---

{2687, 0} In NB-S1 mode, if the tracking area update request is rejected due to operator determined barring, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and assign a value for back-off timer T3346.
---

{2688, 0} If the tracking area request is rejected due to service gap control as specified in subclause 5.3.17 i.e. the T3447 timer is running, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and may assign a back-off timer T3346 with the remaining time of the running T3447 timer.
---

{2689, 0} If the tracking area update request is rejected due to incompatibility between the CIoT EPS optimizations supported by the UE and what the network supports and the network sets the EMM cause value to #15 "no suitable cells in tracking area", the network may additionally include the Extended EMM cause IE with value "requested EPS optimization not supported".
---

{2690, 0} Based on operator policy, if the tracking area update request is rejected due to core network redirection for CIoT optimizations, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #31 "Redirection to 5GCN required".
---

{2691, 0} If the UE initiated the tracking area updating procedure due to inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode, and the MME does not support N26 interface, the MME shall send a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message with EMM cause value #9 "UE identity cannot be derived by the network".
---

{2692, 0} Upon receiving the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message, if the message is integrity protected or contains a reject cause other than EMM cause value #25, the UE shall stop timer T3430 and stop any transmission of user data.
---

{2693, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message with EMM cause #25 was received without integrity protection, then the UE shall discard the message.

{2716, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM state as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the case when the registration procedure for mobility and periodic registration update performed over 3GPP access and indicating "mobility registration updating" in the 5GS registration type IE of the REGISTRATION REQUEST message is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value.

{2749, 2} Additionally, the UE shall remove the current TAI from the stored TAI list if present and, if the UE is in WB-S1 mode and the Extended EMM cause IE with value "E-UTRAN not allowed" is included in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message, the UE supports "E-UTRA Disabling for EMM cause #15", and the "E-UTRA Disabling Allowed for EMM cause #15" parameter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [15A] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] is present and set to enabled; then the UE shall disable the E-UTRA capability as specified in subclause 4.5 and search for a suitable cell in another location area or 5GS tracking area;
---

{2756, 0} If the T3346 value IE is present in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message and the value indicates that this timer is neither zero nor deactivated, the UE shall proceed as described below, otherwise it shall be considered as an abnormal case and the behaviour of the UE for this case is specified in subclause 5.5.3.2.6.
---

{2694, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.

---

{2694, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.
{2755, 0} When the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{2757, 0} The UE shall abort the tracking area updating procedure, reset the tracking area updating attempt counter and set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED.
{2757, 1} If the rejected request was not for initiating a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall change to state EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE.
---

{2694, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.

{2759, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message is integrity protected, the UE shall start timer with the value provided in the T3346 value IE.
---

{2694, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.
{2755, 0} When the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message with EMM cause #22	;
{2760, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall start timer T3346 with a random value from the default range specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13].
---

{2694, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.
{2777, 0} When the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;

---

{2694, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.
{2777, 0} When the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{2778, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs, and set the tracking area update counter to 5.
{2778, 1} The UE shall start an implementation specific timer, setting its value to 2 times the value of T as defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{2694, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.
{2777, 0} When the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{2778, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs, and set the tracking area update counter to 5.
{2778, 1} The UE shall start an implementation specific timer, setting its value to 2 times the value of T as defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{2778, 2} While this timer is running, the UE shall not consider the PLMN + RAT combination that provided this reject cause as a candidate for PLMN selection.
---

{2694, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the EMM cause value received in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.
{2777, 0} When the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{2778, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs, and set the tracking area update counter to 5.
{2778, 1} The UE shall start an implementation specific timer, setting its value to 2 times the value of T as defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{2778, 2} While this timer is running, the UE shall not consider the PLMN + RAT combination that provided this reject cause as a candidate for PLMN selection.
{2778, 3} The UE then enters state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

---

---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2847, 0} Transmission failure of TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{2848, 0} If the current TAI is not in the TAI list, the tracking area updating procedure shall be aborted and re-initiated immediately.
{2848, 1} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2847, 0} Transmission failure of TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message indication with TAI change from lower layers
{2849, 0} If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list, it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2850, 0} Transmission failure of TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message indication without TAI change from lower layers
{2851, 0} It is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2852, 0} "Extended wait time" from the lower layers
{2853, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message contained the low priority indicator set to "MS is configured for NAS signalling low priority", the UE shall start timer T3346 with the "Extended wait time" value and reset the tracking area updating attempt counter.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2852, 0} "Extended wait time" from the lower layers
{2854, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message did not contain the low priority indicator set to "MS is configured for NAS signalling low priority", the UE is operating in NB-S1 mode and the UE is not a UE configured to use AC11 – 15 in selected PLMN, then the UE shall start timer T3346 with the "Extended wait time" value and reset the tracking area updating attempt counter.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2852, 0} "Extended wait time" from the lower layers
{2855, 0} In other cases the UE shall ignore the "Extended wait time".
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2852, 0} "Extended wait time" from the lower layers
{2856, 0} The UE shall abort the tracking area updating procedure, stay in the current serving cell, set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, change the state to EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE and apply the normal cell reselection process.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2852, 0} "Extended wait time" from the lower layers
{2857, 0} If the UE had used eDRX before initiating tracking area updating procedure, then the UE shall continue to use the eDRX with the extended DRX parameters IE received during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2852, 0} "Extended wait time" from the lower layers
{2858, 0} The UE shall proceed as described below.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2859, 0} "Extended wait time CP data" from the lower layers
{2860, 0} If the UE is operating in NB-S1 mode and supports the timer T3448, the UE shall start the timer T3448 with the "Extended wait time CP data" value.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2859, 0} "Extended wait time CP data" from the lower layers
{2860, 0} If the UE is operating in NB-S1 mode and supports the timer T3448, the UE shall start the timer T3448 with the "Extended wait time CP data" value.
{2860, 1} If the UE is operating in NB-S1 mode and does not support the timer T3448, the UE shall start the timer T3346 with the "Extended wait time CP data" value and reset the tracking area updating attempt counter.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2859, 0} "Extended wait time CP data" from the lower layers
{2861, 0} In other cases the UE shall ignore the "Extended wait time CP data".
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2859, 0} "Extended wait time CP data" from the lower layers
{2862, 0} The UE shall abort the tracking area updating procedure, stay in the current serving cell, set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, change the state to EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE and apply the normal cell reselection process.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2859, 0} "Extended wait time CP data" from the lower layers
{2863, 0} If the UE had used eDRX before initiating tracking area updating procedure, then the UE shall continue to use the eDRX with the extended DRX parameters IE received during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2859, 0} "Extended wait time CP data" from the lower layers
{2864, 0} The UE shall proceed as described below.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2866, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure unless, the UE is in EMM-CONNECTED mode;
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2866, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure unless, the UE received a paging;
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2866, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure unless, the UE is a UE configured to use AC11 – 15 in selected PLMN;
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2866, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure unless, the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services;
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2866, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure unless, the UE is requested by the upper layer for a CS fallback for emergency call or a 1xCS fallback for emergency call;
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2866, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure unless, the UE in NB-S1 mode is requested by the upper layer to transmit user data related to an exceptional event and the UE is allowed to use exception data reporting;
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2866, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure unless, the UE in NB-S1 mode is requested by the upper layer to transmit user data related to an exceptional event and timer T3346 was not started when NAS signaling connection was established with RRC establishment cause set to "MO exception data";
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2866, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure unless, the UE has a PDN connection established without the NAS signalling low priority indication or is establishing a PDN connection without the NAS signalling low priority indication, the timer T3402 and the timer T3411 are not running and the timer T3346 was started due to rejection of a NAS request message which contained the low priority indicator set to "MS is configured for NAS signalling low priority".
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2876, 0} The UE stays in the current serving cell and applies the normal cell reselection process.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2877, 0} If the TAI of the current serving cell is not included in the TAI list or the TIN indicates "P-TMSI", the UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED and change to state EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2878, 0} If the tracking area updating procedure needs to be initiated for an MO MMTEL voice call is started, then a notification that the procedure was not initiated due to network congestion shall be provided to upper layers.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2865, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{2879, 0} The UE shall proceed as described below.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

{2881, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure with the "signalling active" flag set, unless, the UE which is only using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization received a paging;
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2880, 0} Timer T3448 is running

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2887, 0} Mobile originated detach required
{2888, 0} Detach due to removal of USIM or due to switch off:
{2889, 0} The tracking area updating procedure shall be aborted, and the UE initiated detach procedure shall be performed.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2887, 0} Mobile originated detach required
{2890, 0} Detach not due to removal of USIM and not due to switch off:
{2891, 0} The UE initiated detach procedure shall be initiated after successful completion of the tracking area updating procedure.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2892, 0} Timer T3447 is running
{2893, 0} The UE shall not start the tracking area updating procedure with the "signalling active" flag set or the "active" flag set, unless, the UE received a paging;
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

{2897, 1} The tracking area update request procedure is started, if still necessary, when timer T3447 expires.
---

{2809, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2898, 0} Tracking area updating and paging procedure collision
{2899, 0} If the UE receives a CS SERVICE NOTIFICATION message before the tracking area updating procedure has been completed, the UE shall progress the tracking area updating procedure and respond to the CS SERVICE NOTIFICATION upon successful completion of the tracking area updating procedure.
---

{2900, 0} For the cases b, c, d, e, f with detach type "re-attach required" or "re-attach not required" with EMM cause other than #2 "IMSI unknown in HSS", k and ka, the UE shall stop any ongoing transmission of user data.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2902, 0} Timer T3430 shall be stopped if still running.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2903, 0} For the cases b, c, d, la k when the "Extended wait time" is ignored, and ka when the "Extended wait time CP data" is ignored, if the tracking area updating request is not for initiating a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the tracking area updating attempt counter shall be incremented, unless it was already set to 5.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2904, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the TAI of the current serving cell is included in the TAI list, the EPS update status is equal to EU1 UPDATED, the TIN does not indicate "P-TMSI" and the tracking area updating procedure is performed not due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode and the tracking area updating procedure is not performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2, the UE shall keep the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2904, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the TAI of the current serving cell is included in the TAI list, the EPS update status is equal to EU1 UPDATED, the TIN does not indicate "P-TMSI" and the tracking area updating procedure is performed not due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode and the tracking area updating procedure is not performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2, the UE shall keep the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
{2905, 1} The UE shall start timer T3411.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2904, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the TAI of the current serving cell is included in the TAI list, the EPS update status is equal to EU1 UPDATED, the TIN does not indicate "P-TMSI" and the tracking area updating procedure is performed not due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode and the tracking area updating procedure is not performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2:
{2906, 0} If in addition the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST indicated "periodic updating" or if tracking area updating procedure was initiated to recover NAS signalling connection due to "RRC Connection failure" from the lower layers, none of the other reasons for initiating the tracking area updating procedure listed in subclause 5.5.3.2.2 was applicable, and the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message did not include T3324 value IE, T3412 extended value IE or Extended DRX parameters IE, the timer T3411 may be stopped when the UE enters EMM-CONNECTED mode.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2904, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the TAI of the current serving cell is included in the TAI list, the EPS update status is equal to EU1 UPDATED, the TIN does not indicate "P-TMSI" and the tracking area updating procedure is performed not due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode and the tracking area updating procedure is not performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2:
{2907, 0} If timer T3411 expires the tracking area updating procedure is triggered again.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2908, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, and the TAI of the current serving cell is not included in the TAI list or the EPS update status is different to EU1 UPDATED or the TIN indicates "P-TMSI" or the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or if the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2, for the cases k and l, the tracking area updating procedure is started, if still necessary, when timer T3346 expires or is stopped.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2908, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, and the TAI of the current serving cell is not included in the TAI list or the EPS update status is different to EU1 UPDATED or the TIN indicates "P-TMSI" or the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or if the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2, for the case ka, if timer T3346 is started, the tracking area updating procedure is started, if still necessary, when timer T3346 expires or is stopped.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2908, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, and the TAI of the current serving cell is not included in the TAI list or the EPS update status is different to EU1 UPDATED or the TIN indicates "P-TMSI" or the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or if the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2, for the case ka, if timer T3448 is started and the "signalling active" flag is set in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, the tracking area updating procedure is started, if still necessary, when timer T3448 expires or is stopped.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2908, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, and the TAI of the current serving cell is not included in the TAI list or the EPS update status is different to EU1 UPDATED or the TIN indicates "P-TMSI" or the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or if the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2, for the case la, if the "signalling active" flag is set in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, the tracking area updating procedure is started, if still necessary, when timer T3448 expires or is stopped.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:

---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
