{2913, 1} When timer T3411 expires the tracking area updating procedure is triggered again.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2908, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, and the TAI of the current serving cell is not included in the TAI list or the EPS update status is different to EU1 UPDATED or the TIN indicates "P-TMSI" or the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or if the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2, for the cases b, c, d, k when the "Extended wait time" is ignored, and ka when the "Extended wait time CP data" is ignored, if the tracking area updating request is not for initiating a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall start timer T3411, shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED and change to state EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE.
{2913, 1} When timer T3411 expires the tracking area updating procedure is triggered again.
{2914, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GPRS update status as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the abnormal case when a normal or periodic routing area updating procedure fails and the routing area updating attempt counter is less than 5 and the GPRS update status is different from GU1 UPDATED.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2908, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, and the TAI of the current serving cell is not included in the TAI list or the EPS update status is different to EU1 UPDATED or the TIN indicates "P-TMSI" or the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or if the tracking area updating procedure is performed due to cases g, m, n, za, zc in subclause 5.5.3.2.2, for the cases b, c, d, k when the "Extended wait time" is ignored, and ka when the "Extended wait time CP data" is ignored, if the tracking area updating request is not for initiating a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall start timer T3411, shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED and change to state EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE.
{2913, 1} When timer T3411 expires the tracking area updating procedure is triggered again.
{2915, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GS update status as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the abnormal cases when a registration procedure for mobility and periodic registration fails and the registration attempt counter is less than 5 and the 5GS update status is different from 5U1 UPDATED.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3402, shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED;
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall delete the list of equivalent PLMNs and shall change to state EMM-REGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-UPDATE or optionally to EMM-REGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6];
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GPRS update status as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the abnormal case when a normal or periodic routing area updating procedure fails and the routing area updating attempt counter is equal to 5;
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GS update status as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the abnormal case when a registration procedure for mobility or periodic registration update performed over 3GPP access fails and the registration attempt counter is equal to 5;
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if the UE does not change to state EMM-REGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if the UE does not change to state EMM-REGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN.
{2922, 1} UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if the UE does not change to state EMM-REGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN.
{2922, 1} UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology.
{2923, 0} If a GERAN or UTRAN cell is selected, a UE in PS mode 1 or PS mode 2 of operation shall proceed with appropriate GMM specific procedures;
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if the UE does not change to state EMM-REGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN.
{2922, 1} UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology.
{2923, 0} If a GERAN or UTRAN cell is selected, a UE in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation shall proceed with appropriate MM or GMM specific procedures.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if the UE does not change to state EMM-REGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN.
{2922, 1} UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology.
{2926, 0} If an NG-RAN cell is selected, the UE shall proceed with appropriate 5GMM specific procedures.
---

{2901, 0} For the cases b, c, d, k, ka, l and la, the UE shall proceed as follows:
{2916, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if the UE does not change to state EMM-REGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN.
{2922, 1} UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology.
{2927, 0} Additionally, the UE may disable the E-UTRA capability as specified in subclause 4.5.
---

{2929, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{2930, 0} if the tracking area update was successful for EPS services only and the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contained a value included in the SMS services status IE not treated in subclause 5.5.3.2.4A or the SMS services status IE is not included in the message, the UE shall proceed as follows:
---

{2929, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{2931, 0} The UE shall stop timer T3430 if still running.
---

{2929, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{2931, 0} The UE shall stop timer T3430 if still running.
{2931, 1} The tracking area updating attempt counter shall be incremented, unless it was already set to 5;
---

{2929, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{2932, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the UE shall start timer T3411, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
---

{2929, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{2932, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the UE shall start timer T3411, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
{2933, 1} When timer T3411 expires the normal tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" or the combined tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" is triggered;
---

{2929, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{2934, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3402, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
---

{2929, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{2934, 0} If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3402, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
{2935, 1} When timer T3402 expires the normal tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" or the combined tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" is triggered;
---

{2929, 0} The UE shall proceed as follows:
{2936, 0} otherwise, the abnormal cases specified in subclause 5.5.3.2.6 apply.
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2939, 0} If a lower layer failure occurs before the message TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE has been received from the UE and a GUTI has been assigned, the network shall abort the procedure, enter EMM-IDLE mode and shall consider both, the old and new GUTI as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2939, 0} If a lower layer failure occurs before the message TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE has been received from the UE and a GUTI has been assigned, the network shall abort the procedure, enter EMM-IDLE mode and shall consider both, the old and new GUTI as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
{2939, 1} During this period the network may use the identification procedure followed by a GUTI reallocation procedure if the old GUTI is used by the UE in a subsequent message.
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2939, 0} If a lower layer failure occurs before the message TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE has been received from the UE and a GUTI has been assigned, the network shall abort the procedure, enter EMM-IDLE mode and shall consider both, the old and new GUTI as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
{2939, 1} During this period the network may use the identification procedure followed by a GUTI reallocation procedure if the old GUTI is used by the UE in a subsequent message.
{2940, 0} The network may page with IMSI if paging with old and new S-TMSI fails.
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2939, 0} If a lower layer failure occurs before the message TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE has been received from the UE and a GUTI has been assigned, the network shall abort the procedure, enter EMM-IDLE mode and shall consider both, the old and new GUTI as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
{2939, 1} During this period the network may use the identification procedure followed by a GUTI reallocation procedure if the old GUTI is used by the UE in a subsequent message.
{2940, 0} The network may page with IMSI if paging with old and new S-TMSI fails.
{2940, 1} Paging with IMSI causes the UE to re-attach as described in subclause 5.6.2.2.2.

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2941, 0} Protocol error

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2947, 0} T3450 time-out
{2948, 0} On the first expiry of the timer, the network shall retransmit the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message and shall reset and restart timer T3450.
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2947, 0} T3450 time-out
{2948, 0} On the first expiry of the timer, the network shall retransmit the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message and shall reset and restart timer T3450.
{2948, 1} The retransmission is performed four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3450, the tracking area updating procedure is aborted.
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2947, 0} T3450 time-out
{2948, 0} On the first expiry of the timer, the network shall retransmit the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message and shall reset and restart timer T3450.
{2948, 1} The retransmission is performed four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3450, the tracking area updating procedure is aborted.
{2948, 2} Both, the old and the new GUTI shall be considered as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2947, 0} T3450 time-out
{2948, 0} On the first expiry of the timer, the network shall retransmit the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message and shall reset and restart timer T3450.
{2948, 1} The retransmission is performed four times, i.e. on the fifth expiry of timer T3450, the tracking area updating procedure is aborted.
{2948, 2} Both, the old and the new GUTI shall be considered as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
{2948, 3} During this period the network acts as described for case a above.

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2949, 0} TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST received after the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message has been sent and before the TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message is received
{2950, 0} If one or more of the information elements in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message differ from the ones received within the previous TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, the previously initiated tracking area updating procedure shall be aborted if the TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message has not been received and the new tracking area updating procedure shall be progressed;
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

{2951, 0} If the information elements do not differ, then the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message shall be resent and the timer T3450 shall be restarted if an TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message is expected.
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2949, 0} TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST received after the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message has been sent and before the TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message is received
{2951, 0} If the information elements do not differ, then the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message shall be resent and the timer T3450 shall be restarted if an TRACKING AREA UPDATE COMPLETE message is expected.
{2951, 1} In that case, the retransmission counter related to T3450 is not incremented.

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2952, 0} More than one TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST received and no TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message has been sent

---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2952, 0} More than one TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST received and no TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message has been sent
{2954, 0} If the information elements do not differ, then the network shall continue with the previous tracking area updating procedure and shall not treat any further this TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2955, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{2956, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the TAI of the target cell and the TAI of the source cell are the same, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.
---

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{2955, 0} Lower layers indication of non-delivered NAS PDU due to handover
{2956, 0} If the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the TAI of the target cell and the TAI of the source cell are the same, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.
{2956, 1} If a failure of the handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message.

{2938, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:

{3257, 0} The purpose of the service request procedure is to transfer the EMM mode from EMM-IDLE to EMM-CONNECTED mode.
---

{3257, 0} The purpose of the service request procedure is to transfer the EMM mode from EMM-IDLE to EMM-CONNECTED mode.
{3257, 1} If the UE is not using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization, this procedure is used to establish the radio and S1 bearers when user data or signalling is to be sent.
---

{3257, 0} The purpose of the service request procedure is to transfer the EMM mode from EMM-IDLE to EMM-CONNECTED mode.
{3257, 1} If the UE is not using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization, this procedure is used to establish the radio and S1 bearers when user data or signalling is to be sent.
{3257, 2} If the UE is using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization, this procedure can be used for UE initiated transfer of user data via the control plane.
---

{3257, 0} The purpose of the service request procedure is to transfer the EMM mode from EMM-IDLE to EMM-CONNECTED mode.
{3257, 1} If the UE is not using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization, this procedure is used to establish the radio and S1 bearers when user data or signalling is to be sent.
{3257, 2} If the UE is using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization, this procedure can be used for UE initiated transfer of user data via the control plane.
{3257, 3} Another purpose of this procedure is to invoke MO/MT CS fallback or 1xCS fallback procedures.
---

{3258, 0} This procedure is used when, the network has downlink signalling pending;
---

{3258, 0} This procedure is used when, the UE has uplink signalling pending;
---

{3258, 0} This procedure is used when, the UE or the network has user data pending and the UE is in EMM-IDLE mode;
---

{3258, 0} This procedure is used when, the UE is in EMM-CONNECTED mode and has a NAS signalling connection only; the UE is using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization, and it has user data pending which is to be transferred via user plane radio bearers;
---

{3258, 0} This procedure is used when, the UE in EMM-IDLE or EMM-CONNECTED mode has requested to perform mobile originating/terminating CS fallback or 1xCS fallback;
---

{3258, 0} This procedure is used when, the network has downlink cdma2000® signalling pending;
---

{3258, 0} This procedure is used when, the UE has uplink cdma2000® signalling pending;
---

{3258, 0} This procedure is used when, the UE has to request resources for ProSe direct discovery or Prose direct communication;
---

{3258, 0} This procedure is used when, the UE has to request resources for V2X communication over PC5.
---

{3268, 0} The service request procedure is initiated by the UE, however, for the downlink transfer of signalling, cdma2000® signalling or user data in EMM-IDLE mode, the trigger is given by the network by means of the paging procedure.
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE in EMM-IDLE mode receives a paging request using S-TMSI with CN domain indicator set to "PS" from the network;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE, in EMM-IDLE mode, has pending user data to be sent;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE, in EMM-IDLE mode, has uplink signalling pending;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE in EMM-IDLE or EMM-CONNECTED mode is configured to use CS fallback and has a mobile originating CS fallback request from the upper layer;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE in EMM-IDLE mode is configured to use CS fallback and receives a paging request with CN domain indicator set to "CS", or the UE in EMM-CONNECTED mode is configured to use CS fallback and receives a CS SERVICE NOTIFICATION message;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE in EMM-IDLE or EMM-CONNECTED mode is configured to use 1xCS fallback and has a mobile originating 1xCS fallback request from the upper layer;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE in EMM-CONNECTED mode is configured to use 1xCS fallback and accepts cdma2000® signalling messages containing a 1xCS paging request received over E-UTRAN;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE, in EMM-IDLE mode, has uplink cdma2000® signalling pending to be transmitted over E-UTRAN;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE, in EMM-IDLE or EMM-CONNECTED mode, is configured to use 1xCS fallback, accepts cdma2000® signalling messages containing a 1xCS paging request received over cdma2000® 1xRTT, and the network supports dual Rx CSFB or provide CS fallback registration parameters;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE, in EMM-IDLE or EMM-CONNECTED mode, has uplink cdma2000® signalling pending to be transmitted over cdma2000® 1xRTT, and the network supports dual Rx CSFB or provide CS fallback registration parameters;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE performs an inter-system change from S101 mode to S1 mode and has user data pending;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE in EMM-IDLE mode has to request resources for ProSe direct discovery or Prose direct communication;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE, in EMM-CONNECTED mode and has a NAS signalling connection only, is using EPS services with control plane CIoT EPS optimization and has pending user data to be sent via user plane radio bearers;
---

{3269, 0} The UE shall invoke the service request procedure when, the UE in EMM-IDLE mode has to request resources for V2X communication over PC5.
---

{3284, 0} If one of the above criteria to invoke the service request procedure is fulfilled, then the service request procedure may only be initiated by the UE when the following conditions are fulfilled:
{3285, 0} its EPS update status is EU1 UPDATED, and the TAI of the current serving cell is included in the TAI list;
---

{3284, 0} If one of the above criteria to invoke the service request procedure is fulfilled, then the service request procedure may only be initiated by the UE when the following conditions are fulfilled:
{3286, 0} no EMM specific procedure is ongoing.
---

{3287, 0} A service request attempt counter is used to limit the number of service request attempts and no response from the network.
---

{3287, 0} A service request attempt counter is used to limit the number of service request attempts and no response from the network.
{3287, 1} The service request attempt counter shall be incremented as specified in subclause 5.6.1.6.
---

{3288, 0} The service request attempt counter shall be reset when, a normal or periodic tracking area updating or a combined tracking area updating procedure is successfully completed;
---

{3288, 0} The service request attempt counter shall be reset when, a service request procedure in order to obtain packet services is successfully completed;
---

{3288, 0} The service request attempt counter shall be reset when, the UE moves to EMM-DEREGISTERED state.

{3316, 0} Upon receipt of the SERVICE REQUEST, EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST or CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message, the MME may initiate the EMM common procedures, e.g. the authentication procedure and security mode control procedure.
---

{3421, 0} If the service request cannot be accepted, the network shall return a SERVICE REJECT message to the UE including an appropriate EMM cause value.
---

{3422, 0} Based on local policies or configurations in the MME, if the MME determines to change the periodic tracking area update timer, or if the MME determines to change the PSM usage or the value of timer T3324 in the UE for which PSM is allowed by the MME, the MME may return a SERVICE REJECT with the cause #10 "implicitly detached" to the UE.
---

{3423, 0} Based on operator policy, if the service request procedure is rejected due to core network redirection for CIoT optimizations, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #31 "Redirection to 5GCN required".
---

{3424, 0} The MME may be configured to perform MME-based access control for mobile originating CS fallback calls for a certain area A by rejecting related service request with EMM cause #39 "CS service temporarily not available".
---

{3425, 0} The MME may further be configured for a certain area A' to exempt service requests for mobile originating CS fallback calls from this MME-based access control, if, the service request is initiated in EMM-IDLE mode;
---

{3425, 0} The MME may further be configured for a certain area A' to exempt service requests for mobile originating CS fallback calls from this MME-based access control, if, the UE indicated support of eNodeB-based access control for mobile originating CS fallback calls during an attach or tracking area updating procedure.
---

{3428, 0} When the EMM cause value is #39 "CS service temporarily not available", the MME shall include a value for timer T3442 in the SERVICE REJECT message.
---

{3428, 0} When the EMM cause value is #39 "CS service temporarily not available", the MME shall include a value for timer T3442 in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3428, 1} If a mobile terminating CS fallback call is aborted by the network during call establishment as specified in 3GPP TS 29.118 [16A], the MME shall include the EMM cause value #39 "CS service temporarily not available" and set the value of timer T3442 to zero.
---

{3429, 0} If a service request from a UE with only LIPA PDN connections is not accepted due to the reasons specified in subclause 5.6.1.4, depending on the service request received, the MME shall include the following EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message:
{3430, 0} if the service request received is not due to CS fallback or 1xCS fallback, EMM cause value #10 "implicitly detached";
---

{3429, 0} If a service request from a UE with only LIPA PDN connections is not accepted due to the reasons specified in subclause 5.6.1.4, depending on the service request received, the MME shall include the following EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message:
{3431, 0} if the service request received is due to CS fallback or 1xCS fallback, EMM cause value #40 "no EPS bearer context activated".
---

{3432, 0} If a service request from a UE with only remaining SIPTO at the local network PDN connections is not accepted due to the reasons specified in subclause 5.6.1.4, depending on the service request received, the MME shall, if the service request received is due to CS fallback or 1xCS fallback, include the EMM cause value #40 "no EPS bearer context activated" in the SERVICE REJECT message;
---

{3432, 0} If a service request from a UE with only remaining SIPTO at the local network PDN connections is not accepted due to the reasons specified in subclause 5.6.1.4, depending on the service request received, the MME shall, if the service request received is not due to CS fallback or 1xCS fallback, abort the service request procedure and send a DETACH REQUEST message to the UE with detach type "re-attach required".
---

{3435, 0} If the service request for mobile originated services is rejected due to general NAS level mobility management congestion control, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and assign a value for back-off timer T3346.
---

{3436, 0} In NB-S1 mode, if the service request for mobile originated services is rejected due to operator determined barring, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and assign a value for back-off timer T3346.
---

{3437, 0} If the service request for mobile originated services is rejected due to service gap control as specified in subclause 5.3.17 i.e. the T3447 timer is running, the network shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and may assign a back-off timer T3346 with the remaining time of the running T3447 timer.
---

{3438, 0} If the MME sends a SERVICE REJECT message upon receipt of the CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message piggybacked with the ESM DATA TRANSPORT message, if the Release assistance indication IE is not set to "No further uplink and no further downlink data transmission subsequent to the uplink data transmission is expected" in the message;
---

---

{3442, 0} then the MME shall set the EMM cause value to #22 "congestion" and assign a value for control plane data back-off timer T3448.
---

{3443, 0} On receipt of the SERVICE REJECT message, if the UE is in state EMM-SERVICE-REQUEST-INITIATED and the message is integrity protected or contains a reject cause other than EMM cause value #25, the UE shall reset the service request attempt counter, stop timer T3417, T3417ext or T3417ext-mt, if running.
---

{3444, 0} If the SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #25 or #31 was received without integrity protection, then the UE shall discard the message.

{3449, 3} If the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS and the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3448, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #8	;
{3450, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status, P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number and the MM parameters update status, TMSI, LAI and ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the service request procedure is rejected with the GMM cause with the same value.
{3450, 1} The USIM shall be considered as invalid also for non-EPS services until switching off or the UICC containing the USIM is removed or the timer T3245 expires as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
{3450, 2} If the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS and the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3448, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #8	;
{3451, 0} For the EMM cause value #3 or #6, if the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state, 5GS update status, 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the case when the service request procedure performed over 3GPP access is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3493, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #13	;
{3496, 0} The UE shall perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{3553, 0} If the service request was initiated for CS fallback and a CS fallback cancellation request was not received, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN radio access technology.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3553, 0} If the service request was initiated for CS fallback and a CS fallback cancellation request was not received, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN radio access technology.
{3553, 1} If the UE finds a suitable GERAN or UTRAN cell, it then proceeds with the appropriate MM and CC specific procedures and the EMM sublayer shall not indicate the abort of the service request procedure to the MM sublayer.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3553, 0} If the service request was initiated for CS fallback and a CS fallback cancellation request was not received, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN or UTRAN radio access technology.
{3553, 1} If the UE finds a suitable GERAN or UTRAN cell, it then proceeds with the appropriate MM and CC specific procedures and the EMM sublayer shall not indicate the abort of the service request procedure to the MM sublayer.
{3553, 2} Otherwise the EMM sublayer shall indicate the abort of the service request procedure to the MM sublayer.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3554, 0} If the service request was initiated for 1xCS fallback, the UE shall select cdma2000® 1x radio access technology.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3554, 0} If the service request was initiated for 1xCS fallback, the UE shall select cdma2000® 1x radio access technology.
{3554, 1} The UE then proceeds with appropriate cdma2000® 1x CS procedures.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3555, 0} If the service request was initiated for 1xCS fallback and the UE has dual Rx/Tx configuration and supports enhanced 1xCS fallback, the UE shall perform a new attach procedure.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3556, 0} If the service request was initiated for any reason other than CS fallback or 1x CS fallback, the UE shall perform a new attach procedure.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3557, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall handle the GMM state as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the service request procedure is rejected with the GMM cause value #10 "Implicitly detached".
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3558, 0} A UE operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation which is already IMSI attached for non-EPS services is still IMSI attached for non-EPS services in the network.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3559, 0} A UE operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation shall set the update status to U2 NOT UPDATED.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3551, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #40	;
{3560, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3561, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{3562, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3561, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{3562, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs.
{3562, 1} The UE shall start an implementation specific timer, setting its value to 2 times the value of T as defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3561, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{3562, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs.
{3562, 1} The UE shall start an implementation specific timer, setting its value to 2 times the value of T as defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{3562, 2} While this timer is running, the UE shall not consider the PLMN + RAT combination that provided this reject cause as a candidate for PLMN selection.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3561, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{3562, 0} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list, eKSI, and list of equivalent PLMNs.
{3562, 1} The UE shall start an implementation specific timer, setting its value to 2 times the value of T as defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
{3562, 2} While this timer is running, the UE shall not consider the PLMN + RAT combination that provided this reject cause as a candidate for PLMN selection.
{3562, 3} The UE then enters state EMM-DEREGISTERED.PLMN-SEARCH in order to perform a PLMN selection according to 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3561, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{3563, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition set the GMM state to GMM-DEREGISTERED, GPRS update status to GU2 NOT UPDATED, MM update status to U2 NOT UPDATED and shall delete the P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number, LAI, TMSI and ciphering key sequence number.
---

{3445, 0} The UE shall take the following actions depending on the received EMM cause value in the SERVICE REJECT message.
{3561, 0} When the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #42	;
{3564, 0} If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED, 5GS update status to 5U2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI.
---

{3565, 0} Other values are considered as abnormal cases.

{3565, 0} Other values are considered as abnormal cases.
{3565, 1} The specification of the UE behaviour in those cases is described in subclause 5.6.1.6.

{3615, 0} T3417 expired
{3617, 0} If the UE triggered the service request procedure in EMM-IDLE mode in order to obtain packet services, then the EMM sublayer shall increment the service request attempt counter, abort the procedure and release locally any resources allocated for the service request procedure.
{3617, 1} The service request counter shall not be incremented, if, the UE in NB-S1 mode is requested by the upper layer to transmit user data related to an exceptional event and the UE is allowed to use exception data reporting.
---

{3585, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{3615, 0} T3417 expired
{3623, 0} If the service request attempt counter is greater than or equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3325.
---

{3585, 0} The following abnormal cases can be identified:
{3615, 0} T3417 expired
{3623, 0} If the service request attempt counter is greater than or equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3325.
{3623, 1} Additionally if the service request was initiated for an "originating MMTEL voice" call type, a notification that the service request was not accepted and that timer T3325 is running shall be provided to the upper layers.
---

{3615, 0} T3417 expired
{3624, 0} The UE shall not attempt service request until expiry of timer T3325 unless, the service request is initiated in response to paging from the network;
---

---

{3740, 0} The paging procedure is used by the network to request the establishment or resumption of a NAS signalling connection to the UE.
---

{3740, 0} The paging procedure is used by the network to request the establishment or resumption of a NAS signalling connection to the UE.
{3740, 1} Another purpose of the paging procedure is to prompt the UE to reattach if necessary as a result of a network failure.
---

{3740, 0} The paging procedure is used by the network to request the establishment or resumption of a NAS signalling connection to the UE.
{3740, 1} Another purpose of the paging procedure is to prompt the UE to reattach if necessary as a result of a network failure.
{3740, 2} If the UE is not attached when it receives a paging for EPS services, the UE shall ignore the paging.
---

{3741, 0} Additionally, the network can use the paging procedure to initiate the mobile terminating CS fallback procedure or SMS or user data transfer via the MME.
---

{3745, 0} The network shall initiate the paging procedure for EPS services using S-TMSI with CN domain indicator set to "PS" when NAS signalling messages, cdma2000® signalling messages or user data is pending to be sent to the UE when no NAS signalling connection exists.
---

{3746, 0} For the UE using eDRX, the network initiates the paging procedure when NAS signalling messages, cdma2000® signalling messages or user data is pending to be sent to the UE within the paging time window.
---

{3746, 0} For the UE using eDRX, the network initiates the paging procedure when NAS signalling messages, cdma2000® signalling messages or user data is pending to be sent to the UE within the paging time window.
{3746, 1} If NAS signalling messages, cdma2000® signalling messages or user data is pending to be sent to the UE outside the paging time window and the eDRX value that the network provides to the UE in the Extended DRX parameters IE during the last attach procedure or the last tracking area updating procedure is not all zeros, the network initiates the paging procedure at T time ahead of the beginning of the next paging time window.
---

{3747, 0} To initiate the procedure the EMM entity in the network requests the lower layer to start paging and shall start the timer:
{3748, 0} T3415 for this paging procedure, if the network accepted to use eDRX for the UE and the UE does not have a PDN connection for emergency bearer services.
---

{3747, 0} To initiate the procedure the EMM entity in the network requests the lower layer to start paging and shall start the timer:
{3749, 0} Otherwise, T3413 for this paging procedure.
---

{3750, 0} If the network starts timer T3415, the network shall set timer T3415 to a value smaller than the value of timer T3-RESPONSE.
---

{3751, 0} The EMM entity may provide the lower layer with a list of CSG IDs, including the CSG IDs of both the expired and the not expired subscriptions.
---

{3751, 0} The EMM entity may provide the lower layer with a list of CSG IDs, including the CSG IDs of both the expired and the not expired subscriptions.
{3751, 1} If there is a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established, the EMM entity in the network shall not provide the list of CSG IDs to the lower layer.
---

{3752, 0} If the negotiated UE paging probability information is available in the EMM context of the UE, the EMM entity shall provide the lower layer with the negotiated UE paging probability information.
---

{3753, 0} Upon reception of a paging indication, if control plane CIoT EPS optimization is not used by the UE, the UE shall stop the timer T3346, if running, and shall initiate a service request procedure to respond to the paging or a tracking area updating procedure as specified in subclauses 5.5.3.2.2 and 5.5.3.3.2.
---

{3753, 0} Upon reception of a paging indication, if control plane CIoT EPS optimization is not used by the UE, the UE shall stop the timer T3346, if running, and shall initiate a service request procedure to respond to the paging or a tracking area updating procedure as specified in subclauses 5.5.3.2.2 and 5.5.3.3.2.
{3753, 1} And additionally, if the UE is in the EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, resume the suspended NAS signalling connection to the MME as specified in subclause 5.3.1.3.
---

{3754, 0} Upon reception of a paging indication, if control plane CIoT EPS optimization is used by the UE, the UE shall stop the timer T3346, if running, and shall additionally, initiate a service request procedure as specified in subclause 5.6.1.2.2 if the UE is in the EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication;
---

{3754, 0} Upon reception of a paging indication, if control plane CIoT EPS optimization is used by the UE, the UE shall stop the timer T3346, if running, and shall additionally, initiate a tracking area updating procedure as specified in subclauses 5.5.3.2.2;
---

{3754, 0} Upon reception of a paging indication, if control plane CIoT EPS optimization is used by the UE, the UE shall stop the timer T3346, if running, and shall additionally, proceed the behaviour as specified in subclause 5.3.1.3 if the UE is in the EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication.
---

{3758, 0} If the paging for EPS services was received during an ongoing UE-initiated EMM specific procedure or service request procedure, then the UE shall ignore the paging.
---

{3758, 0} If the paging for EPS services was received during an ongoing UE-initiated EMM specific procedure or service request procedure, then the UE shall ignore the paging.
{3758, 1} The network shall proceed with the EMM specific procedure or the service request procedure, and stop the timer for the paging procedure.
---

{3758, 0} If the paging for EPS services was received during an ongoing UE-initiated EMM specific procedure or service request procedure, then the UE shall ignore the paging.
{3758, 1} The network shall proceed with the EMM specific procedure or the service request procedure, and stop the timer for the paging procedure.
{3758, 2} If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message when the paging procedure is ongoing, it should be considered as an abnormal case, and the behaviour of the network for this case is specified in subclause 5.6.2.2.1.2.
---

{3759, 0} The network shall stop the timer for the paging procedure when an integrity-protected response is received from the UE and successfully integrity checked by the network or when the EMM entity in the MME receives an indication from the lower layer that it has received the S1-AP UE context resume request message as specified in 3GPP TS 36.413 [23].
---

{3759, 0} The network shall stop the timer for the paging procedure when an integrity-protected response is received from the UE and successfully integrity checked by the network or when the EMM entity in the MME receives an indication from the lower layer that it has received the S1-AP UE context resume request message as specified in 3GPP TS 36.413 [23].
{3759, 1} If the response received is not integrity protected, or the integrity check is unsuccessful, the timer for the paging procedure shall be kept running unless, the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services;
---

{3759, 0} The network shall stop the timer for the paging procedure when an integrity-protected response is received from the UE and successfully integrity checked by the network or when the EMM entity in the MME receives an indication from the lower layer that it has received the S1-AP UE context resume request message as specified in 3GPP TS 36.413 [23].
{3759, 1} If the response received is not integrity protected, or the integrity check is unsuccessful, the timer for the paging procedure shall be kept running unless, the response received is a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and the security mode control procedure or authentication procedure performed during tracking area updating procedure has completed successfully.
---

{3762, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3413, the network may reinitiate paging.
---

{3763, 0} If the network, while waiting for a response to the paging sent without paging priority, receives downlink signalling or downlink data associated with priority EPS bearers, the network shall stop the timer for the paging procedure, and then initiate the paging procedure with paging priority.
---

{3764, 0} Upon expiry of timer T3415, the network shall abort the paging procedure and shall proceed as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10].

{3766, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:

{3766, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:

{3768, 0} If an integrity-protected ATTACH REQUEST message is received from the UE and successfully integrity checked by the network, the network shall abort the paging procedure.

{3766, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{3767, 0} ATTACH REQUEST message received when paging procedure is ongoing.
{3768, 0} If an integrity-protected ATTACH REQUEST message is received from the UE and successfully integrity checked by the network, the network shall abort the paging procedure.
{3768, 1} If the ATTACH REQUEST message received is not integrity protected, or the integrity check is unsuccessful, the paging procedure shall be progressed.
{3768, 2} The paging procedure shall be aborted when the EPS authentication procedure performed during attach procedure is completed successfully.

{3776, 0} Paging for EPS services using IMSI is an abnormal procedure used for error recovery in the network.

---

{3778, 0} In S1 mode, to initiate the procedure the EMM entity in the network requests the lower layer to start paging.
---

{3778, 1} If the TAI list is not available due to a network failure, the network may perform the paging within all tracking areas served by the MME.
---

{3779, 0} When a UE receives a paging for EPS services using IMSI from the network before a UE initiated EMM specific procedure has been completed, then the UE shall abort the EMM specific procedure and proceed according to the description in this subclause.
---

{3780, 0} Upon reception of a paging for EPS services using IMSI, the UE shall stop timer T3346, if it is running, locally deactivate any EPS bearer context, if any, and locally detach from EPS.
---

{3780, 0} Upon reception of a paging for EPS services using IMSI, the UE shall stop timer T3346, if it is running, locally deactivate any EPS bearer context, if any, and locally detach from EPS.
{3780, 1} Additionally the UE shall delete the following parameters: last visited registered TAI, TAI list, GUTI and KSIASME.
---

{3780, 0} Upon reception of a paging for EPS services using IMSI, the UE shall stop timer T3346, if it is running, locally deactivate any EPS bearer context, if any, and locally detach from EPS.
{3780, 1} Additionally the UE shall delete the following parameters: last visited registered TAI, TAI list, GUTI and KSIASME.
{3780, 2} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED and change the state to EMM-DEREGISTERED.
---

{3780, 0} Upon reception of a paging for EPS services using IMSI, the UE shall stop timer T3346, if it is running, locally deactivate any EPS bearer context, if any, and locally detach from EPS.
{3780, 1} Additionally the UE shall delete the following parameters: last visited registered TAI, TAI list, GUTI and KSIASME.
{3780, 2} The UE shall set the EPS update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED and change the state to EMM-DEREGISTERED.
{3780, 3} The UE shall stop all timers T3396 that are running.
---

{3781, 0} If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status, P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI, and GPRS ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when a paging for GPRS services using IMSI is received.
---

{3782, 0} After performing the local detach, the UE shall then perform an attach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.1.2.
---

{3782, 0} After performing the local detach, the UE shall then perform an attach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.1.2.
{3782, 1} If the UE is operating in CS/PS mode 1 or CS/PS mode 2 of operation, then the UE shall perform a combined attach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.1.3.
---

{3801, 0} The network shall initiate the paging procedure when it receives an incoming mobile terminating SMS to the UE if the UE is IMSI attached for non-EPS services or for "SMS only", and no NAS signalling connection exists.
---

{3802, 0} The network shall initiate the paging procedure when it receives an incoming mobile terminating SMS to the UE if the UE is attached for EPS services with CIoT EPS optimization and the UE has requested "SMS only", the UE is in NB-S1 mode, and no NAS signalling connection exists.
---

{3803, 0} For the UE using eDRX, the network initiates the paging procedure when an incoming mobile terminating SMS is received within the paging time window.
---

{3803, 0} For the UE using eDRX, the network initiates the paging procedure when an incoming mobile terminating SMS is received within the paging time window.
{3803, 1} If an incoming mobile terminating SMS is received outside the paging time window and the eDRX value that the network provides to the UE in the Extended DRX parameters IE during the last attach procedure or the last tracking area updating procedure is not all zeros, the network initiates the paging procedure at T time ahead of the beginning of the next paging time window.
---

{3804, 0} To initiate the procedure for SMS when no NAS signalling connection exists, the EMM entity in the network requests the lower layer to start paging.
---

{3804, 0} To initiate the procedure for SMS when no NAS signalling connection exists, the EMM entity in the network requests the lower layer to start paging.
{3804, 1} The paging message shall include a CN domain indicator set to "PS".
---

{3804, 0} To initiate the procedure for SMS when no NAS signalling connection exists, the EMM entity in the network requests the lower layer to start paging.
{3804, 1} The paging message shall include a CN domain indicator set to "PS".
{3804, 2} If the paging message includes a UE Paging Identity set to the UE's S-TMSI, the paging procedure is performed according to subclause 5.6.2.2.1.
---

{3804, 0} To initiate the procedure for SMS when no NAS signalling connection exists, the EMM entity in the network requests the lower layer to start paging.
{3804, 1} The paging message shall include a CN domain indicator set to "PS".
{3804, 2} If the paging message includes a UE Paging Identity set to the UE's S-TMSI, the paging procedure is performed according to subclause 5.6.2.2.1.
{3804, 3} If the paging message includes a UE Paging Identity set to the UE's IMSI, the paging procedure is performed according to subclause 5.6.2.2.2.
---

{3804, 0} To initiate the procedure for SMS when no NAS signalling connection exists, the EMM entity in the network requests the lower layer to start paging.
{3804, 1} The paging message shall include a CN domain indicator set to "PS".
{3804, 2} If the paging message includes a UE Paging Identity set to the UE's S-TMSI, the paging procedure is performed according to subclause 5.6.2.2.1.
{3804, 3} If the paging message includes a UE Paging Identity set to the UE's IMSI, the paging procedure is performed according to subclause 5.6.2.2.2.
{3804, 4} The MME shall not start timers T3413 and T3415 for this procedure.
---

{3805, 0} If the negotiated UE paging probability information is available in the EMM context of the UE, the EMM entity shall provide the lower layer with the negotiated UE paging probability information.
---

{3808, 0} The purpose of the transport of NAS messages procedure is to carry SMS messages in an encapsulated form between the MME and the UE.
---

{3808, 0} The purpose of the transport of NAS messages procedure is to carry SMS messages in an encapsulated form between the MME and the UE.
{3808, 1} The procedure may be initiated by the UE or the network and can only be used when the UE is attached for EPS services and non-EPS services or for EPS services and "SMS only", and the UE is in EMM-CONNECTED mode.
---

{3810, 0} Upon request from the SMS entity to send an SMS message, the EMM entity in the UE initiates the procedure by sending an UPLINK NAS TRANSPORT message including the SMS message in the NAS message container IE.
---

{3812, 0} The network initiates the procedure by sending a DOWNLINK NAS TRANSPORT message.
---

{3812, 0} The network initiates the procedure by sending a DOWNLINK NAS TRANSPORT message.
{3812, 1} When receiving the DOWNLINK NAS TRANSPORT message, the EMM entity in the UE shall forward the contents of the NAS message container IE to the SMS entity.
---

{3814, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{3815, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{3816, 0} The UE shall not send an UPLINK NAS TRANSPORT message unless, the UE is a UE configured to use AC11 – 15 in selected PLMN;
---

{3814, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{3815, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{3816, 0} The UE shall not send an UPLINK NAS TRANSPORT message unless, the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established;
---

{3814, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{3815, 0} Timer T3346 is running
{3816, 0} The UE shall not send an UPLINK NAS TRANSPORT message unless, the UE is configured for dual priority and has a PDN connection established without low access priority but the timer T3346 was started in response to NAS signalling request with low access priority.
---

{3814, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{3820, 0} The UPLINK NAS TRANSPORT message can be sent, if still necessary, when timer T3346 expires or is stopped.
---

{3814, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{3821, 0} Timer T3447 is running
{3822, 0} The UE shall not send an UPLINK NAS TRANSPORT message when the UE is in EMM-CONNECTED mode after the UE attached without PDN connection, unless, the UE is a UE configured to use AC11 – 15 in the selected PLMN;
---

{3814, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{3821, 0} Timer T3447 is running
{3822, 0} The UE shall not send an UPLINK NAS TRANSPORT message when the UE is in EMM-CONNECTED mode after the UE attached without PDN connection, unless, a network initiated signaling message has been received.
---

{3814, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{3821, 0} Timer T3447 is running
{3825, 0} The UPLINK NAS TRANSPORT message can be sent, if still necessary, when timer T3447 expires.
---

{3827, 0} The following abnormal case can be identified:
{3828, 0} Lower layer indication of non-delivered NAS PDU
{3829, 0} If the DOWNLINK NAS TRANSPORT message is not delivered for any reason, the MME may discard the message.
---

{3832, 0} The purpose of the generic transport of NAS messages procedure is to carry protocol messages from various applications in an encapsulated form between the MME and the UE.
---

{3832, 0} The purpose of the generic transport of NAS messages procedure is to carry protocol messages from various applications in an encapsulated form between the MME and the UE.
{3832, 1} The procedure may be initiated by the UE or the network and can only be used when the UE is attached for EPS services and is in EMM-CONNECTED mode.
---

{3834, 0} Upon request from an application to send a message encapsulated in the generic transport of NAS message, the EMM entity in the UE initiates the procedure by sending an UPLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message including the corresponding message in the generic message container IE.
---

{3834, 0} Upon request from an application to send a message encapsulated in the generic transport of NAS message, the EMM entity in the UE initiates the procedure by sending an UPLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message including the corresponding message in the generic message container IE.
{3834, 1} The application may also request additional information to be included in the UPLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message in the Additional information IE.
---

{3834, 0} Upon request from an application to send a message encapsulated in the generic transport of NAS message, the EMM entity in the UE initiates the procedure by sending an UPLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message including the corresponding message in the generic message container IE.
{3834, 1} The application may also request additional information to be included in the UPLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message in the Additional information IE.
{3834, 2} The content, coding and interpretation of this information element are dependent on the particular application.
---

{3835, 0} The UE shall indicate the application protocol using the generic transport in the corresponding generic message container type.
---

{3835, 0} The UE shall indicate the application protocol using the generic transport in the corresponding generic message container type.
{3835, 1} When receiving the UPLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message, the EMM entity in the MME shall provide the contents of the generic message container IE and the generic message container type IE to the corresponding application.
---

{3835, 0} The UE shall indicate the application protocol using the generic transport in the corresponding generic message container type.
{3835, 1} When receiving the UPLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message, the EMM entity in the MME shall provide the contents of the generic message container IE and the generic message container type IE to the corresponding application.
{3835, 2} If included, the EMM entity in the MME shall also provide the contents of the Additional information IE.
---

{3837, 0} Upon request from an application to send a message encapsulated in the generic transport of NAS message, the EMM entity in the MME initiates the procedure by sending a DOWNLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message including the corresponding message in the generic message container IE.
---

{3837, 0} Upon request from an application to send a message encapsulated in the generic transport of NAS message, the EMM entity in the MME initiates the procedure by sending a DOWNLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message including the corresponding message in the generic message container IE.
{3837, 1} The application may also request additional information to be included in the DOWNLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message in the Additional information IE.
---

{3837, 0} Upon request from an application to send a message encapsulated in the generic transport of NAS message, the EMM entity in the MME initiates the procedure by sending a DOWNLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message including the corresponding message in the generic message container IE.
{3837, 1} The application may also request additional information to be included in the DOWNLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message in the Additional information IE.
{3837, 2} The content, coding and interpretation of this information element are dependent on the particular application.
---

---

{3838, 1} When receiving the DOWNLINK GENERIC NAS TRANSPORT message, the EMM entity in the UE shall provide the contents of the generic message container IE and the generic message container type IE to the corresponding application.
---
