{3858, 0} The purpose of the sending of the EMM STATUS message is to report at any time certain error conditions detected upon receipt of EMM protocol data.
---

{3858, 0} The purpose of the sending of the EMM STATUS message is to report at any time certain error conditions detected upon receipt of EMM protocol data.
{3858, 1} The EMM STATUS message can be sent by both the MME and the UE.
---

{3859, 0} On receipt of an EMM STATUS message no state transition and no specific action shall be taken as seen from the radio interface, i.e. local actions are possible.
---

{3859, 0} On receipt of an EMM STATUS message no state transition and no specific action shall be taken as seen from the radio interface, i.e. local actions are possible.
{3859, 1} The local actions to be taken by the MME or the UE on receipt of an EMM STATUS message are implementation dependent.
---

{5052, 0} The procedures specified in the present document apply to those messages which pass the checks described in this subclause.
---

{5053, 0} This subclause also specifies procedures for the handling of unknown, unforeseen, and erroneous protocol data by the receiving entity.
---

{5053, 0} This subclause also specifies procedures for the handling of unknown, unforeseen, and erroneous protocol data by the receiving entity.
{5053, 1} These procedures are called "error handling procedures", but in addition to providing recovery mechanisms for error situations they define a compatibility mechanism for future extensions of the protocols.
---

{5054, 0} Subclauses 7.1 to 7.8 shall be applied in order of precedence.
---

{5055, 0} Most error handling procedures are mandatory for the UE.
---

{5056, 0} Detailed error handling procedures in the network are implementation dependent and may vary from PLMN to PLMN.
---

{5056, 0} Detailed error handling procedures in the network are implementation dependent and may vary from PLMN to PLMN.
{5056, 1} However, when extensions of this protocol are developed, networks will be assumed to have the error handling that is indicated in this subclause as mandatory and that is indicated as strongly recommended.
---

{5057, 0} Also, the error handling of the network is only considered as mandatory or strongly recommended when certain thresholds for errors are not reached during a dedicated connection.
---

{5058, 0} For definition of semantical and syntactical errors see 3GPP TS 24.007 [12], subclause 11.4.2.
---

{5060, 0} When a message is received that is too short to contain a complete message type information element, that message shall be ignored, cf.
---

{5060, 0} When a message is received that is too short to contain a complete message type information element, that message shall be ignored, cf.
{5060, 1} 3GPP TS 24.007 [12].
---

{5063, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5064, 0} If the network receives a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message with an unassigned or reserved PTI value, the network shall respond with a PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
---

{5063, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5065, 0} If the network receives a PDN DISCONNECT REQUEST message with an unassigned or reserved PTI value, the network shall respond with a PDN DISCONNECT REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
---

{5063, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5066, 0} If the network receives a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REQUEST message with an unassigned or reserved PTI value, the network shall respond with a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
---

{5063, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5067, 0} If the network receives a BEARER RESOURCE MODIFICATION REQUEST message with an unassigned or reserved PTI value, the network shall respond with a BEARER RESOURCE MODIFICATION REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
---

{5063, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5068, 0} If the network receives an ESM INFORMATION RESPONSE message which includes an unassigned or reserved PTI value, the network shall ignore the message.
---

{5063, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5068, 0} If the network receives an ESM INFORMATION RESPONSE message which includes an unassigned or reserved PTI value, the network shall ignore the message.
{5068, 1} If the PTI is an assigned value that does not match the PTI in use for any ongoing transaction related procedure, the network shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
---

{5063, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5069, 0} If the network receives an ESM message other than those listed in items a through e above with a reserved PTI value, the network shall ignore the message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5071, 0} If the UE receives a PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value, or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5072, 0} If the UE receives a PDN DISCONNECT REJECT message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value, or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5073, 0} If the UE receives a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REJECT message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value, or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5074, 0} If the UE receives a BEARER RESOURCE MODIFICATION REJECT message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value, or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5075, 0} If the UE receives an ESM INFORMATION REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5075, 0} If the UE receives an ESM INFORMATION REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value, the UE shall ignore the message.
{5075, 1} If the PTI is an assigned value that does not match a PTI in use for a pending UE requested PDN connectivity procedure for which the ESM information transfer flag was set in the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #47 "PTI mismatch".
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5076, 0} If the UE receives a NOTIFICATION message in which the PTI value is an unassigned value, the UE shall proceed as specified in subclause 7.3.2.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5076, 0} If the UE receives a NOTIFICATION message in which the PTI value is an unassigned value, the UE shall proceed as specified in subclause 7.3.2.
{5076, 1} If the PTI is a reserved value, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5076, 0} If the UE receives a NOTIFICATION message in which the PTI value is an unassigned value, the UE shall proceed as specified in subclause 7.3.2.
{5076, 1} If the PTI is a reserved value, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
{5076, 2} If the PTI is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #47 "PTI mismatch".
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5077, 0} If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5077, 0} If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message.
{5077, 1} Otherwise, the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #47 "PTI mismatch".
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5078, 0} If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which contains a reserved or unassigned PTI value, the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5079, 0} If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5079, 0} If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message.
{5079, 1} Otherwise, the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #47 "PTI mismatch".
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5080, 0} If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which contains a reserved PTI value, the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5081, 0} If the UE receives a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request the UE shall respond with a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5081, 0} If the UE receives a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request the UE shall respond with a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message.
{5081, 1} Otherwise, the UE shall respond with a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #47 "PTI mismatch".
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5082, 0} If the UE receives a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which contains a reserved PTI value, the UE shall respond with a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5083, 0} If the UE receives a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is a reserved value or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5070, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen PTI received in an ESM message:
{5084, 0} If the UE receives an ESM message other than those listed in items a through m with a reserved PTI value or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5086, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5087, 0} If the network receives a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the network shall respond with a PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5086, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5088, 0} If the network receives a PDN DISCONNECT REQUEST message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the network shall respond with a PDN DISCONNECT REJECT message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5086, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5089, 0} If the network receives a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REQUEST message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the network shall respond with a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REJECT message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5086, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5090, 0} If the network receives a BEARER RESOURCE MODIFICATION REQUEST message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the network shall respond with a BEARER RESOURCE MODIFICATION REJECT message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5086, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5091, 0} If the network receives an ESM INFORMATION RESPONSE message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the network shall ignore the message.
---

{5086, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5092, 0} If the network receives an ESM DATA TRANSPORT message which includes a reserved EPS bearer identity value or an assigned value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context, the network shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5086, 0} The following network procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5093, 0} If the network receives an ESM message other than those listed in items a through e above in which the message includes a reserved EPS bearer identity value or an assigned value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context, the network shall ignore the message.
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5095, 0} If the UE receives a PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5096, 0} If the UE receives a PDN DISCONNECT REJECT message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5097, 0} If the UE receives a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REJECT message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5098, 0} If the UE receives a BEARER RESOURCE MODIFICATION REJECT message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5099, 0} If the UE receives an ESM INFORMATION REQUEST message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5100, 0} If the UE receives a NOTIFICATION message which includes a reserved EPS bearer identity value, an assigned EPS bearer identity value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context, or the combination of an unassigned PTI value and an unassigned EPS bearer identity value, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5101, 0} If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which includes an unassigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5102, 0} If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which includes an unassigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5103, 0} If the UE receives a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which includes an unassigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value or an assigned EPS bearer identity value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context, the UE shall respond with a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5104, 0} If the UE receives a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which includes an unassigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value or an assigned EPS bearer identity value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context, the UE shall respond with a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message with the EPS bearer identity set to the received EPS bearer identity.
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5105, 0} If the UE receives an ESM DATA TRANSPORT message which includes a reserved EPS bearer identity value or an assigned value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
---

{5094, 0} The following UE procedures shall apply for handling an unknown, erroneous, or unforeseen EPS bearer identity received in the header of an ESM message:
{5106, 0} If the UE receives an ESM message other than those listed in items a through j in which the message includes an unassigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value or a value that does not match an EPS bearer context of an established PDN connection, the UE shall ignore the message.
---

{5108, 0} If UE receives an EMM message or ESM message with message type not defined for the protocol discriminator or not implemented by the receiver, it shall return a status message with cause #97 "message type non-existent or not implemented".
---

{5109, 0} If the network receives an EMM or ESM message with message type not defined for the PD or not implemented by the receiver in a protocol state where reception of an unsolicited message with the given PD from the UE is not foreseen in the protocol, the network actions are implementation dependent.
---

{5109, 0} If the network receives an EMM or ESM message with message type not defined for the PD or not implemented by the receiver in a protocol state where reception of an unsolicited message with the given PD from the UE is not foreseen in the protocol, the network actions are implementation dependent.
{5109, 1} Otherwise, if the network receives a message with message type not defined for the PD or not implemented by the receiver, it shall ignore the message except that it should return a status message with cause #97 "message type non-existent or not implemented".
---

{5110, 0} If the UE receives a message not compatible with the protocol state, the UE shall return a status message with cause #98 "message type not compatible with protocol state".
---

{5111, 0} If the network receives a message not compatible with the protocol state, the network actions are implementation dependent.
---

{5114, 0} When an “imperative message part” error or a “missing mandatory IE” error is diagnosed on receipt of a message, or when a message containing a syntactically incorrect mandatory IE, an IE unknown in the message but encoded as “comprehension required”, or an out of sequence IE encoded as "comprehension required", the UE and the network shall proceed as follows:
{5115, 0} If the message is not one of the messages listed in subclause 7.5.3, item a, b, c, or d, the UE shall return a status message with cause #96 "invalid mandatory information";

{5116, 0} If the message is not one of the messages listed in subclause 7.5.3, item e, f, g or h, the network shall either, try to treat the message;
---

{5114, 0} When an “imperative message part” error or a “missing mandatory IE” error is diagnosed on receipt of a message, or when a message containing a syntactically incorrect mandatory IE, an IE unknown in the message but encoded as “comprehension required”, or an out of sequence IE encoded as "comprehension required", the UE and the network shall proceed as follows:
{5116, 0} If the message is not one of the messages listed in subclause 7.5.3, item e, f, g or h, the network shall either, ignore the message except that it should return a status message with cause #96 "invalid mandatory information".
---

{5120, 0} No exceptional cases are described for mobility management messages.

{5135, 0} The UE shall ignore all IEs unknown in a message which are not encoded as "comprehension required".
---

{5136, 0} The network shall take the same approach.
---

{5138, 0} The UE shall ignore all out of sequence IEs in a message which are not encoded as "comprehension required".
---

{5139, 0} The network should take the same approach.
---

{5141, 0} If an information element with format T, TV, TLV, or TLV-E is repeated in a message in which repetition of the information element is not specified in clause 8 of the present document, the UE shall handle only the contents of the information element appearing first and shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element.
---

{5141, 0} If an information element with format T, TV, TLV, or TLV-E is repeated in a message in which repetition of the information element is not specified in clause 8 of the present document, the UE shall handle only the contents of the information element appearing first and shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element.
{5141, 1} When repetition of information elements is specified, the UE shall handle only the contents of specified repeated information elements.
---

{5141, 0} If an information element with format T, TV, TLV, or TLV-E is repeated in a message in which repetition of the information element is not specified in clause 8 of the present document, the UE shall handle only the contents of the information element appearing first and shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element.
{5141, 1} When repetition of information elements is specified, the UE shall handle only the contents of specified repeated information elements.
{5141, 2} If the limit on repetition of information elements is exceeded, the UE shall handle the contents of information elements appearing first up to the limit of repetitions and shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element.
---

{5142, 0} The network should follow the same procedures.
---

{5144, 0} This category includes, syntactically incorrect optional IEs;
---

{5144, 0} This category includes, conditional IE errors.
---

{5148, 0} The UE shall treat all optional IEs that are syntactically incorrect in a message as not present in the message.
---

{5149, 0} The network shall take the same approach.
---

{5151, 0} When upon receipt of a EMM or ESM message the UE diagnoses a "missing conditional IE" error or an "unexpected conditional IE" error, or when it receives a EMM or ESM message containing at least one syntactically incorrect conditional IE, the UE shall ignore the message and shall return a status message with cause #100 "conditional IE error".
---

{5152, 0} When the network receives a message and diagnoses a "missing conditional IE" error or an "unexpected conditional IE" error or when it receives a message containing at least one syntactically incorrect conditional IE, the network shall either, try to treat the message;
---

{5152, 0} When the network receives a message and diagnoses a "missing conditional IE" error or an "unexpected conditional IE" error or when it receives a message containing at least one syntactically incorrect conditional IE, the network shall either, ignore the message except that it should return a status message with cause #100 "conditional IE error".
---

{5156, 0} When a message with semantically incorrect contents is received, the UE shall perform the foreseen reactions of the procedural part of the present document.
---

{5156, 0} When a message with semantically incorrect contents is received, the UE shall perform the foreseen reactions of the procedural part of the present document.
{5156, 1} If however no such reactions are specified, the UE shall ignore the message except that it shall return a status message with cause #95 "semantically incorrect message".
---

{5157, 0} The network should follow the same procedure except that a status message is not normally transmitted.
---

{5166, 0} Global significance, i.e. relevant in the originating and terminating access and in the network.

{5203, 0} The network may include this IE to inform the UE of the support of certain features.
---

{5203, 0} The network may include this IE to inform the UE of the support of certain features.
{5203, 1} If this IE is not included then the UE shall interpret this as a receipt of an information element with all bits of the value part coded as zero, except for the S1-u data transfer.
---

{5205, 0} The network may include this IE to provide the UE with additional information about the result of, a combined attach procedure if the procedure was successful for EPS services and non-EPS services, or for EPS services and "SMS only";
---

{5205, 0} The network may include this IE to provide the UE with additional information about the result of, an attach procedure requested for CIoT EPS optimizations if the procedure was successful for EPS services and "SMS only".
---

{5209, 0} The network may include this IE to provide the UE with longer periodic tracking area update timer.
---

{5211, 0} The network shall include the T3324 value IE if, the UE included the T3324 value IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message;
---

{5211, 0} The network shall include the T3324 value IE if, the network supports PSM and accepts the use of PSM.
---

{5215, 0} The network shall include the Extended DRX parameters IE if, the UE included the Extended DRX parameters IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message;
---

{5215, 0} The network shall include the Extended DRX parameters IE if, the network supports eDRX and accepts the use of eDRX.
---

{5219, 0} This IE is included in the message when the network wishes to provide a DCN-ID to the UE.
---

{5221, 0} This IE may be included when a normal attach procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" was successful for EPS services only.
---

{5223, 0} This IE is included if the network needs to indicate whether emergency numbers provided via non-3GPP access can be used to initiate UE detected emergency calls.
---

{5223, 0} This IE is included if the network needs to indicate whether emergency numbers provided via non-3GPP access can be used to initiate UE detected emergency calls.
{5223, 1} If this IE is not included then the UE shall interpret this as a receipt of an information element with all bits of the value part coded as zero.
---

{5225, 0} The network may include this IE if the congestion control for transport of user data via the control plane is active and the UE supports timer T3448.
---

{5227, 0} This IE is included if the network needs to indicate network policy information to the UE, If this IE is not included then the UE shall interpret this as a receipt of an information element with all bits of the value part coded as zero.
---

{5229, 0} The network may include T3447 value IE if, the UE has indicated support for service gap control in the ATTACH REQUEST message;
---

{5229, 0} The network may include T3447 value IE if, the EMM context contains a service gap time value.
---

{5233, 0} This IE is included if the network needs to send ciphering key data to the UE for ciphered broadcast assistance data.
---

{6138, 0} When a field extends over more than one octet, the order of bit values progressively decreases as the octet number increases.
---

{6138, 1} The most significant bit of the field is represented by the highest numbered bit of the lowest numbered octet of the field.
---

{6138, 1} The most significant bit of the field is represented by the highest numbered bit of the lowest numbered octet of the field.
{6138, 2} The least significant bit of the field is represented by the lowest numbered bit of the highest numbered octet of the field.

{6535, 0} If Address type indicates IPv4, the Address information in octet 4 to octet 7 contains the IPv4 address.
---

{6535, 0} If Address type indicates IPv4, the Address information in octet 4 to octet 7 contains the IPv4 address.
{6535, 1} Bit 8 of octet 4 represents the most significant bit of the IP address and bit 1 of octet 7 the least significant bit.
---

{6536, 0} If Address type indicates IPv6, the Address information in octet 4 to octet 19 contains the IPv6 address.
---

{6536, 0} If Address type indicates IPv6, the Address information in octet 4 to octet 19 contains the IPv6 address.
{6536, 1} Bit 8 of octet 4 represents the most significant bit of the IP address and bit 1 of octet 19 the least significant bit.
---

{6538, 0} The purpose of the Header compression configuration information element is to negotiate ROHC channel setup parameters specified in IETF RFC 5795 [37] and, optionally, provide additional header compression context setup parameters.
---

{6539, 0} The Header compression configuration information element is coded as shown in figure 9.9.4.22.1 and table 9.9.4.22.1.
---

{6540, 0} The Header compression configuration is a type 4 information element with a minimum length of 5 octets and a maximum length of 257 octets.
---

{6541, 0} The optional Additional header compression parameters container field conveys the additional header compression context setup parameters as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10] in a generic container.
---

{6541, 0} The optional Additional header compression parameters container field conveys the additional header compression context setup parameters as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10] in a generic container.
{6541, 1} This field corresponds to the profile-specific information in the header of the ROHC IR packet type in IETF RFC 5795 [37].
---

{6543, 0} The purpose of the Control plane only indication information element is to indicate that a PDN connection is only for control plane CIoT EPS optimization, e.g. the PDN connection is with an SCEF.
---

{6544, 0} The Control plane only indication information element is coded as shown in figure 9.9.4.23.1.
---

{6545, 0} The Control plane only indication is a type 1 information element.
---

{6547, 0} This information element is used to encapsulate the user data transferred between the UE and the MME.
---

{6547, 0} This information element is used to encapsulate the user data transferred between the UE and the MME.
{6547, 1} The User data container information element is coded as shown in figure 9.9.4.24.1 and table 9.9.4.24.1.
---

{6548, 0} The User data container is a type 6 information element.
---

{6550, 0} The purpose of the Release assistance indication IE is to inform the network whether no further uplink and no further downlink data transmission is expected;
---

{6550, 0} The purpose of the Release assistance indication IE is to inform the network whether only a single downlink data transmission and no further uplink data transmission subsequent to the uplink data transmission is expected.
---

{6553, 0} The Release assistance indication information element is coded as shown in figure 9.9.4.25.1 and table 9.9.4.25.1.
---

{6554, 0} The Release assistance indication is a type 1 information element.
---

{6556, 0} See subclause 10.5.6.3A in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13].
---

{6558, 0} The purpose of the Header compression configuration status information element is to indicate the status of the Header compression configuration for each EPS bearer using Control plane CIoT EPS optimisation that can be identified by an EPS bearer identity.
---

{6559, 0} The Header compression confguration status information element is a type 4 information element with 4 the length of 4 octets.
---

{6561, 0} The purpose of the Serving PLMN rate control information element is to indicate the maximum number of uplink ESM DATA TRANSPORT messages including User data container IEs the UE is allowed to send via a PDN connection per 6 minute interval.
---

{6562, 0} The Serving PLMN rate control information element is coded as shown in figure 9.9.4.28.1.
---

{6563, 0} The Serving PLMN rate control is a type 4 information element with 4 octets length.
---

{6564, 0} Serving PLMN rate control value is a binary encoded integer indicating the maximum number of uplink ESM DATA TRANSPORT messages including User data container IEs the UE is allowed to send per 6 minute interval.
---

{6564, 0} Serving PLMN rate control value is a binary encoded integer indicating the maximum number of uplink ESM DATA TRANSPORT messages including User data container IEs the UE is allowed to send per 6 minute interval.
{6564, 1} The Serving PLMN rate control value is an integer equal to or higher than 10.
---

{6564, 0} Serving PLMN rate control value is a binary encoded integer indicating the maximum number of uplink ESM DATA TRANSPORT messages including User data container IEs the UE is allowed to send per 6 minute interval.
{6564, 1} The Serving PLMN rate control value is an integer equal to or higher than 10.
{6564, 2} The Serving PLMN rate control value FFFFH indicates that the maximum number of uplink ESM DATA TRANSPORT messages including User data container IEs the UE is allowed to send per 6 minute interval is not restricted.
---

{6566, 0} The purpose of the extended APN aggregate maximum bit rate information element is to indicate the initial subscribed APN-AMBR with a value higher than 65280 Mbps when the UE establishes a PDN connection or to indicate the new APN-AMBR with a value higher than 65280 Mbps if it is changed by the network.
---

{6567, 0} The receiving entityshall ignore the bit rate values which are included in the extended APN aggregate maximum bit rate information element and not higher than 65280 Mbps.
---

{6568, 0} The extended APN aggregate maximum bit rate information element is coded as shown in figure 9.9.4.29.1 and table 9.9.4.29.1.
---

{6569, 0} The extended APN aggregate maximum bit rate is a type 4 information element with a length of 8 octets.
---

{6571, 0} The purpose of the Extended quality of service information element is to indicate for an EPS bearer context the maximum bit rates for uplink and downlink and the guaranteed bit rates for uplink and downlink, if at least one of the bit rates has a value higher than 10 Gbps.
---

{6572, 0} The Extended quality of service information element is coded as shown in figure 9.9.4.30.1 and table 9.9.4.30.1.
---

{6572, 0} The Extended quality of service information element is coded as shown in figure 9.9.4.30.1 and table 9.9.4.30.1.
{6572, 1} For uplink and downlink, if the sending entity only has to indicate one bit rate, it shall encode the other bit rate as "00000000".
---

{6572, 0} The Extended quality of service information element is coded as shown in figure 9.9.4.30.1 and table 9.9.4.30.1.
{6572, 1} For uplink and downlink, if the sending entity only has to indicate one bit rate, it shall encode the other bit rate as "00000000".
{6572, 2} The receiving entity shall ignore a bit rate which is included in the extended quality of service information element and has a value smaller or equal to 10 Gbps.
---

{6573, 0} The Extended quality of service is a type 4 information element with a length of 12 octets.
---

{6576, 0} The description of timers in the following tables should be considered a brief summary.
---

{6581, 0} Cause #2 – IMSI unknown in HSS
{6582, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if the UE is not known in the HSS or if the UE has packet only subscription.
---

{6581, 0} Cause #2 – IMSI unknown in HSS
{6582, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if the UE is not known in the HSS or if the UE has packet only subscription.
{6582, 1} This EMM cause does not affect operation of the EPS service, although is may be used by an EMM procedure.
---

{6583, 0} Cause #3 – Illegal UE
{6584, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE when the network refuses service to the UE either because an identity of the UE is not acceptable to the network or because the UE does not pass the authentication check, i.e. the RES received from the UE is different from that generated by the network.
---

{6585, 0} Cause #6 – Illegal ME
{6586, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if the ME used is not acceptable to the network, e.g. blacklisted.
---

{6587, 0} Cause #9 – UE identity cannot be derived by the network.
---

{6587, 0} Cause #9 – UE identity cannot be derived by the network.
{6588, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE when the network cannot derive the UE's identity from the GUTI/S-TMSI/P-TMSI and RAI e.g. no matching identity/context in the network or failure to validate the UE's identity due to integrity check failure of the received message.
---

{6589, 0} Cause #10 – Implicitly detached
{6590, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE either if the network has implicitly detached the UE, e.g. after the implicit detach timer has expired, or if the EMM context data related to the subscription does not exist in the MME e.g. because of a MME restart, or because of a periodic tracking area update request routed to a new MME.
---

{6592, 0} Cause #5 – IMEI not accepted
{6593, 0} This cause is sent to the UE if the network does not accept an attach procedure for emergency bearer services using an IMEI.
---

{6594, 0} Cause #7 – EPS services not allowed
{6595, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE when it is not allowed to operate EPS services.
---

{6596, 0} Cause #8 – EPS services and non-EPS services not allowed
{6597, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE when it is not allowed to operate either EPS or non-EPS services.
---

{6598, 0} Cause #11 – PLMN not allowed
{6599, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if it requests service, or if the network initiates a detach request, in a PLMN where the UE, by subscription or due to operator determined barring, is not allowed to operate.
---

{6600, 0} Cause #12 – Tracking area not allowed
{6601, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if it requests service, or if the network initiates a detach request, in a tracking area where the HPLMN determines that the UE, by subscription, is not allowed to operate.
---

{6602, 0} Cause #13 – Roaming not allowed in this tracking area
{6603, 0} This EMM cause is sent to an UE which requests service, or if the network initiates a detach request, in a tracking area of a PLMN which by subscription offers roaming to that UE but not in that tracking area.
---

{6604, 0} Cause #14 – EPS services not allowed in this PLMN
{6605, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE which requests service, or if the network initiates a detach request, in a PLMN which does not offer roaming for EPS services to that UE.
---

{6606, 0} Cause #15 – No suitable cells in tracking area
{6607, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if it requests service, or if the network initiates a detach request, in a tracking area where the UE, by subscription, is not allowed to operate, but when it should find another allowed tracking area or location area in the same PLMN or an equivalent PLMN.
---

{6608, 0} Cause #25 – Not authorized for this CSG
{6609, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if it requests access, or if the network initiates a detach request, in a CSG cell with CSG ID where the UE either has no subscription to operate or the UE's subscription has expired and it should find another cell in the same PLMN or an equivalent PLMN.
---

{6610, 0} Cause #35 – Requested service option not authorized in this PLMN
{6611, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if it requests in a PLMN a service option for which it is not authorized, e.g. if it attempts to attach for relay node operation in a PLMN with a USIM which does not belong to a relay node-specific subscription.
---

{6612, 0} Cause #40 – No EPS bearer context activated
{6613, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE, if during a tracking area updating procedure or a service request, the MME detects that there is no active EPS bearer context in the network.
---

{6614, 0} Cause #31 – Redirection to 5GCN required
{6615, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if it requests service in a PLMN where the UE by operator policy, is not allowed in EPC and redirection to 5GCN is required.
---

{6617, 0} Cause #16 – MSC temporarily not reachable
{6618, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if it requests a combined EPS attach or tracking area updating in a PLMN where the MSC is temporarily not reachable via the EPS part of the network.
---

{6619, 0} Cause #17 – Network failure
{6620, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if the MME cannot service an UE generated request because of PLMN failures.
---

{6621, 0} Cause #18 – CS domain not available
{6622, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE if the MME cannot service an UE generated request because CS domain is not available and SMS in MME is not supported.
---

{6623, 0} Cause #19 – ESM failure
{6624, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE when there is a failure in the ESM message contained in the EMM message.
---

{6625, 0} Cause #20 – MAC failure
{6626, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the network if the USIM detects that the MAC in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message is not fresh.
---

{6627, 0} Cause #21 – Synch failure
{6628, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the network if the USIM detects that the SQN in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message is out of range.
---

{6629, 0} Cause #22 – Congestion
{6630, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE because of congestion in the network.
---

{6631, 0} Cause #23 – UE security capabilities mismatch
{6632, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the network if the UE detects that the UE security capability does not match the one sent back by the network.
---

{6633, 0} Cause #24 – Security mode rejected, unspecified
{6634, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the network if the security mode command is rejected by the UE if the UE detects that the nonceUE does not match the one sent back by the network or for unspecified reasons.
---

{6635, 0} Cause #26 – Non-EPS authentication unacceptable
{6636, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the network in S1 mode if the "separation bit" in the AMF field of AUTN is set to 0 in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
---

{6637, 0} Cause #39 – CS service temporarily not available
{6638, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE when the CS fallback or 1xCS fallback request cannot be served temporarily due to O&M reasons or a mobile terminating CS fallback call is aborted by the network during call establishment.
---

{6639, 0} Cause #42 – Severe network failure
{6640, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE when the network has determined that the requested procedure cannot be completed successfully due to network failure.
---

{6639, 0} Cause #42 – Severe network failure
{6640, 0} This EMM cause is sent to the UE when the network has determined that the requested procedure cannot be completed successfully due to network failure.
{6640, 1} The failure is not expected to be temporary and repeated request is not likely to succeed in near future.
---

---

{6664, 0} This ESM cause is used by the UE or by the network to indicate that the requested service cannot be provided due to insufficient resources.
---

{6665, 0} Cause #27 – Missing or unknown APN
{6666, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the external packet data network because the access point name was not included although required or if the access point name could not be resolved.
---

{6668, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the external packet data network because the PDN type could not be recognised.
---

{6670, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the external packet data network due to a failed user authentication or revoked by the external packet data network.
---

{6672, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service or operation or the request for a resource was rejected by the Serving GW or PDN GW.
---

{6674, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network or by the UE to indicate that the requested service or operation or the request for a resource was rejected due to unspecified reasons.
---

{6676, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network when the UE requests a service which is not supported by the PLMN.
---

{6678, 0} This ESM cause is sent when the UE requests a service option for which it has no subscription.
---

{6679, 0} Cause #34 – Service option temporarily out of order
{6680, 0} This ESM cause is sent when the network cannot service the request because of temporary outage of one or more functions required for supporting the service.
---

{6681, 0} Cause #35 – PTI already in use
{6682, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network to indicate that the PTI included by the UE is already in use by another active UE requested procedure for this UE.
---

{6684, 0} This ESM cause is used to indicate a regular UE or network initiated release of EPS bearer resources.
---

{6686, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network if the new EPS QoS cannot be accepted that was indicated in the UE request.
---

{6688, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected due to an error situation in the network.
---

{6690, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network to request a PDN connection reactivation.

---

{6702, 0} This ESM cause is used by the UE to indicate that the PTI value which is included in the ESM message that the UE receives does not match a PTI in use.

{6703, 0} Cause #49 – Last PDN disconnection not allowed

---

---

---

---

{6727, 0} Cause #61 – PDN type Ethernet only allowed

---

{6729, 0} Cause #65 – Maximum number of EPS bearers reached
{6730, 0} This ESM cause is used by the network to indicate that the procedure requested by the UE was rejected as the network has reached the maximum number of simultaneously active EPS bearer contexts for the UE.

---

{6741, 0} This ESM cause is used to report receipt of a message with semantically incorrect contents.
---

{6742, 0} Cause #96 – Invalid mandatory information
{6743, 0} This ESM cause indicates that the equipment sending this ESM cause has received a message with a non-semantical mandatory IE error.
---

{6744, 0} Cause #97 – Message type non-existent or not implemented
{6745, 0} This ESM cause indicates that the equipment sending this ESM cause has received a message with a message type it does not recognize either because this is a message not defined, or defined but not implemented by the equipment sending this ESM cause.
---

{6746, 0} Cause #98 – Message type not compatible with protocol state
{6747, 0} This ESM cause indicates that the equipment sending this ESM cause has received a message not compatible with the protocol state.
---

{6748, 0} Cause #99 – Information element non-existent or not implemented
{6749, 0} This ESM cause indicates that the equipment sending this ESM cause has received a message which includes information elements not recognized because the information element identifier is not defined or it is defined but not implemented by the equipment sending the ESM cause.
---

{6748, 0} Cause #99 – Information element non-existent or not implemented
{6749, 0} This ESM cause indicates that the equipment sending this ESM cause has received a message which includes information elements not recognized because the information element identifier is not defined or it is defined but not implemented by the equipment sending the ESM cause.
{6749, 1} However, the information element is not required to be present in the message in order for the equipment sending the ESM cause to process the message.
---

{6750, 0} Cause #100 – Conditional IE error
{6751, 0} This ESM cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with conditional IE errors.
---

{6752, 0} Cause #101 – Message not compatible with protocol state
{6753, 0} This ESM cause indicates that a message has been received which is incompatible with the protocol state.
---

{6754, 0} Cause #111 – Protocol error, unspecified
{6755, 0} This ESM cause is used to report a protocol error event only when no other ESM cause in the protocol error class applies.
---

{6763, 0} EPS security context parameters from a full native EPS security context.
---

{6757, 0} The following EMM parameters shall be stored on the USIM if the corresponding file is present:
{6764, 0} The presence and format of corresponding files on the USIM is specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17].
---

{6765, 0} If the corresponding file is not present on the USIM, these EMM parameters except allowed CSG list are stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME together with the IMSI from the USIM.
---

{6765, 0} If the corresponding file is not present on the USIM, these EMM parameters except allowed CSG list are stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME together with the IMSI from the USIM.
{6765, 1} The allowed CSG list is stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME if the UE supports CSG selection.
---

{6765, 0} If the corresponding file is not present on the USIM, these EMM parameters except allowed CSG list are stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME together with the IMSI from the USIM.
{6765, 1} The allowed CSG list is stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME if the UE supports CSG selection.
{6765, 2} These EMM parameters can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory; else the UE shall delete the EMM parameters.
---

{6766, 0} The following EMM parameters shall be stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME together with the IMSI from the USIM:
{6767, 0} TIN;
---

{6766, 0} The following EMM parameters shall be stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME together with the IMSI from the USIM:
{6768, 0} DCN-ID list;
---

{6766, 0} The following EMM parameters shall be stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME together with the IMSI from the USIM:
{6769, 0} network-assigned UE radio capability IDs.
---

{6770, 0} The TIN parameter can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME; else the UE shall delete the TIN parameter.
---

{6771, 0} The DCN-ID list consists of DCN-IDs stored together with a PLMN identity.
---

{6771, 0} The DCN-ID list consists of DCN-IDs stored together with a PLMN identity.
{6771, 1} The list can have zero or more entries and the maximum length shall be at least 32 entries.
---

{6771, 0} The DCN-ID list consists of DCN-IDs stored together with a PLMN identity.
{6771, 1} The list can have zero or more entries and the maximum length shall be at least 32 entries.
{6771, 2} When the maximum length is reached any new entry shall replace the oldest entry in the list.
---

{6771, 0} The DCN-ID list consists of DCN-IDs stored together with a PLMN identity.
{6771, 1} The list can have zero or more entries and the maximum length shall be at least 32 entries.
{6771, 2} When the maximum length is reached any new entry shall replace the oldest entry in the list.
{6771, 3} There shall be no duplicated PLMN identities in the list and any existing DCN-ID shall be deleted when a new DCN-ID is added for the same PLMN.
---

{6772, 0} The DCN-ID list can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME; else the UE shall delete the DCN-ID list.
---

{6772, 0} The DCN-ID list can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME; else the UE shall delete the DCN-ID list.
{6772, 1} The UE shall delete the stored DCN-ID list if the default standardized DCN-ID in the UE is changed.
---

{6773, 0} Each network-assigned UE radio capability ID is stored together with a PLMN identity of the PLMN that provided it as well as a mapping to the corresponding UE radio configuration, and is valid in that PLMN.
---

{6773, 0} Each network-assigned UE radio capability ID is stored together with a PLMN identity of the PLMN that provided it as well as a mapping to the corresponding UE radio configuration, and is valid in that PLMN.
{6773, 1} A network-assigned UE radio capability ID can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME, else the UE shall delete the network-assigned UE radio capability ID.
---

{6773, 0} Each network-assigned UE radio capability ID is stored together with a PLMN identity of the PLMN that provided it as well as a mapping to the corresponding UE radio configuration, and is valid in that PLMN.
{6773, 1} A network-assigned UE radio capability ID can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME, else the UE shall delete the network-assigned UE radio capability ID.
{6773, 2} The UE shall be able to store at least the last 16 received network-assigned UE radio capability IDs.
---

{6773, 0} Each network-assigned UE radio capability ID is stored together with a PLMN identity of the PLMN that provided it as well as a mapping to the corresponding UE radio configuration, and is valid in that PLMN.
{6773, 1} A network-assigned UE radio capability ID can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME, else the UE shall delete the network-assigned UE radio capability ID.
{6773, 2} The UE shall be able to store at least the last 16 received network-assigned UE radio capability IDs.
{6773, 3} There shall be only one network-assigned UE radio capability ID stored for a given combination of PLMN identity and UE radio configuration and any existing UE radio capability ID shall be deleted when a new UE radio capability ID is added for the same combination of PLMN identity and UE radio configuration.
---

{6773, 0} Each network-assigned UE radio capability ID is stored together with a PLMN identity of the PLMN that provided it as well as a mapping to the corresponding UE radio configuration, and is valid in that PLMN.
{6773, 1} A network-assigned UE radio capability ID can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME, else the UE shall delete the network-assigned UE radio capability ID.
{6773, 2} The UE shall be able to store at least the last 16 received network-assigned UE radio capability IDs.
{6773, 3} There shall be only one network-assigned UE radio capability ID stored for a given combination of PLMN identity and UE radio configuration and any existing UE radio capability ID shall be deleted when a new UE radio capability ID is added for the same combination of PLMN identity and UE radio configuration.
{6773, 4} If the UE receives a network-assigned UE radio capability ID with a Version ID value different from the value included in the network-assigned UE radio capability ID stored at the UE for the serving PLMN, the UE may delete these stored network-assigned UE radio capability ID.
---

{6774, 0} If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory.
---

{6774, 0} If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory.
{6774, 1} Instead the UE shall temporarily store these parameters locally in the ME and the UE shall delete these parameters when the UE is detached.
---

{6775, 0} If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17], the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory.
---

{6775, 0} If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17], the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory.
{6775, 1} Instead the UE shall temporarily store these parameters locally in the ME and the UE shall delete these parameters when the UE enters EMM-DEREGISTERED.eCALL-INACTIVE state, the UE is switched-off or the USIM is removed.
---

{6776, 0} If the UE is attached for access to RLOS, the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory.
---

{6776, 0} If the UE is attached for access to RLOS, the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory.
{6776, 1} Instead, the UE shall temporarily store these parameters locally in the ME and the UE shall delete these parameters after detach.
---

{6779, 0} When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection, or when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection, the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall be selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1.
---

{6779, 0} When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection, or when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection, the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall be selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 1} The EMM shall also indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control, the call type associated with the RRC establishment cause as specified in table D.1.1.
---

{6779, 0} When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection, or when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection, the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall be selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 1} The EMM shall also indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control, the call type associated with the RRC establishment cause as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 2} If the UE is configured for EAB, the EMM shall indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control that EAB applies for this request except for the following cases:
{6780, 0} the UE is a UE configured to use AC11 – 15 in selected PLMN;
---

{6779, 0} When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection, or when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection, the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall be selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 1} The EMM shall also indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control, the call type associated with the RRC establishment cause as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 2} If the UE is configured for EAB, the EMM shall indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control that EAB applies for this request except for the following cases:
{6781, 0} the UE is answering to paging;
---

{6779, 0} When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection, or when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection, the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall be selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 1} The EMM shall also indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control, the call type associated with the RRC establishment cause as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 2} If the UE is configured for EAB, the EMM shall indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control that EAB applies for this request except for the following cases:
{6782, 0} the RRC Establishment cause is set to "Emergency call";
---

{6779, 0} When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection, or when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection, the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall be selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 1} The EMM shall also indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control, the call type associated with the RRC establishment cause as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 2} If the UE is configured for EAB, the EMM shall indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control that EAB applies for this request except for the following cases:
{6783, 0} the UE is configured to allow overriding EAB and receives an indication from the upper layers to override EAB;
---

{6779, 0} When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection, or when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection, the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall be selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 1} The EMM shall also indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control, the call type associated with the RRC establishment cause as specified in table D.1.1.
{6779, 2} If the UE is configured for EAB, the EMM shall indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control that EAB applies for this request except for the following cases:
{6784, 0} the UE is configured to allow overriding EAB and already has a PDN connection that was established with EAB override.
---

{6786, 0} The UE uses the information elements MS network capability and UE network capability to inform the core network about its network related capabilities.
---

{6786, 0} The UE uses the information elements MS network capability and UE network capability to inform the core network about its network related capabilities.
{6786, 1} Both information elements can be signalled in any of the modes: A/Gb mode, Iu mode and S1 mode.
---

{6787, 0} The purpose of the present annex is to give some guidelines how to select the information element to be enhanced if new capabilities need to be added.
---

{6787, 0} The purpose of the present annex is to give some guidelines how to select the information element to be enhanced if new capabilities need to be added.
{6788, 0} If a capability is related to a feature that can be used in a network supporting A/Gb mode only or Iu mode only or both, the capability will be signalled in the MS network capability IE.
---

{6787, 0} The purpose of the present annex is to give some guidelines how to select the information element to be enhanced if new capabilities need to be added.
{6789, 0} If a capability is related to a feature that can be used in network supporting S1 mode only, the capability will be signalled in the UE network capability IE.
---

{6787, 0} The purpose of the present annex is to give some guidelines how to select the information element to be enhanced if new capabilities need to be added.
{6790, 0} If a capability is related to a feature that can be used only in a network supporting both S1 mode and at least one of the two modes A/Gb mode and Iu mode, the capability is added only to one of the two information elements:
{6791, 0} If the information is used by the MME only, the capability will be signalled in the UE network capability IE.
---

{6787, 0} The purpose of the present annex is to give some guidelines how to select the information element to be enhanced if new capabilities need to be added.
{6790, 0} If a capability is related to a feature that can be used only in a network supporting both S1 mode and at least one of the two modes A/Gb mode and Iu mode, the capability is added only to one of the two information elements:
{6792, 0} If the information is used by the SGSN only or both by the SGSN and by the MME, the capability will be signalled in the MS network capability IE.
---

{6794, 0} The UE may support the procedures in this annex.
---

{6795, 0} If the UE supports ACDC, the EMM layer shall determine the ACDC category applicable to the request based on the application identifier received from the upper layers and the configuration information in the "ACDCConf" leaf of ACDC MO as specified in 3GPP TS 24.105 [35] or in the USIM EFACDC as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17].
---

{6796, 0} The EMM sublayer shall indicate to the lower layers, for the purpose of access control, the ACDC category that applies to this request if only one ACDC category is applicable;
---

{6796, 0} The EMM sublayer shall indicate to the lower layers, for the purpose of access control, the highest ranked ACDC category among the ACDC categories that applies to this request if multiple ACDC categories are applicable;
---

{6796, 0} The EMM sublayer shall indicate to the lower layers, for the purpose of access control, this request is for an uncategorized application if an application identifier received from the upper layers is not mapped to any ACDC category,
---

{6800, 0} except for the following cases:
{6801, 0} the UE is a UE configured to use AC11 – 15 in selected PLMN;
---

{6800, 0} except for the following cases:
{6802, 0} the UE is answering to paging;
---

{6800, 0} except for the following cases:
{6803, 0} the RRC Establishment cause is set to "Emergency call";
---

{6800, 0} except for the following cases:
{6804, 0} if conditions MO MMTEL voice call is started or MO MMTEL video call is started or MO SMSoIP is started, is satisfied.
---

{6805, 0} If the UE supports ACDC and access is barred because of ACDC, the EMM layer shall keep track of the ACDC category for which access is barred and it shall not send a request for the same ACDC category or a lower ACDC category until access is granted.
---

{6806, 0} If the UE supports ACDC and access is barred because of ACDC, the EMM layer shall not send a request for any uncategorized application until access is granted.
---
